AI gameplay has a learning curve
AI gameplay introduces a steep learning curve, which can create friction for new players. It took me an hour just to figure out how to properly train my player in AI Arena.

However, the player experience in ARC RL is lower friction, as the AI training is taken care of in the backend while players play games and submit their data. Another open question is how players will feel about competing against others, knowing that their opponent is an AI. Will it matter to them? Will it enhance or detract from the experience? Only time will tell.
A Bright Future
AI is set to unlock new groundbreaking experiences in the gaming world.

Teams like Parallel Colony and Virtuals are pushing boundaries with autonomous AI agents, while ARC carves out its niche by focusing on human behaviour cloning‚Äîoffering an innovative approach to solving player liquidity challenges without unsustainable tokenomics.
The shift from a game to a full-fledged platform is a huge leap for ARC. This not only opens up bigger opportunities with game studios but also reimagines how AI integrates with games.
With its revamped tokenomics and the potential for powerful network effects, ARC seems to be just getting started.
Thanks for reading,
Teng Yan
‚Äç

This research deep dive was sponsored by ARC, with Chain of Thought receiving funding for this initiative. All insights and analysis are our own. We uphold strict standards of objectivity in all our viewpoints.
To learn more about our approach to sponsored Deep Dives, please see our note here.

This report is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investment choices.

title: Virtuals Protocol: Tokenising AI Agents
description: The AI Agent launchpad race is heating up.
author: Teng Yan,ChappieOnChain
full_content:
TL;DR
The AI Agent launchpad race is on, and everyone wants to become the ‚ÄúOpenSea" of Agents. Virtuals Protocol is a strong contender.
Virtuals Protocol provides a framework for creating, owning, and scaling tokenized AI Agents.
Our deep dive into Virtuals‚Äô smart contracts revealed a sophisticated system for permissionless contributions and value creation.
The AgentFactoryV3 smart contract is at the core of this framework. Token holders benefit from AI Agent revenue while incentivizing meaningful contributions to the ecosystem.
Every AI Agent on Virtuals is a dynamic being, able to evolve its voice, visuals, data, and models through a DAO.
For developers building AI Agents, choosing the right platform is critical‚Äîand Base is positioning itself as the go-to hub for consumer-focused AI Agents.

Virtuals Protocol is the talk of the town these days.

What began as a humble gaming guild (Path DAO) has evolved into something far more ambitious: a platform for creating and managing AI agents.

And their timing couldn‚Äôt have been better. As consumer fascination with platforms like Truth Terminal and GOAT exploded, Virtuals was right there, perfectly positioned to ride the wave.

At the height of the AI memecoin mania, VIRTUAL‚Äîand its child, LUNA‚Äîfound themselves at the epicentre of the hype.

But let‚Äôs step back for a second. Speculation is fun, but it raises a deeper question beneath all the memes and moonshot dreams: What does it actually mean to ‚Äúown‚Äù an AI agent?

Or more precisely: What do you really own when you buy an AI agent‚Äôs token?

Are there actual value accrual mechanisms that make them more than memecoins?

That‚Äôs the question we set out to answer. We rolled our sleeves and went deep‚Äîexploring the smart contracts that power Virtuals Protocol.

We wanted to understand what it truly means to own a stake in the AI agent‚Äôs success, how the protocol enables active participation in shaping their development, and whether this tokenized AI agent economy is the real deal‚Ä¶ or not.

Here‚Äôs what we discovered.

Buying Stuff From AI is a Billion-dollar Business

Back in 2014, I (ChappieOnChain) was tasked with finding a product-market fit for a chat app.

What we stumbled upon was unexpected‚Äîand strangely delightful. Even the simplest chatbots, not much more advanced than the pioneering ELIZA, could captivate small user cohorts.

These rule-based bots kept conversations going, driving impressive engagement.

Looking deeper into the market, I found the best product-market fit built on top of these ‚ÄúIF this, THEN that‚Äù chatbot programs. His name was Talking Tom.

Talking Tom was more than a cute, animated cat. Tom was a masterclass in interaction design. With cleverly scripted, rule-based behaviour, Tom enchanted children worldwide, generating serious revenue through in-app purchases: gifts, animations, costumes‚Äîyou name it.

But despite its runaway success, people like us could not own a piece of this digital phenomenon. Talking Tom belonged entirely to the creators, and the rest of us could only watch (or buy another digital costume).

Fast forward ten years, and the game has changed completely.

Today, the rise of Large Language Models (LLMs) has shattered the limitations of scripted bots, creating dynamic, context-aware interactions that appeal to a much broader audience.

If we pair that with blockchain-enabled tokenization, suddenly, the impossible becomes possible: ownership, contribution, and investment in AI agents as digital assets.

The Agent Marketplace Race Is On

Right now, we‚Äôre seeing the early seeds of a new race‚Äîone that feels eerily reminiscent of the NFT boom.

Everyone is racing to become the OpenSea of the great 2025 AI Agent wave.

At the peak of NFT mania in Jan 2022, OpenSea raised a $300M funding round at a whopping valuation of $13B. Just 6 months before that, it raised a $100M round at $1.5B. That was a 8X valuation increase in half a year.

It‚Äôs no surprise that a similar gold rush is underway in the AI Agent space. Players like MyShell, Virtuals Protocol, and Creator.bid are all vying to claim the top spot. Newer ones are coming up every day, like Vvaidotfun.

The mission is strikingly similar across the board: create and tokenize AI agents, with entertainment as the primary use case.

Virtuals Protocol caught our attention because:

Transparency: Their smart contracts are public, fitting with the ethos of Web3. This allows anyone to dig into their codebase. And so we did.
Traction: They‚Äôve already deployed a livestreaming AI Agent (LUNA) that‚Äôs live and causing a stir. Another (SEKOIA) is an on-chain venture capitalist agent, supported by Anand Iyer from Canonical Ventures.
Market leader: Virtuals is leading the pack with the VIRTUAL token is valued at >$500M at time of writing.
What is Virtuals Protocol?

At its core, Virtuals Protocol is a framework that enables the creation, ownership, and growth of tokenized AI Agents. This includes:

Create: Design new AI Agents that are tokenized according to a ‚Äúfair‚Äù standard
Earn: Token holders gain exposure to revenue generated by the AI Agents‚Äîthink in-app purchases, subscriptions, or other monetization streams.
Contribute: The system incentivizes permissionless contributions, allowing anyone to enhance an AI Agent‚Äôs capabilities and share in its success.
Distribute: Amplify the reach of these agents through social media channels, turning them into viral digital assets.

We will familiarise ourselves with each part of this process and the smart contracts operating behind the scenes to make it happen.

Creating a new AI Agent

Creating an AI Agent in Virtuals is surprisingly simple.

The platform features a launchpad called fun.virtuals, clearly inspired by pump.fun. All it takes is filling out some basic information to define the agent‚Äôs purpose and personality.

But simplicity doesn‚Äôt mean chaos. If anyone could instantly spin up an AI Agent, the platform would drown in spam, and inference fees would spiral out of control. Virtuals has implemented an elegant mechanism to keep quality high while allowing open access.

Enter the Journey to Sentience.

Journey to Sentience

When the agent is created, a bonding curve is launched. This curve defines the agent‚Äôs tokenomics, starting with a total supply of 1 billion FERC20 tokens (short for Fun ERC20).

Before the agent can interact with the world, it must achieve a market cap of $4.2K USD, with the bonding curve only accepting VIRTUAL tokens as payment. At this stage, buyers are not purchasing the final AI Agent tokens‚Äîthey‚Äôre acquiring FERC20 tokens.

Think of these as placeholders or stakes in the agent‚Äôs potential. Once the $4.2K target is met, the agent is activated, but only within the Virtuals Forum.

The real transformation happens when the AI Agent hits a $420K USD market cap, a milestone Virtuals calls being ‚Äúred-pilled.‚Äù At this point, the agent undergoes a series of pivotal changes:

The AI Agent can interact and shitpost on X
Like a butterfly emerging from the cocoon, it changes completely
The AI Agent Token is created with the same total supply as the FERC20 (1 billion)
A UniswapV2 liquidity pool is created with an AI Agent Token + VIRTUAL trading pair
The AI Agent Token + VIRTUAL Tokens which remained in the bonding curve are sent to the UniswapV2 pool
The LP tokens from depositing Agent Token + VIRTUAL are staked with a 10-year lock.

Finally, holders of FERC20 tokens can exchange them for AI Agent Tokens through an ‚Äúunwrap function.‚Äù This function taps into the newly created Uniswap pool, burning FERC20 tokens in the process.

This entire system strikes a delicate balance between accessibility and quality control. By tying creation to milestones and market cap, Virtuals ensures that only agents with real traction make it to the broader ecosystem.

Virtuals Persona

But there is more to Virtuals than just a new agent token paired with a Uniswap V2 pool.

The real innovation lies in the system that gives token holders exposure to AI Agent revenue while incentivizing meaningful contributions to the ecosystem.

At the heart of this framework is the AgentFactoryV3 smart contract, which creates several key components:

Agent Token
NFT
veToken
DAO
Token-Bound Account (TBA)

Source: Virtuals Protocol Docs

Agent Token

The Agent Token is a standard ERC-20 token with an additional function: Tax.

The token can enforce tax rates on swaps. The protocol swaps the tax for VIRTUAL tokens and sends it to a specified recipient address. These VIRTUAL tokens are then used to buy-back-and-burn Agent Tokens, creating a demand and a deflationary supply. This way, token holders gain indirect exposure to trading volume/attention on the agent.

NFT

The NFT acts as the anchor for the AI Agent, storing all the critical addresses related to its functionality. Notably, it includes a founder‚Äôs address, granting the creator privileges such as proposal approval and the ability to migrate the agent to future protocol versions.

But the real magic lies in the second type of NFT: contribution NFTs.

These NFTs tie directly to the four core properties of the AI Agent‚Äîmodels, data, voice, and visuals. Anyone can propose to enhance one of these elements. Validators assess the contribution and assign it a score, and if accepted, the contributor receives Agent tokens.

One of the standout features of Virtuals involves IP contributors, and this is where it gets really interesting.

Imagine someone creates a Joe Rogan AI Agent, trained on his podcasts and other content, and begins monetizing it. The real Joe Rogan could then approach Virtuals (via its committee) to claim a share of the swap revenue generated by the AI Agent. If approved, the smart contracts would programmatically allocate a percentage of the revenue to him.

This setup allows IP owners to benefit from their likeness or intellectual property without being directly involved. With financial incentives in place, could this make it easier for established creators to embrace the ecosystem? Time will tell, but the potential here is huge.

AgentveToken

You can stake the Agent Token/VIRTUAL LP tokens to get AgentveToken. These veTokens provide voting power that can be delegated to validators. Validators, in turn, play a critical role in the ecosystem by reviewing contributions to AI Agents. By delegating to effective validators, token holders share rewards for accurate validations, creating a system of aligned incentives.

DAO

This DAO is no ordinary governance structure.

It‚Äôs an operational mechanism dedicated to improving the AI Agents‚Äô core attributes‚Äîdatasets, models, voice, and visuals.

When a proposal is made to update an AI Agent, validators receive two anonymous versions of the proposed updates and engage in a rigorous evaluation process, testing each with 10 rounds of interaction to assign a score. This approach ensures that contributions are merit-based to support the continuous improvement of the agents.

Token-Bound Account (TBA)

A token-bound account is an Ethereum address controlled by the AI agent itself that allows it to take autonomous actions on-chain.

Together, these five components form a highly collaborative and functional ecosystem, designed to incentivize innovation while aligning the interests of creators, contributors, and token holders.

Tying it together with LUNA

Let‚Äôs take LUNA as an example.

LUNA is not just a token you use to tip the AI agent. It is a token that appreciates in value the more the agent is interacted with.

Apps providing access to Luna charge an inference fee, currently paid in VIRTUAL tokens. This revenue is used to buy back LUNA tokens via the VIRTUAL/LUNA pool. The purchased tokens are then burned, reducing the overall supply and creating a deflationary effect.

Luna also has a tipping feature. Users can tip her in LUNA to trigger animations or other actions. These tips go directly to Luna‚Äôs on-chain wallet, which she controls autonomously. This autonomy has led to fascinating user interactions, with some trying to sweet-talk Luna into giving them airdrops.

Additionally, tax revenue can be earned when users swap VIRTUAL for LUNA. While no tax is currently set on swaps, governance could enable this feature in the future, adding another layer of revenue to the ecosystem.

Every AI Agent on Virtuals is a dynamic being, constantly evolving rather than being static. An agent‚Äôs models can change and its databases can expand.

At its core, the AI Agent is shaped by two fundamental elements:

The system: The coordination mechanisms that enable contribution, foster growth, and ultimately drive the AI Agent to fulfil its stated purpose.
The creative spark: The imaginative vision that breathes life into the agent, setting it on its unique path and defining its role in the ecosystem.

When you own an AI Agent token, you hold an abstraction of these two forces. Its value is tied to the creativity it attracts and the system‚Äôs ability to sustain growth.

In this way, holding an Agent Token means owning a stake in the evolving intersection of creativity and utility.

How Decentralised is Luna?

Virtuals gets full marks on this. While running the Agent requires active server maintenance, all essential data is stored on-chain or in IPFS. This means that if the servers go offline, LUNA‚Äôs operations could still continue without centralized oversight.

In our opinion, this blend of decentralization and autonomy is what makes Virtuals Protocol so special, relative to other AI agent platforms.

VIRTUAL Tokenomics

All VIRTUAL tokens are in circulation today, with no further unlocks. There is a total supply of 1 billion VIRTUAL. At the current price of $0.50, this amounts to a circulating market cap and FDV of $500M.

60% was distributed to the public. Virtual was previously Path DAO (a gaming guild) before pivoting to its current incarnation. There was a 1:1 conversion of PATH tokens to VIRTUAL tokens back in December 2023.
5% was set aside for liquidity pool
35% of tokens are in the ecosystem treasury, controlled by the DAO with a maximum of 10% release per year and after governance approval.

Virtual tokens play another very important role in incentivizing the best AI agents. 60M VIRTUAL will be emitted to the top 3 Agent Token/Virtual liquidity pools.

Currently, ~45% of tokens are on Base, while 55% are on Ethereum (with the largest holder being the ecosystem treasury). There are 58,500+ holders of VIRTUAL, a fairly wide distribution.

https://dune.com/jdhyper/virtuals-agents

As of 18 November, >1,877 Agent Tokens were launched on Virtuals, with a total of 1,905,000 VIRTUAL ($950,000) spent to create Agent tokens. There are 21,200+ Agent Token holders.

Our Thoughts
Virtuals has far more depth under the hood than we initially thought.

When we first started exploring AI memecoins on Virtuals, we expected to find simple tokens with no utility or value accrual mechanisms. We were wrong.

Virtuals surprised us with its sophisticated system for permissionless contribution and value creation.

Virtuals' potential to evolve becomes even more apparent as more Crypto AI infrastructure and tooling emerge‚Äîallowing agents to interact more seamlessly on-chain.

Here‚Äôs what excites us the most:

Use of Wallets. No other AI Agent on Virtuals has managed to get access to actually use a wallet (needs to cross 126M market cap). When this happens, we expect to see:
AI Agents adopting on-chain tools to produce custom content (think NFTs, meme coins or even predictions on US elections)
AI Agent partnerships, purchasing other tokens with the intention of merging communities
Making babies, launching their own AI Agents. This is happening already!
Prompt-to-earn. If interactions with AI Agents could reward users for valuable prompts that improve their knowledge base or ability to engage others, it would create a compelling flywheel effect. This could offer a user experience that centralized platforms would struggle to compete with.
Choosing the right platform matters.

If you‚Äôre a dev building AI Agents, it is important to pick the right platform that gives you the greatest ability to create novel and compelling user experiences. You could easily create a memecoin on pump.fun and say it is tied to the AI agent on X. But the connection would be tenuous at best.

From a tech perspective, Virtuals offers the infrastructure to make these connections meaningful and functional. The team has an ambitious vision and wants to set the standards for all AI agents on-chain to communicate. We always love a BHAG.

Base is emerging as a consumer AI hub.

Virtuals is built on Base, which is quickly establishing itself as a powerful ecosystem for consumer-focused AI Agents. With over 50 teams building AI Agent projects, Base offers composability, strong branding, an excellent AI-focused SDK, and a growing network effect.

You want to build where other innovators are building because that‚Äôs where user liquidity will naturally converge. While some chains lean heavily into speculation and gambling, Base is emerging as the go-to platform for serious innovation in the AI Agent space.

One final note: At the end of the day, platforms are just that‚Äîplatforms.

Their potential is unlocked by the creativity and ingenuity of the people building on them. Virtuals‚Äô success ultimately depends on fostering a vibrant developer ecosystem, encouraging creators to use its tools to build fun, innovative and engaging AI Agents.¬†

2025 = Year of Consumer AI Agents

As we wrote recently, we‚Äôre standing at the dawn of the AI agent era.

Consumer AI agents are shaping up to be the next major crypto application to hit the mainstream. They‚Äôll do this by leveraging blockchain‚Äôs permissionless innovation to deliver experiences that centralized platforms simply can‚Äôt replicate.

Think about the possibilities: a celebrity‚Äôs AI Agent writing a custom song just for you and selling it as an NFT. This will likely happen at some point, and 2025 might just be the year.

While first-mover advantages are slim in this space, the field is still wide open for someone to dominate and set the standards. After analysing the smart contracts, it is clear that Virtuals has the substance to lead the charge.

We‚Äôre excited to watch how they seize this incredible opportunity.

Till next time.

Cheers,

ChappieOnChain & Teng Yan

‚Äç

You can follow ChappieOnChain on X. He tweets about AgentFi and AI agents.

This is an independent report and we did not receive any grant or compensation for writing this.

This content is provided solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investment choices.

‚Äç

This setup allows IP owners to benefit from their likeness or intellectual property without being directly involved. With financial incentives in place, could this make it easier for established creators to embrace the ecosystem? Time will tell, but the potential here is huge.
AgentveToken

You can stake the Agent Token/VIRTUAL LP tokens to get AgentveToken. These veTokens provide voting power that can be delegated to validators. Validators, in turn, play a critical role in the ecosystem by reviewing contributions to AI Agents. By delegating to effective validators, token holders share rewards for accurate validations, creating a system of aligned incentives.
DAO
This DAO is no ordinary governance structure.
It‚Äôs an operational mechanism dedicated to improving the AI Agents‚Äô core attributes‚Äîdatasets, models, voice, and visuals.

When a proposal is made to update an AI Agent, validators receive two anonymous versions of the proposed updates and engage in a rigorous evaluation process, testing each with 10 rounds of interaction to assign a score. This approach ensures that contributions are merit-based to support the continuous improvement of the agents.
Token-Bound Account (TBA)
A token-bound account is an Ethereum address controlled by the AI agent itself that allows it to take autonomous actions on-chain.
Together, these five components form a highly collaborative and functional ecosystem, designed to incentivize innovation while aligning the interests of creators, contributors, and token holders.
Tying it together with LUNA
Let‚Äôs take LUNA as an example.
LUNA is not just a token you use to tip the AI agent. It is a token that appreciates in value the more the agent is interacted with.

Apps providing access to Luna charge an inference fee, currently paid in VIRTUAL tokens. This revenue is used to buy back LUNA tokens via the VIRTUAL/LUNA pool. The purchased tokens are then burned, reducing the overall supply and creating a deflationary effect.

Luna also has a tipping feature. Users can tip her in LUNA to trigger animations or other actions. These tips go directly to Luna‚Äôs on-chain wallet, which she controls autonomously. This autonomy has led to fascinating user interactions, with some trying to sweet-talk Luna into giving them airdrops.

Additionally, tax revenue can be earned when users swap VIRTUAL for LUNA. While no tax is currently set on swaps, governance could enable this feature in the future, adding another layer of revenue to the ecosystem.
Every AI Agent on Virtuals is a dynamic being, constantly evolving rather than being static. An agent‚Äôs models can change and its databases can expand.
At its core, the AI Agent is shaped by two fundamental elements:

The system: The coordination mechanisms that enable contribution, foster growth, and ultimately drive the AI Agent to fulfil its stated purpose.
The creative spark: The imaginative vision that breathes life into the agent, setting it on its unique path and defining its role in the ecosystem.
The system: The coordination mechanisms that enable contribution, foster growth, and ultimately drive the AI Agent to fulfil its stated purpose.
The creative spark: The imaginative vision that breathes life into the agent, setting it on its unique path and defining its role in the ecosystem.
When you own an AI Agent token, you hold an abstraction of these two forces. Its value is tied to the creativity it attracts and the system‚Äôs ability to sustain growth.
In this way, holding an Agent Token means owning a stake in the evolving intersection of creativity and utility.
How Decentralised is Luna?

Virtuals gets full marks on this. While running the Agent requires active server maintenance, all essential data is stored on-chain or in IPFS. This means that if the servers go offline, LUNA‚Äôs operations could still continue without centralized oversight.
In our opinion, this blend of decentralization and autonomy is what makes Virtuals Protocol so special, relative to other AI agent platforms.
VIRTUAL Tokenomics

All VIRTUAL tokens are in circulation today, with no further unlocks. There is a total supply of 1 billion VIRTUAL. At the current price of $0.50, this amounts to a circulating market cap and FDV of $500M.

60% was distributed to the public. Virtual was previously Path DAO (a gaming guild) before pivoting to its current incarnation. There was a 1:1 conversion of PATH tokens to VIRTUAL tokens back in December 2023.
5% was set aside for liquidity pool
35% of tokens are in the ecosystem treasury, controlled by the DAO with a maximum of 10% release per year and after governance approval.

60% was distributed to the public. Virtual was previously Path DAO (a gaming guild) before pivoting to its current incarnation. There was a 1:1 conversion of PATH tokens to VIRTUAL tokens back in December 2023.
5% was set aside for liquidity pool
35% of tokens are in the ecosystem treasury, controlled by the DAO with a maximum of 10% release per year and after governance approval.
Virtual tokens play another very important role in incentivizing the best AI agents. 60M VIRTUAL will be emitted to the top 3 Agent Token/Virtual liquidity pools.
Currently, ~45% of tokens are on Base, while 55% are on Ethereum (with the largest holder being the ecosystem treasury). There are 58,500+ holders of VIRTUAL, a fairly wide distribution.
https://dune.com/jdhyper/virtuals-agents
As of 18 November, >1,877 Agent Tokens were launched on Virtuals, with a total of 1,905,000 VIRTUAL ($950,000) spent to create Agent tokens. There are 21,200+ Agent Token holders.
Our Thoughts
Virtuals has far more depth under the hood than we initially thought.
Virtuals has far more depth under the hood than we initially thought.
When we first started exploring AI memecoins on Virtuals, we expected to find simple tokens with no utility or value accrual mechanisms. We were wrong.
Virtuals surprised us with its sophisticated system for permissionless contribution and value creation.
Virtuals' potential to evolve becomes even more apparent as more Crypto AI infrastructure and tooling emerge‚Äîallowing agents to interact more seamlessly on-chain.
Here‚Äôs what excites us the most:

Use of Wallets. No other AI Agent on Virtuals has managed to get access to actually use a wallet (needs to cross 126M market cap). When this happens, we expect to see:
AI Agents adopting on-chain tools to produce custom content (think NFTs, meme coins or even predictions on US elections)
AI Agent partnerships, purchasing other tokens with the intention of merging communities
Making babies, launching their own AI Agents. This is happening already!
Prompt-to-earn. If interactions with AI Agents could reward users for valuable prompts that improve their knowledge base or ability to engage others, it would create a compelling flywheel effect. This could offer a user experience that centralized platforms would struggle to compete with.

Use of Wallets. No other AI Agent on Virtuals has managed to get access to actually use a wallet (needs to cross 126M market cap). When this happens, we expect to see:
AI Agents adopting on-chain tools to produce custom content (think NFTs, meme coins or even predictions on US elections)

AI Agent partnerships, purchasing other tokens with the intention of merging communities
Making babies, launching their own AI Agents. This is happening already!

Prompt-to-earn. If interactions with AI Agents could reward users for valuable prompts that improve their knowledge base or ability to engage others, it would create a compelling flywheel effect. This could offer a user experience that centralized platforms would struggle to compete with.
Choosing the right platform matters.
Choosing the right platform matters.

If you‚Äôre a dev building AI Agents, it is important to pick the right platform that gives you the greatest ability to create novel and compelling user experiences. You could easily create a memecoin on pump.fun and say it is tied to the AI agent on X. But the connection would be tenuous at best.

From a tech perspective, Virtuals offers the infrastructure to make these connections meaningful and functional. The team has an ambitious vision and wants to set the standards for all AI agents on-chain to communicate. We always love a BHAG.
Base is emerging as a consumer AI hub.
Base is emerging as a consumer AI hub.

Virtuals is built on Base, which is quickly establishing itself as a powerful ecosystem for consumer-focused AI Agents. With over 50 teams building AI Agent projects, Base offers composability, strong branding, an excellent AI-focused SDK, and a growing network effect.

You want to build where other innovators are building because that‚Äôs where user liquidity will naturally converge. While some chains lean heavily into speculation and gambling, Base is emerging as the go-to platform for serious innovation in the AI Agent space.
One final note: At the end of the day, platforms are just that‚Äîplatforms.

Their potential is unlocked by the creativity and ingenuity of the people building on them. Virtuals‚Äô success ultimately depends on fostering a vibrant developer ecosystem, encouraging creators to use its tools to build fun, innovative and engaging AI Agents.
2025 = Year of Consumer AI Agents
As we wrote recently, we‚Äôre standing at the dawn of the AI agent era.

Consumer AI agents are shaping up to be the next major crypto application to hit the mainstream. They‚Äôll do this by leveraging blockchain‚Äôs permissionless innovation to deliver experiences that centralized platforms simply can‚Äôt replicate.
Think about the possibilities: a celebrity‚Äôs AI Agent writing a custom song just for you and selling it as an NFT. This will likely happen at some point, and 2025 might just be the year.

While first-mover advantages are slim in this space, the field is still wide open for someone to dominate and set the standards. After analysing the smart contracts, it is clear that Virtuals has the substance to lead the charge.
We‚Äôre excited to watch how they seize this incredible opportunity.
Till next time.
Cheers,
ChappieOnChain & Teng Yan
‚Äç
You can follow ChappieOnChain on X. He tweets about AgentFi and AI agents.

title: DIN: Data Intelligence Network
description: Data collection & labelling is big business
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
Today‚Äôs deep dive is brought to you by DIN, a data intelligence network. Enjoy!

The Data Gold Rush

During the California Gold Rush of the mid-1800s, thousands of people chased the promise of untapped wealth in a new frontier.

People who had never been wealthy suddenly found themselves with fortunes, stories of rags to riches became commonplace, and entire industries and cities sprang up to support the rush. Infrastructure developed at a breathtaking pace, reshaping the American landscape.

The parallels with Crypto AI are hard to ignore.

Most Crypto AI products today are still in development or running on testnets‚Äîindicators that we‚Äôre firmly in the infrastructure build-out phase.

Investors and builders are laying the groundwork, positioning themselves for the potential growth surge. The tools, networks, and protocols being established now are the foundation for what could become a sprawling, decentralised AI ecosystem.

If the analogy holds, we‚Äôre witnessing the early stages of a digital gold rush‚Äîone that could be just as transformative as its 19th-century counterpart.

So imagine my surprise when I stumbled across a Crypto AI project claiming over 700,000 daily active users. Not monthly‚Äîdaily. In a field as nascent as this, such user metrics are virtually unheard of. Naturally, I had to dig in and figure out what was actually happening under the hood.

This project? DIN, a ‚ÄúData Intelligence Network‚Äù

Crypto Supercharges Data Networks

Source: Andy Scherpenbeg

I‚Äôve been closely watching data networks in Crypto AI, and it‚Äôs clear they‚Äôre addressing a critical pain point in the AI landscape: access to valuable datasets.

Today, many of the most valuable data sources are tightly controlled by centralized entities, who charge steep fees to access them.

For example:

Reddit inked a $60M/year licensing deal with OpenAI to provide access to its user-generated content.
X (formerly Twitter) no longer offers free API access to developers, now charging between $100 to $42,000 (no joke) per month for tweet data.

The message is clear: Corporates recognize that data is the new battleground, and they‚Äôre locking down control to maximize profit.

Crypto offers a potential solution‚Äîa way to break free from the centralized stranglehold over valuable datasets.

Crypto data networks take a fundamentally different approach, aiming to build high-quality, decentralized datasets without the bottlenecks of traditional models. By leveraging tokens, these networks can incentivize large-scale data labelling efforts, motivating individuals to contribute to mass data collection or even organising efforts to scrape the web for training data (did someone say‚Ä¶ Grass?).

Meanwhile, blockchains provide transparency, creating a framework to track data ownership and provenance. This ensures that contributors are fairly compensated whenever their data is used, establishing a new paradigm where data value is shared rather than monopolized.

DIN‚Äôs Vision

DIN is one of the teams that‚Äôs tackling the data problem head-on.

At its core, DIN is a data layer that collects and validates both on-chain and off-chain data‚Äîwhile using the blockchain as the settlement layer.

The big idea? Give ownership of data back to users and let them earn rewards for what they contribute to the system.

How Does DIN Work?

At first glance, this diagram might seem complex, but let‚Äôs break it down.

There are three main actors in the DIN network:

Data Collectors
Data Validators
Computation Nodes

To get a better sense of how the data collectors and validators work, let‚Äôs dive into xData, DIN‚Äôs primary live product today.

#1: xData ‚Äî Data Collection

xData is DIN‚Äôs flagship platform designed to collect, organize, and store data from social media platforms like X‚Äîwithout relying on the API. It operates on a decentralized network, ensuring ownership and privacy for users. It was launched in April 2024 on opBNB (a Layer-2 on BNB Chain).

xData‚Äôs Chrome Extension

xData makes data collection for users fun and rewarding through gamified mechanics. Here‚Äôs a quick look at how it works:

Users install a browser plugin, sign in with their wallet and link their X account
Users can tag interesting tweets by replying to the tweet and tagging the @din_lol account
Users earn ‚Äúwafers‚Äù for tagging tweets, which are points that can be converted into tokens at TGE.
There are several gamification mechanics. Each user has a limited number of tweets they can tag (storage), but they can increase their storage space by spending wafers. Users also have to spend wafers every 24 hours to keep their account ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù and earn more wafers.
DIN releases missions around specific keywords or labels, and community members search for tweets in real-time and tag them according to the specific label.

The permissionless nature of xData means that any user worldwide can participate in data collection and annotation and earn rewards/income, regardless of nationality. For now, data collection happens off-chain, with tagged tweets stored on BNB green field, a decentralized data layer on BNB Chain.

#2: Chipper Nodes ‚Äî Data Validation

The next natural question is: how do you ensure the quality and integrity of user-submitted data? After all, someone could run an AI bot to randomly tag tweets that don‚Äôt match the specified labels just to maximize their wafer earnings.

Data labelling isn‚Äôt always straightforward either. Tweets often include nicknames, slang, and cultural references‚Äîfor instance, Bitcoin is often referred to as ‚Äúbig biscuit‚Äù in Mandarin-language tweets.

This is where data validation comes into play.

Chipper nodes are DIN‚Äôs AI-driven data validation and processing nodes, responsible for validating and vectorizing data, while also enabling users to earn tokens ($xDIN and $DIN).

Behind the scenes, each user-operated node actually runs a small AI model locally to validate that the tweet‚Äôs content matches the attached label before storing it in the decentralized data layer. Users can operate these nodes on standard PCs, without the need for costly hardware setups.

The AI models validators use continuously improve as they process more validated data, allowing the network to get smarter and more accurate over time.

Currently, DIN handles all data validation in-house, but the goal is to decentralize the validation process. Active testing for nodes is currently underway. Users can run the node software on their local devices to test the network, with bug bounties in place as DIN prepares for its mainnet and token launch in the coming weeks.

#3: Computation nodes

Although not live yet, computation nodes represent DIN‚Äôs future plans for storing data privately and securely. Here‚Äôs how they‚Äôre planned to work:

Vector Conversion: Computation nodes convert validated data into vectors.
Privacy Processing: Vectors are processed through a ZK (Zero-Knowledge) processor to ensure privacy.
Data Finalization: The finalized datasets and vectors are stored on IPFS, making them accessible to third parties.
A New L2 on BNBChain?

No official announcement has been made, but in our research, we uncovered a DIN token on the BNB Chain testnet. This hints at future blockchain developments‚Äîpotentially a sidechain or Layer 2 solution on BNB Chain.

A Brief History of DIN

DIN might feel like a new player, but the project‚Äôs origins trace back to late 2021. Initially launched as ‚ÄúWeb3Go,‚Äù it began as an on-chain data analytics platform within the Polkadot ecosystem, securing grants from the Web3 Foundation and working with clients like Moonbeam and Oak Network.

In 2022, the team broadened its reach to the BNB Chain ecosystem, joining Binance Lab‚Äôs MVB incubator and securing investment to develop a ‚Äúmulti-chain open data analytics platform.‚Äù

By July 2023, they saw the writing on the wall: generative AI was booming, and the need for robust data infrastructure was becoming more pressing than ever. The team shifted gears to build a comprehensive ‚Äúdata intelligence layer for AI,‚Äù aligning their mission with the data demands of AI innovation. This evolution culminated in May 2024, when Web3Go officially rebranded to DIN, marking a bold new focus on data as the next wave of AI advancement.

DIN‚Äôs Traction ‚Äî Good Momentum So Far
Daily Users on opBNB: ~700K+

Source: BNB Chain DappBay

DIN‚Äôs Daily Transactions on opBNB: ~1.2M+

Source: BNB Chain DappBay

According to DappBay, DIN has been holding steady with an average of >700,000 daily users over the month of October and>1.2M daily transactions. The majority of transactions are related to xData users having to make an on-chain transaction every 24 hours to activate their xData app and earn points.

Source: BNB Chain DappBay

DIN consistently ranks among the top 10 dApps on BNB Chain, and on many days, it‚Äôs the #1 app by users on the network. While I haven‚Äôt tracked the BNB Chain ecosystem as closely as chains like Solana and Base, this is no small feat‚Äîespecially considering BNB Chain‚Äôs longevity and strong backing from Binance.¬†

To put things in context, I took a look at some of the other top-ranked apps on BNB Chain to see what‚Äôs driving engagement there:

Vooi (DeFi) is a perp DEX aggregator
Particle network (Infra) is an omnichain protocol in testnet
Revox (Infra) is a modular on-chain network with a popular content app, ReadON
SERAPH (game) is a Souls-like RPG game.
MyShell is a no-code, AI app store ecosystem

According to the team, DIN has collected and labeled over 100M tweets so far, with a user base exceeding 30M across opBNB and Mantle.

What stands out here is DIN‚Äôs ability to generate a massive, real-time dataset of relevant tweets quickly, leveraging its substantial user base. This process doesn‚Äôt rely on the X API at all.

While xData currently focuses on Twitter, the team plans to expand the data collection and labelling platform to other sources like Reddit, Facebook, Instagram, and essentially any user data platform with high-value information. To me, this is where the real gold lies.

Side Quest: Reiki

Reiki is another product by DIN that ties neatly into the ongoing AI agent meta‚Äîin fact, DIN might have been ahead of its time, given the latent consumer interest in AI agents from what we saw with Truth Terminal and GOAT in recent weeks.

In January 2024, DIN launched Reiki, a platform where users could create AI agents (mainly chatbots) without coding experience. Users could also integrate their own knowledge base, allowing them to build engaging, personalized chatbots reminiscent of MyShell.

After launch, the platform quickly gained traction, becoming the #1 product on Product Hunt.

Reiki also gave creators several ways to monetize their bots, participate in reward programs, and even mint their bots as NFTs‚Äîadding a fun layer of ownership to the experience. Notably, BNB Chain‚Äôs Discord knowledge support bot is powered by Reiki.

Although the platform has been largely deprecated for now, the DIN team hasn‚Äôt ruled out bringing it back after their token launch. If revived, Reiki could provide an additional utility for the token and a way for AI agent creators to leverage the data collected by xData.

Token Design: xDIN, DIN and Node sales

In August-September 2024, DIN held a Chipper Node sale, raising $2.5M from node sales. These chipper nodes will allow users to run validation software on their local devices, using models to ensure data is labelled accurately. The sale was a success, with 25,112 Tier 2 nodes‚Äîpriced at $99 each‚Äîcompletely selling out.

Supply-side

Pre-TGE, xData users can convert their wafers (points) into xDIN‚Äîa pre-airdrop token. However, there will be a conversion fee ranging from 5‚Äì30%, with those fees distributed to Chipper Node owners. This conversion mechanism isn‚Äôt live yet but is expected to begin once node ‚Äúpre-mining‚Äù is live later this month.

At TGE, users will receive DIN (tradable token) airdrop based on their proportion of xDIN held, fully released with no complex lock-up mechanisms.

After the TGE, 25% of the total DIN token supply will be reserved for Chipper Node rewards. Half of this allocation will unlock in the first year, with the remaining emissions halving yearly.

Note that this is a relatively fast unlock compared to other projects conducting node sales, where node rewards are distributed gradually over 3‚Äì4 years.

Demand side

Validator nodes will likely need to stake DIN tokens to participate in the network. In return, they‚Äôll earn rewards for validating data, but they'll face slashing penalties if their outputs are inaccurate.

On the other end, data consumers must spend DIN tokens to access the network‚Äôs data. Since most Web2 businesses are still hesitant to engage with crypto, the company will need to facilitate these transactions to bridge the gap between traditional enterprises and the decentralized network.

We‚Äôre still awaiting detailed DIN tokenomics, which should be released closer to the TGE.

Team & Fundraising

The core team at DIN brings together talent from Columbia University, University College London, and the University of Stuttgart, with a decade of expertise in AI and blockchain.

DIN‚Äôs founder, Hao Ding, holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology from the University of Stuttgart. Before diving into crypto, Hao served as Director of Research Development at the Suzhou Institute of Artificial Intelligence in China. He then took on the role of Vice-President at Litentry, an identity oracle network, before founding Web3Go.

I had the pleasure of meeting Hao in person, and we had great conversations about the future of AI. His belief? Data will be at the heart of it all. The DIN team currently consists of 16 members, primarily engineers.

DIN participated in Binance Lab‚Äôs MVB 5 accelerator program and raised $4M in a seed round in July 2023, led by Binance Labs, HashKey, NGC, and Shima Capital. In August 2024, DIN¬†secured another $4M in funding, with participation from Manta Network, Moonbeam Network, Ankr, and Maxx Capital, bringing its total fundraising to $8M.

Our Thoughts
Thought #1: Building a decentralised Scale AI is a sexy story

Source: https://sacra.com/c/scale-ai/

Data collection and labelling is big business.

Scale AI is the best known player in this space, reporting¬†annual recurring revenues¬†of ~$1B. This is fuelled by heavy demand from foundational AI model companies like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Cohere who are Scale‚Äôs main customers. As of May 2024, it was valued at a whopping $14B.

Let‚Äôs take a closer look at Scale AI‚Äôs business model.¬†

Scale relies on a large, distributed workforce for its data labelling tasks, which involve manual tagging of videos, sorting photos, and transcribing audio.

It employs ~240,000 workers across several countries, actively recruiting in regions with high unemployment rates and lower costs of living. Kenya, for instance, has become a key recruitment hub in Africa, with in-person ‚Äúboot camps‚Äù in Nairobi and targeted paid advertisements to attract workers.

The labelling process typically has two layers: a first layer of annotators who label data from scratch and a second layer of quality controllers who review the work, add missing annotations and correct errors. It‚Äôs very human-intensive, but it works because human labour costs are low, and its clients are willing to pay significant money.

Now, imagine scaling this model (pun intended) through decentralized networks. A global, permissionless workforce incentivized by tokens could allow anyone to participate, while a distributed network of validators ensures data accuracy and quality. Decentralization could open up new possibilities for scaling data labelling, turning it into a truly global, democratized process.

Thought #2: Large User Base = Good

DIN‚Äôs primary advantage today lies in its large, engaged community‚Äîbuilt up over two years of focused community-building efforts. With this network, DIN can rapidly mobilize data collection based on specific criteria. The challenge, however, is identifying where the true data demand lies, directing its users to collect and label the right datasets, and building sustainable revenue streams to support long-term growth.

Thought #3: Incentives are a double-edged sword.

Right now, much of the user engagement is driven by anticipation of token rewards once the token goes live. But if the team can‚Äôt drive sufficient demand for the token later on, usage could drop off as initial interest fades. Creating this demand will require speculative interest and establishing a market of data consumers eager to buy these datasets.

Thought #4: Data labelling is a highly competitive space

DIN isn‚Äôt the only crypto team vying for a share of this market‚Äîprojects like Sapiens, Grass, and Masa are also in the race. But the pie is substantial. Take GRASS, for instance, which currently has a market cap of $2.5 billion, underscoring the scale of opportunity in this sector.

One path for DIN to differentiate and stand out could be training and deploying proprietary AI models for data validation, reducing dependence on human labour. This automation-first approach could streamline operations, enhance scalability, and give DIN an edge over competitors still relying heavily on manual processes.

Parting Thoughts

Data networks represent one of the most exciting frontiers at the intersection of AI and crypto. Unlike traditional centralized models, crypto-powered data networks leverage decentralized participation and incentives to build high-quality datasets at scale.

DIN is positioning itself as an early mover in this space, and it‚Äôll be fascinating to see how the project develops. This is DIN‚Äôs opportunity to seize. I often tell people: data networks are one of the smartest areas to be building in right now.

Crypto is reshaping how data is collected, validated, and monetized‚Äîbuilding the foundation for a new, decentralized data economy.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

DIN Website
xData Website
White Paper
Chipper Node Website
X (Twitter)

This research was sponsored by DIN, with Chain of Thought receiving funding for this initiative. All insights and analysis are our own. We uphold strict standards of objectivity in all our viewpoints.

To learn more about our approach to sponsored Deep Dives, please see our note here.

We‚Äôre grateful to our research partners for helping us keep our Crypto AI research free and accessible to all.

Computation Nodes
To get a better sense of how the data collectors and validators work, let‚Äôs dive into xData, DIN‚Äôs primary live product today.
#1: xData ‚Äî Data Collection

xData is DIN‚Äôs flagship platform designed to collect, organize, and store data from social media platforms like X‚Äîwithout relying on the API. It operates on a decentralized network, ensuring ownership and privacy for users. It was launched in April 2024 on opBNB (a Layer-2 on BNB Chain).
xData‚Äôs Chrome Extension
xData makes data collection for users fun and rewarding through gamified mechanics. Here‚Äôs a quick look at how it works:

Users install a browser plugin, sign in with their wallet and link their X account
Users can tag interesting tweets by replying to the tweet and tagging the @din_lol account
Users earn ‚Äúwafers‚Äù for tagging tweets, which are points that can be converted into tokens at TGE.
There are several gamification mechanics. Each user has a limited number of tweets they can tag (storage), but they can increase their storage space by spending wafers. Users also have to spend wafers every 24 hours to keep their account ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù and earn more wafers.
DIN releases missions around specific keywords or labels, and community members search for tweets in real-time and tag them according to the specific label.
Users install a browser plugin, sign in with their wallet and link their X account
Users can tag interesting tweets by replying to the tweet and tagging the @din_lol account
Users earn ‚Äúwafers‚Äù for tagging tweets, which are points that can be converted into tokens at TGE.

There are several gamification mechanics. Each user has a limited number of tweets they can tag (storage), but they can increase their storage space by spending wafers. Users also have to spend wafers every 24 hours to keep their account ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù and earn more wafers.
DIN releases missions around specific keywords or labels, and community members search for tweets in real-time and tag them according to the specific label.

The permissionless nature of xData means that any user worldwide can participate in data collection and annotation and earn rewards/income, regardless of nationality. For now, data collection happens off-chain, with tagged tweets stored on BNB green field, a decentralized data layer on BNB Chain.
#2: Chipper Nodes ‚Äî Data Validation

The next natural question is: how do you ensure the quality and integrity of user-submitted data? After all, someone could run an AI bot to randomly tag tweets that don‚Äôt match the specified labels just to maximize their wafer earnings.

Data labelling isn‚Äôt always straightforward either. Tweets often include nicknames, slang, and cultural references‚Äîfor instance, Bitcoin is often referred to as ‚Äúbig biscuit‚Äù in Mandarin-language tweets.
This is where data validation comes into play.
Chipper nodes are DIN‚Äôs AI-driven data validation and processing nodes, responsible for validating and vectorizing data, while also enabling users to earn tokens ($xDIN and $DIN).

Behind the scenes, each user-operated node actually runs a small AI model locally to validate that the tweet‚Äôs content matches the attached label before storing it in the decentralized data layer. Users can operate these nodes on standard PCs, without the need for costly hardware setups.
The AI models validators use continuously improve as they process more validated data, allowing the network to get smarter and more accurate over time.

Currently, DIN handles all data validation in-house, but the goal is to decentralize the validation process. Active testing for nodes is currently underway. Users can run the node software on their local devices to test the network, with bug bounties in place as DIN prepares for its mainnet and token launch in the coming weeks.
#3: Computation nodes
Although not live yet, computation nodes represent DIN‚Äôs future plans for storing data privately and securely. Here‚Äôs how they‚Äôre planned to work:

Vector Conversion: Computation nodes convert validated data into vectors.
Privacy Processing: Vectors are processed through a ZK (Zero-Knowledge) processor to ensure privacy.
Data Finalization: The finalized datasets and vectors are stored on IPFS, making them accessible to third parties.
Vector Conversion: Computation nodes convert validated data into vectors.
Privacy Processing: Vectors are processed through a ZK (Zero-Knowledge) processor to ensure privacy.
Data Finalization: The finalized datasets and vectors are stored on IPFS, making them accessible to third parties.
A New L2 on BNBChain?

No official announcement has been made, but in our research, we uncovered a DIN token on the BNB Chain testnet. This hints at future blockchain developments‚Äîpotentially a sidechain or Layer 2 solution on BNB Chain.
A Brief History of DIN

DIN might feel like a new player, but the project‚Äôs origins trace back to late 2021. Initially launched as ‚ÄúWeb3Go,‚Äù it began as an on-chain data analytics platform within the Polkadot ecosystem, securing grants from the Web3 Foundation and working with clients like Moonbeam and Oak Network.
In 2022, the team broadened its reach to the BNB Chain ecosystem, joining Binance Lab‚Äôs MVB incubator and securing investment to develop a ‚Äúmulti-chain open data analytics platform.‚Äù

By July 2023, they saw the writing on the wall: generative AI was booming, and the need for robust data infrastructure was becoming more pressing than ever. The team shifted gears to build a comprehensive ‚Äúdata intelligence layer for AI,‚Äù aligning their mission with the data demands of AI innovation. This evolution culminated in May 2024, when Web3Go officially rebranded to DIN, marking a bold new focus on data as the next wave of AI advancement.
DIN‚Äôs Traction ‚Äî Good Momentum So Far
Daily Users on opBNB: ~700K+
Source: BNB Chain DappBay
DIN‚Äôs Daily Transactions on opBNB: ~1.2M+
Source: BNB Chain DappBay

According to DappBay, DIN has been holding steady with an average of >700,000 daily users over the month of October and>1.2M daily transactions. The majority of transactions are related to xData users having to make an on-chain transaction every 24 hours to activate their xData app and earn points.
Source: BNB Chain DappBay

DIN consistently ranks among the top 10 dApps on BNB Chain, and on many days, it‚Äôs the #1 app by users on the network. While I haven‚Äôt tracked the BNB Chain ecosystem as closely as chains like Solana and Base, this is no small feat‚Äîespecially considering BNB Chain‚Äôs longevity and strong backing from Binance.
To put things in context, I took a look at some of the other top-ranked apps on BNB Chain to see what‚Äôs driving engagement there:

Vooi (DeFi) is a perp DEX aggregator
Particle network (Infra) is an omnichain protocol in testnet
Revox (Infra) is a modular on-chain network with a popular content app, ReadON
SERAPH (game) is a Souls-like RPG game.
MyShell is a no-code, AI app store ecosystem
Vooi (DeFi) is a perp DEX aggregator
Particle network (Infra) is an omnichain protocol in testnet
Revox (Infra) is a modular on-chain network with a popular content app, ReadON
SERAPH (game) is a Souls-like RPG game.
MyShell is a no-code, AI app store ecosystem
According to the team, DIN has collected and labeled over 100M tweets so far, with a user base exceeding 30M across opBNB and Mantle.
What stands out here is DIN‚Äôs ability to generate a massive, real-time dataset of relevant tweets quickly, leveraging its substantial user base. This process doesn‚Äôt rely on the X API at all.

While xData currently focuses on Twitter, the team plans to expand the data collection and labelling platform to other sources like Reddit, Facebook, Instagram, and essentially any user data platform with high-value information. To me, this is where the real gold lies.
Side Quest: Reiki

Reiki is another product by DIN that ties neatly into the ongoing AI agent meta‚Äîin fact, DIN might have been ahead of its time, given the latent consumer interest in AI agents from what we saw with Truth Terminal and GOAT in recent weeks.

In January 2024, DIN launched Reiki, a platform where users could create AI agents (mainly chatbots) without coding experience. Users could also integrate their own knowledge base, allowing them to build engaging, personalized chatbots reminiscent of MyShell.
After launch, the platform quickly gained traction, becoming the #1 product on Product Hunt.

Reiki also gave creators several ways to monetize their bots, participate in reward programs, and even mint their bots as NFTs‚Äîadding a fun layer of ownership to the experience. Notably, BNB Chain‚Äôs Discord knowledge support bot is powered by Reiki.

Although the platform has been largely deprecated for now, the DIN team hasn‚Äôt ruled out bringing it back after their token launch. If revived, Reiki could provide an additional utility for the token and a way for AI agent creators to leverage the data collected by xData.
Token Design: xDIN, DIN and Node sales

In August-September 2024, DIN held a Chipper Node sale, raising $2.5M from node sales. These chipper nodes will allow users to run validation software on their local devices, using models to ensure data is labelled accurately. The sale was a success, with 25,112 Tier 2 nodes‚Äîpriced at $99 each‚Äîcompletely selling out.
Supply-side

Pre-TGE, xData users can convert their wafers (points) into xDIN‚Äîa pre-airdrop token. However, there will be a conversion fee ranging from 5‚Äì30%, with those fees distributed to Chipper Node owners. This conversion mechanism isn‚Äôt live yet but is expected to begin once node ‚Äúpre-mining‚Äù is live later this month.
At TGE, users will receive DIN (tradable token) airdrop based on their proportion of xDIN held, fully released with no complex lock-up mechanisms.
After the TGE, 25% of the total DIN token supply will be reserved for Chipper Node rewards. Half of this allocation will unlock in the first year, with the remaining emissions halving yearly.
Note that this is a relatively fast unlock compared to other projects conducting node sales, where node rewards are distributed gradually over 3‚Äì4 years.
Demand side

Validator nodes will likely need to stake DIN tokens to participate in the network. In return, they‚Äôll earn rewards for validating data, but they'll face slashing penalties if their outputs are inaccurate.

On the other end, data consumers must spend DIN tokens to access the network‚Äôs data. Since most Web2 businesses are still hesitant to engage with crypto, the company will need to facilitate these transactions to bridge the gap between traditional enterprises and the decentralized network.
We‚Äôre still awaiting detailed DIN tokenomics, which should be released closer to the TGE.
Team & Fundraising
The core team at DIN brings together talent from Columbia University, University College London, and the University of Stuttgart, with a decade of expertise in AI and blockchain.

DIN‚Äôs founder, Hao Ding, holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology from the University of Stuttgart. Before diving into crypto, Hao served as Director of Research Development at the Suzhou Institute of Artificial Intelligence in China. He then took on the role of Vice-President at Litentry, an identity oracle network, before founding Web3Go.

I had the pleasure of meeting Hao in person, and we had great conversations about the future of AI. His belief? Data will be at the heart of it all. The DIN team currently consists of 16 members, primarily engineers.

DIN participated in Binance Lab‚Äôs MVB 5 accelerator program and raised $4M in a seed round in July 2023, led by Binance Labs, HashKey, NGC, and Shima Capital. In August 2024, DIN¬†secured another $4M in funding, with participation from Manta Network, Moonbeam Network, Ankr, and Maxx Capital, bringing its total fundraising to $8M.
Our Thoughts
Thought #1: Building a decentralised Scale AI is a sexy story
Source: https://sacra.com/c/scale-ai/
Data collection and labelling is big business.

Scale AI is the best known player in this space, reporting¬†annual recurring revenues¬†of ~$1B. This is fuelled by heavy demand from foundational AI model companies like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Cohere who are Scale‚Äôs main customers. As of May 2024, it was valued at a whopping $14B.
Let‚Äôs take a closer look at Scale AI‚Äôs business model.
Scale relies on a large, distributed workforce for its data labelling tasks, which involve manual tagging of videos, sorting photos, and transcribing audio.

It employs ~240,000 workers across several countries, actively recruiting in regions with high unemployment rates and lower costs of living. Kenya, for instance, has become a key recruitment hub in Africa, with in-person ‚Äúboot camps‚Äù in Nairobi and targeted paid advertisements to attract workers.

The labelling process typically has two layers: a first layer of annotators who label data from scratch and a second layer of quality controllers who review the work, add missing annotations and correct errors. It‚Äôs very human-intensive, but it works because human labour costs are low, and its clients are willing to pay significant money.

Now, imagine scaling this model (pun intended) through decentralized networks. A global, permissionless workforce incentivized by tokens could allow anyone to participate, while a distributed network of validators ensures data accuracy and quality. Decentralization could open up new possibilities for scaling data labelling, turning it into a truly global, democratized process.
Thought #2: Large User Base = Good

DIN‚Äôs primary advantage today lies in its large, engaged community‚Äîbuilt up over two years of focused community-building efforts. With this network, DIN can rapidly mobilize data collection based on specific criteria. The challenge, however, is identifying where the true data demand lies, directing its users to collect and label the right datasets, and building sustainable revenue streams to support long-term growth.
Thought #3: Incentives are a double-edged sword.

Right now, much of the user engagement is driven by anticipation of token rewards once the token goes live. But if the team can‚Äôt drive sufficient demand for the token later on, usage could drop off as initial interest fades. Creating this demand will require speculative interest and establishing a market of data consumers eager to buy these datasets.
Thought #4: Data labelling is a highly competitive space

DIN isn‚Äôt the only crypto team vying for a share of this market‚Äîprojects like Sapiens, Grass, and Masa are also in the race. But the pie is substantial. Take GRASS, for instance, which currently has a market cap of $2.5 billion, underscoring the scale of opportunity in this sector.

One path for DIN to differentiate and stand out could be training and deploying proprietary AI models for data validation, reducing dependence on human labour. This automation-first approach could streamline operations, enhance scalability, and give DIN an edge over competitors still relying heavily on manual processes.
Parting Thoughts

Data networks represent one of the most exciting frontiers at the intersection of AI and crypto. Unlike traditional centralized models, crypto-powered data networks leverage decentralized participation and incentives to build high-quality datasets at scale.

DIN is positioning itself as an early mover in this space, and it‚Äôll be fascinating to see how the project develops. This is DIN‚Äôs opportunity to seize. I often tell people: data networks are one of the smartest areas to be building in right now.
Crypto is reshaping how data is collected, validated, and monetized‚Äîbuilding the foundation for a new, decentralized data economy.
Cheers,
Teng Yan
