I‚Äôm also keeping my eye on Coinbase‚Äôs newly launched template for creating AI agents with a crypto wallet that can perform simple on-chain transactions.
Parting Thoughts

The success of on-chain AI agents is tightly linked to AI‚Äôs overall progress. We‚Äôre still battling issues like multi-step reasoning and reducing hallucinations that trip up AI models. But as AI improves, so will the viability of these agents.
The good news is that Epoch AI believes AI scaling can continue for at least the next five years. Software is progressing at the fastest pace we‚Äôve ever seen.
This means that the hurdles we‚Äôre facing today are just temporary roadblocks on the way to something much, much bigger.
Crypto will be an inevitable part of this agentic future.
Other notes that didn‚Äôt make it into the main article:

Could prediction markets help AI agents make better decisions? Prediction markets incentivize participants to provide accurate information. AI agents tapping into these markets could benefit from real-time, incentive-aligned insights, reducing their reliance on potentially biased sources. Perhaps agents could even adopt Futarchy, as @mrink0 posits.
Are we over-anthropomorphizing AI agents? Maybe we shouldn‚Äôt view them as doing ‚Äúhuman‚Äù work. Focusing on functionality over human-like attributes can lead to more efficient and effective AI agents
On-chain data is a major PITA (pain in the ass) to work with and will continue to be a drag on on-chain AI agent development progress.
The real opportunity in agents isn‚Äôt in low-hanging fruit like customer service‚Äîwhich can easily be disrupted by next-gen AI models. Instead, the focus should be on highly regulated sectors where accuracy is critical, creating defensible moats around these models.

Could prediction markets help AI agents make better decisions? Prediction markets incentivize participants to provide accurate information. AI agents tapping into these markets could benefit from real-time, incentive-aligned insights, reducing their reliance on potentially biased sources. Perhaps agents could even adopt Futarchy, as @mrink0 posits.

Are we over-anthropomorphizing AI agents? Maybe we shouldn‚Äôt view them as doing ‚Äúhuman‚Äù work. Focusing on functionality over human-like attributes can lead to more efficient and effective AI agents
On-chain data is a major PITA (pain in the ass) to work with and will continue to be a drag on on-chain AI agent development progress.

The real opportunity in agents isn‚Äôt in low-hanging fruit like customer service‚Äîwhich can easily be disrupted by next-gen AI models. Instead, the focus should be on highly regulated sectors where accuracy is critical, creating defensible moats around these models.
Good readings on AI Agents

DeAI IV: The Agentic Economy (Delphi Digital)
Onchain AI Agents: Architecture, Examples, and Projects to Follow (Accelxr)
The internet of agents (Davide Crapis)
AI Agents: A New Architecture for Enterprise Automation (Menlo Ventures)
Agentic protocols (Alexander Good)
DeAI IV: The Agentic Economy (Delphi Digital)
Onchain AI Agents: Architecture, Examples, and Projects to Follow (Accelxr)
The internet of agents (Davide Crapis)
AI Agents: A New Architecture for Enterprise Automation (Menlo Ventures)
Agentic protocols (Alexander Good)
Thanks for reading,
Teng Yan
Special thanks to Graeme Barnes¬†from Biconomy for reviewing my ideas and contributing his valuable thoughts to this piece.

This newsletter is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investment choices.

metadata.title: The Dawn of the Crypto Agentic Era

title: Our Crypto AI Thesis (Part I): The Massive Lifetime Opportunity
description: My full thesis is on why I'm uncomfortably bullish on crypto AI and why we are still early.
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
I often tell friends that in the future, we‚Äôll look back on 2022‚Äì2024 as the pivotal years before humanity's massive technological acceleration.

AI is likely to be the most transformative tech trend we‚Äôll witness in our lifetimes‚Äîunless, of course, we stumble upon a miracle in life extension that allows us to live for hundreds of years.

This means AI is red-hot, and everyone is scrambling to get a slice of the action.

In just the first half of 2024, $35 billion has been funnelled into AI startups. And that‚Äôs only the private side‚Äîbig tech is investing even more internally, as seen in their enormous GPU purchases from NVIDIA, which has driven NVDA‚Äôs market cap to an eye-popping $3 trillion.

But amid the hype, there‚Äôs a massive underdog opportunity that many are missing: Crypto AI (or decentralised AI)

This was a prescient comic from way back in 2019

Historically, every decade brings transformative investment opportunities that seem unpromising‚Äîeven foolish‚Äîonly to later prove visionary.

Social media was once dismissed as a frivolous distraction for teenagers with no real business model. Today, Meta (formerly Facebook) is one of the most powerful companies in the world, and early investors reaped returns exceeding 1,000 times their initial investment.

The narrative for Crypto AI is urgent and compelling. When I explain it, most people understand it right away.

By its nature, AI centralizes power. Left unchecked, it risks concentrating control in the hands of a few monopolistic organizations that will surely wield AI for profit and dominance. Decentralizing AI is not just crucial for our future‚Äîit‚Äôs essential for a brighter, more equitable society. I‚Äôve explored this philosophical angle in greater depth before.

Skeptics, though, argue that integrating crypto with AI is merely capitalizing on buzzwords, pointing to past disappointments in entertainment, gaming, and social media, where crypto has failed to achieve lasting impact or widespread adoption (yet). I hear this even from smart investors‚Äîand it‚Äôs a fair concern.

But I believe this time is actually different.

There are several reasons why Crypto AI is poised to follow a very different trajectory. And I‚Äôm writing this to explain why.

There‚Äôs much more to cover than I initially planned, so I‚Äôve decided to break this into multiple parts.

In this three-part thesis, I‚Äôll examine the¬†technological¬†&¬†investment landscape for Crypto AI in depth. I‚Äôll highlight the most promising sectors and show how I position myself to capitalize on this emerging megatrend.

Part I: Why Crypto AI is the sector to pay attention to

Part II: How I‚Äôm thinking about AI agents, decentralised training, verifiable inference, data networks (and other subsectors in Crypto AI)

Part III: A multitude of different ways to capture value from this opportunity

The more AI the world has, the more crypto it will need to keep it at bay and put a price on ‚Äì and defensive wall around ‚Äì the most precious and irreplaceable resource of all: our time.

- Preston Bryne

‚Äç

Be Where Secular Technology Trends Intersect

As savvy investors and entrepreneurs, we always want to be riding the waves of change.

To catch the biggest waves, we need to look for places where multiple major currents converge and position ourselves there.

This means identifying secular technology trends‚Äîdeep-rooted shifts in behaviour driven by technological advancements that redefine entire industries.

Crypto is a secular technology trend representing a shift in how we think about and use money. Other examples include cloud computing, mobile technology, and clean energy.

Simply riding a single secular tech trend isn‚Äôt enough, though. Thousands of others see the trend and are making similar bets. To truly stand out, we need to look beyond the obvious.

That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs remarkable to spot the early¬†convergence of two large-scale secular technology trends.

This is where magic happens.

‚Äç

Convergence + Scale = Opportunity
(1) The Power of Convergence

When two secular trends converge, a sweet spot for innovation and value creation is created ‚Äî often in places others might overlook.

Multiple Growth Drivers: Companies at the intersection of multiple secular trends benefit from the growth momentum of each trend.
Reduced Competition: Companies can carve out unique market positions with high barriers to entry because of the deep expertise required on both sides
Cross-pollination of ideas: Leads to innovative products and business models

‚Äç

(2) The Power of Scale

When it comes to investing, market size absolutely matters.

Consider Amazon in the early 2000s. Its dominance was not just due to e-commerce but also because it tapped into the emerging cloud computing trend, birthing Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS now generates billions annually and is a leader in the growing cloud infrastructure market

The larger the secular technology trend‚Äîboth in terms of the total addressable market and growth potential‚Äîand the earlier you enter, the greater the opportunities at its intersection.

Big trends not only provide a buffer against failure but also significantly amplify potential rewards.

‚Äç

Crypto ü§ù Artificial Intelligence

CPUs and GPUs have long been the backbone of computing, but now they power AI, which is emerging as the world‚Äôs supercomputer‚Äîharnessing humanity‚Äôs collective knowledge and creativity.

Crypto, on the other hand, enables the creation of open, decentralized networks, laying the foundation for a new internet.

Combined, these super-computers and super-networks are a beautiful, powerful fit for each other.

AI enhances the user experience of crypto. Users can interact with the blockchain using natural language instead of learning how to manage wallets, seed phrases, and sign transactions.
Crypto provides the trustless, permissionless, and secure infrastructure AI needs to stay open and censorship-resistant. It also serves as a powerful coordination layer for building decentralized networks.
This convergence sets the stage for entirely new business models to emerge

The intersection of Crypto and AI will grow exponentially, benefiting from advancements in both fields, which are on separate development trajectories.

The key lies in identifying what crypto enables AI to achieve that was previously impossible ‚Äî that‚Äôs the secret sauce. Hint: distributed training, data networks and private data. More on these in Part II.

‚Äç

Learning from the Past: The Case of NFTs and DeFi

Floor price of a Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT. Yuga Labs raised $450M in funding in 2022. (Coingecko).

The rise and fall of NFTs offer a valuable lesson.

NFTs rode high on a wave of speculation within the crypto community but lacked the tailwinds of another secular technology trend to take it further. Entertainment and gaming‚Äîthe core use cases for NFTs‚Äîare complex, mature markets with heavy incumbents, and their dynamics are not driven by technology alone.

As a result, NFTs were unable to sustain their early momentum. While the use cases are real, achieving their promise will take much longer.

On the other hand, DeFi stands as a successful example of the power of intersecting secular tech trends.

By sitting at the crossroads of fintech and crypto, DeFi has revolutionized financial services, offering alternatives to traditional banking, lending, and asset management that address real-world financial needs. The total stablecoin market cap is at all-time highs ($170B) and rising, while $82B is locked in DeFi protocols today.

‚Äç

Tokens: Open Source AI Needs Crypto
The closed-door nature of Big Tech‚Äôs LLM precludes the possibility of an ‚ÄúAI Democracy,‚Äù where every developer or user should be able to contribute both¬†algorithms¬†and¬†data¬†to an LLM model, and in turn receive a fraction of the¬†future profits¬†from the model. AI should be¬†accessible for, relevant to, and owned by everyone.¬†

‚Äç- Catrina Wang (Portal Ventures)

When people ask me why AI needs crypto, my answer is simple: tokens.

Traditional software scales at nearly zero marginal cost. Write code once, deploy it everywhere.

AI is an entirely different beast. It operates with high capital and marginal costs.

Training and deploying large-scale AI models demand vast computational resources, making efficiency and access to infrastructure critical success factors.

Right now, we live in a world where centralized giants‚ÄîOpenAI, Anthropic, Google‚Äîhold all the cards. These companies have the talent, the hardware, and the capital. But let‚Äôs be real: corporate-owned AI seeks to maximise profits. Always.

Meta‚Äôs contributions to open-source AI have been invaluable, but who‚Äôs to say when they might stop releasing state-of-the-art models like Llama 3? Developing these systems costs hundreds of millions, and initiatives could be discontinued if Zuck wakes up on the wrong side of the bed one day.

Expecting the open-source movement to compete with these giants purely out of ideals or goodwill is, frankly, unrealistic. We need a new strategy.

The thing is, there‚Äôs a ton of untapped compute, research, and talent in the open-source world, outside the top AI research labs. This includes contributions from universities, research centres, collaborative platforms like Hugging Face, and individual AI researchers. But right now, it‚Äôs fragmented. It lacks the coordination necessary to make major breakthroughs at scale.

That‚Äôs where tokens come in.

As outlined by @long_solitude¬†from Zee Prime, tokens embody crypto‚Äôs most powerful property ‚Äî permissionless capital formation.

Tokens do what traditional fundraising models can‚Äôt:

They create bottom-up funding opportunities for experimental AI projects that would never see the light of day under the VC model.
They bootstrap decentralized networks, turning them into thriving, self-sustaining ecosystems by distributing ownership and value to contributors. Just look at Bittensor as an early proof-of-concept.
They enable entirely new business models that slash costs, using DePIN-style tokenomics. One example: shifting upfront infrastructure costs (a huge burden for AI startups) to the network itself. Another: GPU marketplaces that tap into the latent global supply GPUs sitting unused in people‚Äôs homes, reducing costs per unit of compute.

Tokens unlock a massive opportunity for retail investors to ride the AI wave. And this is wildly understated.

Crypto is great at finding new markets people want to trade in. Just look at NFTs & cultural assets, social tokens for the creator economy, memecoins for virality etc.

My bet? There‚Äôs a huge, untapped demand for retail participation in early-stage AI projects.

As AI seeps deeper into our daily lives and enables us to do things we couldn‚Äôt do before, people are starting to realize just how big and real this is. Sure, there will be heavy speculation, but it‚Äôs also about democratizing access to the biggest tech revolution of our lifetime‚Äîand giving everyone a shot at the next big thing.

Expect things to get crazy.

‚Äç

So Why Now?
Source: Syncracy Capital

‚Äç

New technologies tend to follow a well-defined innovation cycle.

The Gartner Hype Cycle is one of the best-known frameworks. It tracks how innovations blowoff through a hype phase, crash into the trough of disillusionment, and eventually climb up into real-world use cases.

As an investor, the ideal moments to invest are either when you spot a new innovation trigger early, well before the hype peak, or during the trough of disillusionment, when you can identify the startups poised to climb onto the slope of enlightenment.

This begs the million-dollar question: Where are we in this cycle for Crypto AI?

I like to use the chart above from Syncracy Capital (smart folks) to highlight the consensus view today.

It suggests that decentralized AI is nearing or at the peak of inflated expectations. Crypto AI has had a strong year, with several protocols now at multibillion-dollar valuations.

But I disagree with this view. We‚Äôre probably nowhere near the peak for Crypto AI yet.

The consensus view underestimates the sheer scale of the opportunity ahead. We haven‚Äôt even hit mania territory. Ask around‚Äîhow many people really understand Bittensor, the bellwether for Crypto AI? In fact, I believe it could be another 1‚Äì2 years before we see a true peak.

Here‚Äôs why:

1. Crypto AI tokens ($30B) represent just 2.9% of the total altcoin market cap ($1.04T).

The largest Crypto AI protocols with live tokens‚ÄîTAO, NEAR, FET, and ICP‚Äîsit in the $5B‚Äì$10B market cap range, and there are only four of them.

Excluding these four, and keeping in mind that ICP and NEAR aren‚Äôt exclusively Crypto AI tokens, the total market cap of Crypto AI stands at just $11.7B. That‚Äôs <25% of the market cap of memecoins.

Only four other Crypto AI projects (RENDER, GRT, AKT, AIOZ) are valued between $500M and $5B, with the majority having a market cap under $100 - 200M.

This is minuscule when you consider the massive potential of this trend convergence. Crypto AI encompasses both infrastructure and applications, including next-generation smart contract platforms designed for AI.

By comparison, smart contract platforms today have a combined market cap nearing $600B. There are 8 Layer 1 protocols valued over $10B, and another 12 in the $1B‚Äì$10B range.

What could the market size for Crypto AI be? It‚Äôs such early days and anyone‚Äôs guess.

Bloomberg Intelligence estimates the generative AI market will grow at a CAGR of 30%+, reaching $1.3T by 2032. If decentralized AI captures just 10% of that broader AI market, and we apply a speculative premium common in crypto valuations (say 3X), the result is a $390B market in 2032‚Äî13X growth from today‚Äôs $30B.

Intuitively, I think this is very conservative yet too far out into the future to be useful.

Another way is to consider Crypto AI growing to 10% of the total altcoin market cap in the next 3 years (2027) as AI apps and smart contract platforms launch and gain momentum. If the altcoin market cap hits $2.7T by then (50% growth from its 2021 peak of $1.8T), that would place Crypto AI at $270B‚Äîabout 9X growth from current levels. That‚Äôs $240B in value waiting to be unlocked.

But these numbers are more illustrative than definitive. There are simply too many unknowns. What they do highlight, though, is the scale of the opportunity and provide us with a sanity check when thinking about valuations.

‚Äç

‚Äç2. Top-tier Crypto AI teams are just getting started‚Äç

Many high-calibre teams have been heads down building for 1‚Äì2 years and haven‚Äôt even launched their products to mainnet yet.

Several have raised 8-figures in VC funding, including Sentient, Sahara, Vana, Story Protocol, Gensyn, Space and Time, Ritual, Nillion...

Over the next 12 months, we‚Äôll witness major mainnet rollouts and token launches‚Äîthe AO Computer ecosystem, for example, is one to keep an eye on and which I wrote about earlier this year.‚Äç

‚Äç

3. AI is advancing exponentially.

Look at OpenAI‚Äôs recent o1 model, which made significant leaps in reasoning capabilities. Scaling laws continue to hold. Crypto AI will closely track broader AI growth.

That said, there‚Äôs a lot of noise today. Perhaps more than any other crypto sector. Many startups and protocols will inevitably fail, even if they see some short-term success.

A selective, discretionary approach to identifying winners will likely outperform a broad ‚Äúspray-and-pray‚Äù strategy.

‚Äç

Positive Catalysts Ahead for 2025

I expect several major tailwinds for Crypto AI that will propel the sector and narrative in the coming year.

Traditional Tech VC Funds Entering Crypto AI: While a16z is already in, major players like Sequoia, Lightspeed, and Accel have only dipped their toes lightly into this sector. As they move further along the investment curve towards decentralized AI, they‚Äôll bring both capital and legitimacy to the space.
OpenAI IPO: With OpenAI‚Äôs private valuation already at $150B and growing revenue, a potential IPO in 2025 could spark retail mania for AI investments. There are very few opportunities for retail investors to directly capture value from the AI trend outside of NVIDIA and hardware. This pent-up demand could spill over into Crypto AI tokens, which will be easily accessible on platforms like Coinbase.
A More Token-Friendly US Government: If the next U.S. administration post-November 2024 elections takes a friendlier stance towards crypto tokens, it could provide massive tailwinds for the Crypto AI sector, opening up regulatory clarity and encouraging broader adoption
Breakthroughs in AI: The exponential pace of AI development shows no signs of stopping anytime soon. In a recent blog post, Sam Altman outlines how he believes the future for AI is extremely bright. Progress in AI agents and distributed AI training will unlock new use cases and drive further momentum.

‚Äç

The Bear Case for Crypto AI

While I‚Äôm bullish on the massive potential of Crypto AI, I also recognize that nothing is guaranteed. My thesis would shift if these bear case scenarios play out:

Unfriendly Regulatory Regime: A hostile crypto regulatory environment in major markets like the U.S. could stifle innovation, limit funding, and push crypto projects into grey areas. Tokens are central to decentralized networks and heavy restrictions would undercut one of crypto‚Äôs key value drivers. This is less likely in a Trump win but could happen if Kamala becomes the US president.
AI Fails to Live Up to the Hype: Despite the current frenzy and billions in investment, there‚Äôs a chance AI won‚Äôt deliver on its promise. If progress slows or hits roadblocks, we could see the AI bubble deflate. I think this is unlikely, though.
Failure to Find Large Markets and Product-Market Fit (PMF): No matter how innovative, Crypto AI projects must find real business models and solid product-market fit. The sector could stagnate if decentralized AI fails to integrate meaningful commercial use cases. In this scenario, Crypto AI risks becoming more of a niche.
Mediocre Talent Pool: The pool of top machine learning scientists and engineers is limited. If Crypto AI can‚Äôt attract enough top talent who believe in the vision of an open, democratised AI future, innovation will slow, and the sector will struggle to keep up.

‚Äç

Part I: Closing Thoughts

Unironically, AI might be the best thing that‚Äôs ever happened to crypto.

It opens the door to true mainstream adoption and practical use cases‚Äîsomething that‚Äôs eluded gaming, NFTs, and social apps.

We‚Äôre heading into a decentralized AI future fueled by open, public networks. The savviest founders and forward-thinking investors are already taking notice.

The toughest part about Crypto AI is that you can't just watch the crypto space. Otherwise, you'll have a very narrow, superficial view of what‚Äôs coming. You need to stay plugged into machine learning developments, dig into the latest Arxiv papers, and talk to founders who truly believe they‚Äôre building the next big thing in AI.

But boy, I've never been so excited.

In Part II, I‚Äôll dive into and map out the key subsectors within Crypto AI. Some of the most critical areas I‚Äôve identified include:

Decentralised Compute: Training, Inference & GPU marketplaces
AI Agents living on-chain
Data networks
Crypto AI consumer apps
Verifiable AI, and more.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

‚Äç

This article is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investments.

Training and deploying large-scale AI models demand vast computational resources, making efficiency and access to infrastructure critical success factors.

Right now, we live in a world where centralized giants‚ÄîOpenAI, Anthropic, Google‚Äîhold all the cards. These companies have the talent, the hardware, and the capital. But let‚Äôs be real: corporate-owned AI seeks to maximise profits. Always.

Meta‚Äôs contributions to open-source AI have been invaluable, but who‚Äôs to say when they might stop releasing state-of-the-art models like Llama 3? Developing these systems costs hundreds of millions, and initiatives could be discontinued if Zuck wakes up on the wrong side of the bed one day.
Expecting the open-source movement to compete with these giants purely out of ideals or goodwill is, frankly, unrealistic. We need a new strategy.

The thing is, there‚Äôs a ton of untapped compute, research, and talent in the open-source world, outside the top AI research labs. This includes contributions from universities, research centres, collaborative platforms like Hugging Face, and individual AI researchers. But right now, it‚Äôs fragmented. It lacks the coordination necessary to make major breakthroughs at scale.
That‚Äôs where tokens come in.
As outlined by @long_solitude¬†from Zee Prime, tokens embody crypto‚Äôs most powerful property ‚Äî permissionless capital formation.
Tokens do what traditional fundraising models can‚Äôt:

They create bottom-up funding opportunities for experimental AI projects that would never see the light of day under the VC model.
They bootstrap decentralized networks, turning them into thriving, self-sustaining ecosystems by distributing ownership and value to contributors. Just look at Bittensor as an early proof-of-concept.
They enable entirely new business models that slash costs, using DePIN-style tokenomics. One example: shifting upfront infrastructure costs (a huge burden for AI startups) to the network itself. Another: GPU marketplaces that tap into the latent global supply GPUs sitting unused in people‚Äôs homes, reducing costs per unit of compute.
They create bottom-up funding opportunities for experimental AI projects that would never see the light of day under the VC model.
They bootstrap decentralized networks, turning them into thriving, self-sustaining ecosystems by distributing ownership and value to contributors. Just look at Bittensor as an early proof-of-concept.

They enable entirely new business models that slash costs, using DePIN-style tokenomics. One example: shifting upfront infrastructure costs (a huge burden for AI startups) to the network itself. Another: GPU marketplaces that tap into the latent global supply GPUs sitting unused in people‚Äôs homes, reducing costs per unit of compute.
Tokens unlock a massive opportunity for retail investors to ride the AI wave. And this is wildly understated.
Crypto is great at finding new markets people want to trade in. Just look at NFTs & cultural assets, social tokens for the creator economy, memecoins for virality etc.
My bet? There‚Äôs a huge, untapped demand for retail participation in early-stage AI projects.

As AI seeps deeper into our daily lives and enables us to do things we couldn‚Äôt do before, people are starting to realize just how big and real this is. Sure, there will be heavy speculation, but it‚Äôs also about democratizing access to the biggest tech revolution of our lifetime‚Äîand giving everyone a shot at the next big thing.
Expect things to get crazy.
‚Äç
So Why Now?
‚Äç
New technologies tend to follow a well-defined innovation cycle.

The Gartner Hype Cycle is one of the best-known frameworks. It tracks how innovations blowoff through a hype phase, crash into the trough of disillusionment, and eventually climb up into real-world use cases.

As an investor, the ideal moments to invest are either when you spot a new innovation trigger early, well before the hype peak, or during the trough of disillusionment, when you can identify the startups poised to climb onto the slope of enlightenment.
This begs the million-dollar question: Where are we in this cycle for Crypto AI?
I like to use the chart above from Syncracy Capital (smart folks) to highlight the consensus view today.
It suggests that decentralized AI is nearing or at the peak of inflated expectations. Crypto AI has had a strong year, with several protocols now at multibillion-dollar valuations.
But I disagree with this view. We‚Äôre probably nowhere near the peak for Crypto AI yet.

The consensus view underestimates the sheer scale of the opportunity ahead. We haven‚Äôt even hit mania territory. Ask around‚Äîhow many people really understand Bittensor, the bellwether for Crypto AI? In fact, I believe it could be another 1‚Äì2 years before we see a true peak.
Here‚Äôs why:
1. Crypto AI tokens ($30B) represent just 2.9% of the total altcoin market cap ($1.04T).
The largest Crypto AI protocols with live tokens‚ÄîTAO, NEAR, FET, and ICP‚Äîsit in the $5B‚Äì$10B market cap range, and there are only four of them.

Excluding these four, and keeping in mind that ICP and NEAR aren‚Äôt exclusively Crypto AI tokens, the total market cap of Crypto AI stands at just $11.7B. That‚Äôs <25% of the market cap of memecoins.
Only four other Crypto AI projects (RENDER, GRT, AKT, AIOZ) are valued between $500M and $5B, with the majority having a market cap under $100 - 200M.

This is minuscule when you consider the massive potential of this trend convergence. Crypto AI encompasses both infrastructure and applications, including next-generation smart contract platforms designed for AI.
By comparison, smart contract platforms today have a combined market cap nearing $600B. There are 8 Layer 1 protocols valued over $10B, and another 12 in the $1B‚Äì$10B range.
What could the market size for Crypto AI be? It‚Äôs such early days and anyone‚Äôs guess.

Bloomberg Intelligence estimates the generative AI market will grow at a CAGR of 30%+, reaching $1.3T by 2032. If decentralized AI captures just 10% of that broader AI market, and we apply a speculative premium common in crypto valuations (say 3X), the result is a $390B market in 2032‚Äî13X growth from today‚Äôs $30B.
Intuitively, I think this is very conservative yet too far out into the future to be useful.

Another way is to consider Crypto AI growing to 10% of the total altcoin market cap in the next 3 years (2027) as AI apps and smart contract platforms launch and gain momentum. If the altcoin market cap hits $2.7T by then (50% growth from its 2021 peak of $1.8T), that would place Crypto AI at $270B‚Äîabout 9X growth from current levels. That‚Äôs $240B in value waiting to be unlocked.

But these numbers are more illustrative than definitive. There are simply too many unknowns. What they do highlight, though, is the scale of the opportunity and provide us with a sanity check when thinking about valuations.
‚Äç
‚Äç2. Top-tier Crypto AI teams are just getting started‚Äç
Many high-calibre teams have been heads down building for 1‚Äì2 years and haven‚Äôt even launched their products to mainnet yet.
Several have raised 8-figures in VC funding, including Sentient, Sahara, Vana, Story Protocol, Gensyn, Space and Time, Ritual, Nillion...
Over the next 12 months, we‚Äôll witness major mainnet rollouts and token launches‚Äîthe AO Computer ecosystem, for example, is one to keep an eye on and which I wrote about earlier this year.‚Äç
‚Äç
3. AI is advancing exponentially.
Look at OpenAI‚Äôs recent o1 model, which made significant leaps in reasoning capabilities. Scaling laws continue to hold. Crypto AI will closely track broader AI growth.
That said, there‚Äôs a lot of noise today. Perhaps more than any other crypto sector. Many startups and protocols will inevitably fail, even if they see some short-term success.
A selective, discretionary approach to identifying winners will likely outperform a broad ‚Äúspray-and-pray‚Äù strategy.
‚Äç
Positive Catalysts Ahead for 2025
I expect several major tailwinds for Crypto AI that will propel the sector and narrative in the coming year.

Traditional Tech VC Funds Entering Crypto AI: While a16z is already in, major players like Sequoia, Lightspeed, and Accel have only dipped their toes lightly into this sector. As they move further along the investment curve towards decentralized AI, they‚Äôll bring both capital and legitimacy to the space.
OpenAI IPO: With OpenAI‚Äôs private valuation already at $150B and growing revenue, a potential IPO in 2025 could spark retail mania for AI investments. There are very few opportunities for retail investors to directly capture value from the AI trend outside of NVIDIA and hardware. This pent-up demand could spill over into Crypto AI tokens, which will be easily accessible on platforms like Coinbase.
A More Token-Friendly US Government: If the next U.S. administration post-November 2024 elections takes a friendlier stance towards crypto tokens, it could provide massive tailwinds for the Crypto AI sector, opening up regulatory clarity and encouraging broader adoption
Breakthroughs in AI: The exponential pace of AI development shows no signs of stopping anytime soon. In a recent blog post, Sam Altman outlines how he believes the future for AI is extremely bright. Progress in AI agents and distributed AI training will unlock new use cases and drive further momentum.

Traditional Tech VC Funds Entering Crypto AI: While a16z is already in, major players like Sequoia, Lightspeed, and Accel have only dipped their toes lightly into this sector. As they move further along the investment curve towards decentralized AI, they‚Äôll bring both capital and legitimacy to the space.

OpenAI IPO: With OpenAI‚Äôs private valuation already at $150B and growing revenue, a potential IPO in 2025 could spark retail mania for AI investments. There are very few opportunities for retail investors to directly capture value from the AI trend outside of NVIDIA and hardware. This pent-up demand could spill over into Crypto AI tokens, which will be easily accessible on platforms like Coinbase.

A More Token-Friendly US Government: If the next U.S. administration post-November 2024 elections takes a friendlier stance towards crypto tokens, it could provide massive tailwinds for the Crypto AI sector, opening up regulatory clarity and encouraging broader adoption

Breakthroughs in AI: The exponential pace of AI development shows no signs of stopping anytime soon. In a recent blog post, Sam Altman outlines how he believes the future for AI is extremely bright. Progress in AI agents and distributed AI training will unlock new use cases and drive further momentum.
‚Äç
The Bear Case for Crypto AI
While I‚Äôm bullish on the massive potential of Crypto AI, I also recognize that nothing is guaranteed. My thesis would shift if these bear case scenarios play out:

Unfriendly Regulatory Regime: A hostile crypto regulatory environment in major markets like the U.S. could stifle innovation, limit funding, and push crypto projects into grey areas. Tokens are central to decentralized networks and heavy restrictions would undercut one of crypto‚Äôs key value drivers. This is less likely in a Trump win but could happen if Kamala becomes the US president.
AI Fails to Live Up to the Hype: Despite the current frenzy and billions in investment, there‚Äôs a chance AI won‚Äôt deliver on its promise. If progress slows or hits roadblocks, we could see the AI bubble deflate. I think this is unlikely, though.
Failure to Find Large Markets and Product-Market Fit (PMF): No matter how innovative, Crypto AI projects must find real business models and solid product-market fit. The sector could stagnate if decentralized AI fails to integrate meaningful commercial use cases. In this scenario, Crypto AI risks becoming more of a niche.
Mediocre Talent Pool: The pool of top machine learning scientists and engineers is limited. If Crypto AI can‚Äôt attract enough top talent who believe in the vision of an open, democratised AI future, innovation will slow, and the sector will struggle to keep up.

Unfriendly Regulatory Regime: A hostile crypto regulatory environment in major markets like the U.S. could stifle innovation, limit funding, and push crypto projects into grey areas. Tokens are central to decentralized networks and heavy restrictions would undercut one of crypto‚Äôs key value drivers. This is less likely in a Trump win but could happen if Kamala becomes the US president.

AI Fails to Live Up to the Hype: Despite the current frenzy and billions in investment, there‚Äôs a chance AI won‚Äôt deliver on its promise. If progress slows or hits roadblocks, we could see the AI bubble deflate. I think this is unlikely, though.

Failure to Find Large Markets and Product-Market Fit (PMF): No matter how innovative, Crypto AI projects must find real business models and solid product-market fit. The sector could stagnate if decentralized AI fails to integrate meaningful commercial use cases. In this scenario, Crypto AI risks becoming more of a niche.

Mediocre Talent Pool: The pool of top machine learning scientists and engineers is limited. If Crypto AI can‚Äôt attract enough top talent who believe in the vision of an open, democratised AI future, innovation will slow, and the sector will struggle to keep up.
‚Äç
Part I: Closing Thoughts
Unironically, AI might be the best thing that‚Äôs ever happened to crypto.
It opens the door to true mainstream adoption and practical use cases‚Äîsomething that‚Äôs eluded gaming, NFTs, and social apps.
We‚Äôre heading into a decentralized AI future fueled by open, public networks. The savviest founders and forward-thinking investors are already taking notice.

The toughest part about Crypto AI is that you can't just watch the crypto space. Otherwise, you'll have a very narrow, superficial view of what‚Äôs coming. You need to stay plugged into machine learning developments, dig into the latest Arxiv papers, and talk to founders who truly believe they‚Äôre building the next big thing in AI.
But boy, I've never been so excited.
In Part II, I‚Äôll dive into and map out the key subsectors within Crypto AI. Some of the most critical areas I‚Äôve identified include:

Decentralised Compute: Training, Inference & GPU marketplaces
AI Agents living on-chain
Data networks
Crypto AI consumer apps
Verifiable AI, and more.
Decentralised Compute: Training, Inference & GPU marketplaces
AI Agents living on-chain
Data networks
Crypto AI consumer apps
Verifiable AI, and more.
Cheers,
Teng Yan
‚Äç

This article is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investments.

title: How I'm thinking about: Decentralised AI Training
description: Foundation-scale models are no longer the domain of the top AI labs
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
Decentralised AI Training

‚Äç

Picture this: a vast and powerful AI model but not built in tech giants' cold, secretive labs.

Instead, it‚Äôs brought to life by millions of everyday people. Gamers, whose GPUs are usually busy rendering epic tournaments in Call of Duty, are now lending their computing power to something even grander‚Äîan open-source AI model owned by everyone around the globe.

In this future, foundation-scale models are no longer the domain of the top AI labs only.

Efficiency is King

For now, though, the lion‚Äôs share of heavy AI model training remains anchored in centralized data centres.

Companies like OpenAI are scaling up their massive clusters, and they‚Äôre not alone. Elon Musk recently announced that xAI is nearing completion of a data centre boasting the equivalent of 200,000 H100 GPUs. It‚Äôs aptly named ‚ÄúColossus‚Äù.

Why is AI training still so centralized? It‚Äôs all about efficiency. Training large AI models relies on several key techniques:

‚Ä¢ Data parallelism: Splitting the dataset across multiple GPUs to perform the same operations in parallel, speeding up the training process.

‚Ä¢ Model parallelism: Dividing the model across multiple GPUs to get around memory constraints.

These methods require constant data exchange between GPUs, making interconnect speed critical.

Interconnect speed = rate at which data is transferred between computers in the network

When training runs cost $50M+, every ounce of efficiency matters.

Model FLOPS utilization (MFU)‚Äîwhich measures how effectively a GPU‚Äôs maximum capacity is used‚Äîtypically hovers around 35-40%. MFU was first introduced in Google‚Äôs PaLM paper back in 2022.

Source: Google Cloud

‚Äç

Why so low? While GPU performance has skyrocketed, other essential components like networking, memory, and storage have only improved by 5-10x, creating bottlenecks. This leaves GPUs often sitting idle, waiting for data.

With their high-speed interconnects, centralised data centres can transfer data between GPUs far more efficiently, leading to significant cost savings.

Challenges of Decentralised Training

So, one of the main challenges with decentralized AI training is low interconnect speed.

Since GPU clusters aren‚Äôt physically in the same location, transferring data between them takes longer, leading to a bottleneck. Training requires GPUs to exchange data and sync at every step.

The farther apart the clusters are geographically, the higher the latency, slowing down the process and raising costs.

There are distributed training methods that allow the training of smaller models in low interconnect speed environments already. Frontier research is extending this to larger models now.

For example, Prime Intellect‚Äôs open DiCoLo paper demonstrates a practical approach where islands of GPUs perform 500 ‚Äúlocal steps‚Äù before sharing and synchronising the results, resulting in up to 500x lower bandwidth requirements. They‚Äôve extended this to work in a 1.1B parameter model.

Introducing OpenDiLoCo, an open-source implementation and scaling of DeepMind‚Äôs Distributed Low-Communication (DiLoCo) method, enabling globally distributed AI model training. ‚Äî Prime Intellect (@PrimeIntellect)
4:55 PM ‚Ä¢ Jul 11, 2024

Nous Research‚Äôs DisTrO offers another promising solution with 1000x reduction in bandwidth requirements in training a 1.2B parameter model.

What if you could use all the computing power in the world to train a shared, open source AI model? Nous Research is proud to release a preliminary report on DisTrO (Distributed Training Over-the-Internet) a family of‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Nous Research (@NousResearch) ¬†5:25 PM ‚Ä¢ Aug 26, 2024

There is still quite a way to go, but so far, things look promising.

Another challenge is managing a diverse range of GPU hardware, including consumer-grade GPUs with limited memory that are typical in decentralized networks. Techniques like model parallelism (splitting model layers across devices) can help make this feasible.

What Lies Ahead

There are even bigger ideas on the horizon.

Pluralis suggests that decentralized networks could aggregate more GPU compute power than centralized data centres ever could‚Äîeven the largest data centres are limited by physical space constraints, power, and cooling.

This means the world's most powerful AI models will be trained in a decentralised fashion.

It‚Äôs an exciting thought, but I‚Äôm not fully sold on this vision just yet. I need to see better evidence that decentralised training of the largest AI models is technically and economically feasible.

There are already specific use cases for decentralised AI training, such as training mid-sized models or certain types of models whose architecture makes decentralised training most suitable.

Why Crypto?

Large global networks of nodes (computers) are essential to realize the vision of decentralized training and inference.

And the best way to build decentralised networks? Crypto, by far.

Once decentralized training becomes practically feasible, tokens will be the key to scaling these networks and rewarding contributors.

Tokens align the interests of participants, uniting them around a shared goal: growing the network and increasing the token‚Äôs value. A well-designed token economy creates a powerful incentive structure, helping overcome the early challenges that typically stall growing networks.

Just look at Bitcoin and Ethereum‚Äîthey‚Äôve already aggregated the largest supply of computing power globally, proving the power of token-driven networks.

I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts‚Äîwhether you agree or see things differently. Feel free to drop me an email.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

title: Weekly AI Edge #34
description: Arc Forge launches. Story Protocol (and $IP) arrives with a bang
author: Issy,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM

Big money is flooding into AI. Europe just launched the ‚Ç¨200B InvestAI program, building on the European AI Champions Initiative.

The AI race is just beginning.

Building on the European AI Champions initiative, I‚Äôm glad to announce InvestAI üá™üá∫

We aim to mobilise ‚Ç¨200 billion in AI investments in Europe ‚Üì

‚Äî Ursula von der Leyen (@vonderleyen)
9:57 AM ‚Ä¢ Feb 11, 2025

And Sam Altman (OpenAI) is out here talking about the $500 billion Stargate project, and plans to raise $5 trillion in a few years. Crazy? Maybe. But seriously‚Ä¶ how do you even price intelligence?

The big question is: how much of that $$$ flows into Crypto AI?

Infrastructure is improving fast. Projects like Story Protocol and Nillion (mainnet soon) are giving agents tools to protect IP and stay private in a decentralized world. But the truly useful applications? Still lagging. We‚Äôve got launchpads and agents dropping left and right, but too often, it‚Äôs a flood of ‚Äúagent slop‚Äù with little real utility.

And therein lies the massive opportunity. The gap between infrastructure and real utility is wide open. Founders who focus on building apps and agents that actually solve problems will own the future.

Quick tips for founders pitching for funds: 1. Skip the buzzwords (DEFAI??), and 2. Get straight to why what you‚Äôre building is actually awesome and important.

Good luck!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

The launch of Arc Forge
Story Protocol hits mainnet
Cookie Fun drops Act Two of Cookie DAO

Some serious action in the AI coin market this week.

ARC absolutely popped, soaring by 84%, and it‚Äôs no surprise with everyone talking about the Arc Forge launchpad (more on that in a sec). Meanwhile, AI16Z and AVA held their own, up 57% and 49% respectively as AI agent tokens make a strong comeback.

But it wasn‚Äôt all green candles. NEUR and MOSS took a hit, sliding 37% and 26%, respectively. This is despite NEUR pushing a new update to better look at bundled transactions and snipers.

Zooming out from Crypto AI, AI startups pulled in a record $110 billion in funding in 2024‚Äîa 62% jump from the previous year, according to Dealroom. In contrast, the broader tech sector raised $227 billion, down 12% from 2023.

Source: dealroom.co

The recent downtrend in Crypto AI feels a lot like the Solana saga of 2022‚Äîremember when everyone wrote it off? Meanwhile, devs kept building, fundamentals kept improving, and the early quitters quietly disappeared. Fast forward, and it became one big ‚ÄúI told you so‚Äù for those who stuck it out.

Time will tell.

Arc Forge: Redefining AI Token Launches
Source: cookie.fun

‚Äç

Arc Forge is here, driving a serious uptick in the ARC‚Äôs mindshare. In just a week, ARC‚Äôs slice of the Crypto AI mindshare jumped from 1.8% to 3.5%. Not bad, right?

Arc Forge is a token launch platform built on Meteora‚Äôs Dynamic Liquidity Market Maker (DLMM), integrated with Jupiter routing.

Translation: Deeper liquidity, sniper deterrence, and a boost to the ARC ecosystem. Let‚Äôs break it down.

First up, liquidity. Arc Forge is about reducing slippage and volatile price swings. How? Meteora‚Äôs "price bins" system. This allows projects to do more with less capital‚Äîwhether you're a creator or a trader, that‚Äôs a win.

The cherry on top? Similar to Virtuals, every trade on Arc Forge goes through ARC, creating real demand and fees that go right back into the ecosystem. That‚Äôs how you make a crypto ecosystem work for you.

Source: Arc Twitter

‚Äç

The first project to launch on Arc Forge? AskJimmy, created by Columbia University quants and a hedge fund veteran with experience managing $1B+ AUM. They‚Äôre bringing pro-level trading strategies to the table, covering Spot, Perps, and Options across platforms like Hyperliquid and Uniswap.

And for those who want the easy life, AskJimmy Vaults offer fully automated trading‚Äîjust set it and forget it.

But of course, it hasn‚Äôt been all smooth sailing. The token launch hit a bit of a bump, with the team reportedly pulling $700K from the Meteora Pool by removing ASKJ and USDC. And despite Arc Forge claiming to have multiple anti-snipe measures, snipers were still able to get in on the launch. This all may have contributed to a 25% dip in ARC‚Äôs price. Ouch.

The Arc and AskJimmy teams are at least owning up to the fact that this launch was far from perfect‚Äîand that‚Äôs a start. They know improvements need to be made.

GM
Community Update: We are currently digesting everything and looking to establish a detailed report on what happened with the arc-team.¬†
It's important return to our ethos : we are first in or we are never in. We will stay the first token from the rig complex.¬†

Sniper‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî AskJimmy (@askjimmy_ai)
9:12 PM ‚Ä¢ Feb 13, 2025

Here‚Äôs hoping teams like ElizaOS take notes and roll out something polished when they drop their launchpads. No one wants a repeat of this mess.

üå¥ Story Protocol: Tokenizing Intellectual Property

Story‚Äôs public mainnet is officially live, and it‚Äôs ready to flip the script on how we think about intellectual property (IP) in the AI age ‚Äî a $61 trillion global market.

Its Layer 1 blockchain transforms IP into a programmable asset class, enabling permissionless ownership, exchange, and monetization.

Homer, our Public Mainnet, is live.

Welcome to a new era of ÍßÅIPÍßÇ

Learn more ‚Ü¥

‚Äî Story (ÍßÅIPÍßÇ) (@StoryProtocol)
8:21 AM ‚Ä¢ Feb 13, 2025

At the heart of it all is the IP token (currently trading at a $1.8B FDV), which plays a critical role in governance, staking, and, of course, gas fees. It‚Äôs also got a deflationary burn mechanism. With 58.4% of the token supply going to the ecosystem, community, and incentives, the protocol is gearing up for decentralization and long-term growth‚Äîif everything goes according to plan.

IP Finance (IPFi) and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization could be a game-changer for creators‚Äîartists, developers, and scientists alike‚Äîenabling them to upload IP, set terms, and automatically earn royalties.

The platform‚Äôs focus on fair launch principles and sniper-prevention mechanisms ensures a level playing field. Staking rewards are launching simultaneously for all participants, with long lock-up periods for early backers who supported the project at its inception.

To kick things off, Story is launching a 30-day Day 1 Rewards Portal to incentivize early adopters. They‚Äôre also making strategic moves, including a collaboration with ElizaOS, which will allow Eliza agents to access and monetize programmable IP on Story‚Äôs platform.

Will Story truly transform the IP landscape?

Success is going to come down to one thing‚Äîadoption. Convincing creators, developers, and AI companies to embrace an entirely new IP system is no small task. This is a huge shift, and the jury‚Äôs still out on whether the market is ready for it.

Web2 AI
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman turned down Elon Musk's jaw-dropping $97.4 billion offer to take control of the company. Altman‚Äôs take? It's open-source under the Apache 2.0 license. You can test it, access the API, and even download the model‚Äôs weights and inference code.

structured_content.text: GM
Big money is flooding into AI. Europe just launched the ‚Ç¨200B InvestAI program, building on the European AI Champions Initiative.
The AI race is just beginning.

Building on the European AI Champions initiative, I‚Äôm glad to announce InvestAI üá™üá∫

We aim to mobilise ‚Ç¨200 billion in AI investments in Europe ‚Üì

‚Äî Ursula von der Leyen (@vonderleyen)
9:57 AM ‚Ä¢ Feb 11, 2025
And Sam Altman (OpenAI) is out here talking about the $500 billion Stargate project, and plans to raise $5 trillion in a few years. Crazy? Maybe. But seriously‚Ä¶ how do you even price intelligence?
The big question is: how much of that $$$ flows into Crypto AI?

Infrastructure is improving fast. Projects like Story Protocol and Nillion (mainnet soon) are giving agents tools to protect IP and stay private in a decentralized world. But the truly useful applications? Still lagging. We‚Äôve got launchpads and agents dropping left and right, but too often, it‚Äôs a flood of ‚Äúagent slop‚Äù with little real utility.

And therein lies the massive opportunity. The gap between infrastructure and real utility is wide open. Founders who focus on building apps and agents that actually solve problems will own the future.
Quick tips for founders pitching for funds: 1. Skip the buzzwords (DEFAI??), and 2. Get straight to why what you‚Äôre building is actually awesome and important.
Good luck!
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

The launch of Arc Forge
Story Protocol hits mainnet
Cookie Fun drops Act Two of Cookie DAO
The launch of Arc Forge
Story Protocol hits mainnet
Cookie Fun drops Act Two of Cookie DAO
Some serious action in the AI coin market this week.

ARC absolutely popped, soaring by 84%, and it‚Äôs no surprise with everyone talking about the Arc Forge launchpad (more on that in a sec). Meanwhile, AI16Z and AVA held their own, up 57% and 49% respectively as AI agent tokens make a strong comeback.
But it wasn‚Äôt all green candles. NEUR and MOSS took a hit, sliding 37% and 26%, respectively. This is despite NEUR pushing a new update to better look at bundled transactions and snipers.

Zooming out from Crypto AI, AI startups pulled in a record $110 billion in funding in 2024‚Äîa 62% jump from the previous year, according to Dealroom. In contrast, the broader tech sector raised $227 billion, down 12% from 2023.
Source: dealroom.co

The recent downtrend in Crypto AI feels a lot like the Solana saga of 2022‚Äîremember when everyone wrote it off? Meanwhile, devs kept building, fundamentals kept improving, and the early quitters quietly disappeared. Fast forward, and it became one big ‚ÄúI told you so‚Äù for those who stuck it out.
Time will tell.
Arc Forge: Redefining AI Token Launches
‚Äç
Arc Forge is here, driving a serious uptick in the ARC‚Äôs mindshare. In just a week, ARC‚Äôs slice of the Crypto AI mindshare jumped from 1.8% to 3.5%. Not bad, right?
Arc Forge is a token launch platform built on Meteora‚Äôs Dynamic Liquidity Market Maker (DLMM), integrated with Jupiter routing.
Translation: Deeper liquidity, sniper deterrence, and a boost to the ARC ecosystem. Let‚Äôs break it down.

First up, liquidity. Arc Forge is about reducing slippage and volatile price swings. How? Meteora‚Äôs "price bins" system. This allows projects to do more with less capital‚Äîwhether you're a creator or a trader, that‚Äôs a win.

The cherry on top? Similar to Virtuals, every trade on Arc Forge goes through ARC, creating real demand and fees that go right back into the ecosystem. That‚Äôs how you make a crypto ecosystem work for you.
‚Äç

The first project to launch on Arc Forge? AskJimmy, created by Columbia University quants and a hedge fund veteran with experience managing $1B+ AUM. They‚Äôre bringing pro-level trading strategies to the table, covering Spot, Perps, and Options across platforms like Hyperliquid and Uniswap.
And for those who want the easy life, AskJimmy Vaults offer fully automated trading‚Äîjust set it and forget it.

But of course, it hasn‚Äôt been all smooth sailing. The token launch hit a bit of a bump, with the team reportedly pulling $700K from the Meteora Pool by removing ASKJ and USDC. And despite Arc Forge claiming to have multiple anti-snipe measures, snipers were still able to get in on the launch. This all may have contributed to a 25% dip in ARC‚Äôs price. Ouch.
The Arc and AskJimmy teams are at least owning up to the fact that this launch was far from perfect‚Äîand that‚Äôs a start. They know improvements need to be made.

GM
Community Update: We are currently digesting everything and looking to establish a detailed report on what happened with the arc-team.¬†
It's important return to our ethos : we are first in or we are never in. We will stay the first token from the rig complex.¬†

title: Weekly AI Edge #33
description: Dynamic TAO is coming. Autonolas announces Olas Pearl.
author: Teng Yan,Issy
full_content:
GM!

Not the smoothest start to the month‚Äîmarkets took a nosedive over the weekend, rattled by Trump‚Äôs tariff announcement. Global trade got spooked, and the sell-off was brutal. But now, Trump‚Äôs giving Mexico and Canada a 30-day grace period to sort things out, so markets are catching their breath‚Ä¶ for now.

David Sacks, the AI & Crypto Czar, just laid out U.S. plan for digital asset leadership. Which is‚Ä¶ more working groups. It‚Äôs a long road ahead, but maybe‚Äîjust maybe‚Äîwe‚Äôll finally see some regulatory clarity and stablecoin protections. (Hope is a dangerous thing, but we‚Äôll take it.)

I was honored to appear with @SenatorTimScott@RepFrenchHill@JohnBoozman@CongressmanGT at @BankingGOP to discuss how the Trump administration and Congress will work together to support digital assets as President Trump directed in his week one EO

‚Äî David Sacks (@davidsacks47)
8:42 PM ‚Ä¢ Feb 4, 2025

We can‚Äôt help but feel like the AI agent space is getting overcrowded.¬† Too many projects tackling the same problems: blockchain AI assistants, DeFi trading bots, and no-code agent builders.

We wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if attention shifts elsewhere in crypto AI for a bit while the AI agent hype cools off. We‚Äôre looking at Bittensor (with the dTAO upgrade next week), decentralised compute, and AI-driven L1s.

But give it a few weeks/months, and we‚Äôre sure something fresh will shake things up in agents again.

Meanwhile, regulatory arbitrage is where crypto excels - finding grey areas and getting around policy hurdles. Imagine using a decentralised network of nodes to generate synthetic data for model distillation.

That‚Äôs the kind of innovation that keeps us excited for the future.

---

üö® One quick announcement before we dive in..

AI moves so fast and keeping up is tough. We struggle too. So we‚Äôve just launched a Telegram channel for Cyra, our AI researcher, to share her key insights in a timely way. She filters the most important news, tracks high-signal discussions across communities on a daily basis.

It‚Äôs broadcast-only, so no spam‚Äîjust pure signal. Join us here:

‚Äçhttps://t.me/cyra_alpha

---

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

ElizaOS GitHub showdown & latest updates
Dynamic TAO anticipation builds
Autonolas unveils three major updates, including an "Agent App Store"

Brutal week in the markets‚ÄîETH nuked 25% in a day, crashing below the $3K support.

AI tokens got wrecked, too. FARTCOIN and AI16Z plunged 63% and 57%, so hard that even FARTCOIN maxi Taiki rage-quit his position.

Meanwhile, FXN took the worst hit, tanking 65% despite its recent mainnet launch.

But it wasn‚Äôt all doom and gloom. SNAI (Swarmnode) and NEUR managed to defy the bloodbath. SNAI ripped 48%‚Äîlikely fueled by its acceptance into the NVIDIA Inception Program.

Source: kaito.ai

‚Äç

Overall, AI‚Äôs mindshare has collapsed to 32%, down from 70% last month.

Eliza¬†just hit a major milestone, catching up to Solana Foundation's GitHub star count in a photo finish. That‚Äôs right, Eliza is giving¬†Solana a run for its money, and the¬†numbers don‚Äôt lie. Here‚Äôs the breakdown:

But Eliza is not¬†just about GitHub¬†stars. Their recent v0.1.9 release is packed with upgrades: Instagram and¬†XMTP clients, enhanced autonomous agents, and expanded support for NVIDIA, Livepeer, and¬†Amazon Bedrock. Blockchain integrations? They‚Äôve got Birdeye, Solana improvements, OpenZeppelin governance, cross-chain¬†swaps, and new chains¬†like BNB, Cronos, and¬†Mina.

Oh, and over 100 new developers joined the party..

Meanwhile, the DAO is attempting to revamp its¬†tokenomics. This is mission critical, considering how the price of AI16Z has been tanking lately. Instead of letting its¬†$15M-$30M treasury sit idle, it‚Äôs¬†deploying those¬†assets into liquidity¬†pools. By pairing tribute tokens with the AI16Z token in one-sided¬†LPs, it aims to create buy pressure and improve liquidity.

And¬†more partnerships? Yes

One more thing: the DAO¬†is launching a Crypto Shark Tank with AI judges. üå¥ The Rise of Dynamic TAO (dTAO)

Bittensor is about¬†to shake things¬†up with the launch of dynamic TAO. With Coinbase adding TAO to their¬†roadmap and the dTAO whitepaper released, the stage¬†is set for something big.

The countdown has begun: a¬†senate vote¬†kicks off¬†the process, and if all goes well by¬†February¬†9th, dynamic TAO (dTAO) will make¬†its¬†grand debut between February 10th and 14th. It‚Äôs going to be a big week.

‚Äî JJ (@JosephJacks_)
5:35 PM ‚Ä¢ Jan 25, 2025

But what makes dTAO a game-changer? Let‚Äôs¬†break it down.

Dynamic TAO (dTAO) is a massive upgrade to the Bittensor network, set to transform how token emissions are distributed.

Right now, a small group of validators manually assess subnets, deciding their value and rewards. But as the network scales, this system is cracking‚Äîvalidators are overloaded, engagement drops, and manipulation risks rise. So high-value subnets might get overlooked while less deserving ones reap the rewards.

dTAO¬†introduces subnet tokens (think Alpha1, Alpha2, Alpha3) and subnet pools powered by¬†Constant Product Automated¬†Market Makers¬†(AMMs). These pools let users stake TAO for subnet¬†tokens and vice¬†versa, with prices determined by market activity.

In¬†other words, the market decides what each subnet is worth.

Source: bittensor.com

‚Äç

The dTAO system has powerful features: AMMs for subnet pools, fresh liquidity injections, TAO staking/unstaking, dynamic emission distribution, and halving schedules.

Each subnet gets its own liquidity pool, allowing true price discovery between subnet tokens.

With dTAO, subnet valuations are no longer dictated by a select few but by the collective intelligence of the market. This upgrade cements Bittensor‚Äôs vision: a decentralized network where growth is driven by the community, for the community.

But now, Trump‚Äôs giving Mexico and Canada a 30-day grace period to sort things out, so markets are catching their breath‚Ä¶ for now.

David Sacks, the AI & Crypto Czar, just laid out U.S. plan for digital asset leadership. Which is‚Ä¶ more working groups. It‚Äôs a long road ahead, but maybe‚Äîjust maybe‚Äîwe‚Äôll finally see some regulatory clarity and stablecoin protections. (Hope is a dangerous thing, but we‚Äôll take it.)

I was honored to appear with @SenatorTimScott@RepFrenchHill@JohnBoozman@CongressmanGT at @BankingGOP to discuss how the Trump administration and Congress will work together to support digital assets as President Trump directed in his week one EO

We can‚Äôt help but feel like the AI agent space is getting overcrowded.¬† Too many projects tackling the same problems: blockchain AI assistants, DeFi trading bots, and no-code agent builders.

We wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if attention shifts elsewhere in crypto AI for a bit while the AI agent hype cools off. We‚Äôre looking at Bittensor (with the dTAO upgrade next week), decentralised compute, and AI-driven L1s.
But give it a few weeks/months, and we‚Äôre sure something fresh will shake things up in agents again.

Meanwhile, regulatory arbitrage is where crypto excels - finding grey areas and getting around policy hurdles. Imagine using a decentralised network of nodes to generate synthetic data for model distillation.
That‚Äôs the kind of innovation that keeps us excited for the future.

title: Weekly AI Edge #32
description: Crypto AI reels from DeepSeek. Nous Research announces Psyche.
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

Happy Lunar New Year! Wishing you prosperity, good health, and maybe even some green candles.

But while the festivities are in full swing, the markets clearly didn‚Äôt get the memo.

The launch of DeepSeek triggered a mass sell-off across US tech equities and AI-related stocks‚Äîand the hot takes have been flying.

Most of them? Pretty bad. But one of the more thoughtful takes came from Dario, CEO of Anthropic:

‚Äú..DeepSeek V3 is not a unique breakthrough or something that fundamentally changes the economics of LLMs; it‚Äôs an expected point on an ongoing cost reduction curve. What‚Äôs different this time is that the company that was first to demonstrate the expected cost reductions was Chinese.‚Äù

Cheaper, better, faster AI is always a win in our book.

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Nous Psyche, the latest from Nous Research
The controversy around VVV
DeepSeek, a huge deflationary shock to the price of intelligence

Another brutal week in the market. The launch of DeepSeek, combined with weak sentiment across sectors, brought even more pain.

Agent-related tokens got wrecked‚ÄîMOSS, NOVA, and ELIZA all plunged 50% this week alone. Even major AI names like VIRTUAL, FARTCOIN, AI16Z, and AIXBT weren‚Äôt spared, each dropping 20-30%. Right now, buying into agents feels like catching a falling knife.

On the flip side, MOR and TAO stood strong. Morpheus kept up last week‚Äôs momentum, pumping another 50%, likely fueled by VVV‚Äôs launch due to their partnership. Meanwhile, TAO is finally getting some love. With more chatter around the upcoming dTAO upgrade, it looks like everyone is waking up to the fact that TAO has been overlooked for too long.

VVV Airdrop Controversy

Venice dropped its VVV token out of nowhere, and yeah‚Äîit made waves.Venice is a chatGPT-like app that runs on open-source models like Deepseek and Llama, but everything stays in your browser with prompts routed through their proxy infrastructure to a set of decentralized GPU providers.Venice went all-in on its community, airdropping half the total supply straight to Venice users and Base token holders (VIRTUAL, AERO, DEGEN, etc.). And the numbers? Wild.

10M out of 25M tokens have already been claimed
124 accounts scored 5,000‚Äì10,000 VVV each ($40K‚Äì$80K).
287 accounts walked away with 10,000+ VVV (over $80K).

But then came the dump. Since launch on Jan 27, the market cap cratered from $680M to $170M‚Äîa brutal 60-70% correction. Coinbase listing VVV within one day didn‚Äôt help either.The data tells an interesting story. On Jan 28, there was a 20K jump in holders, likely due to the 24H airdrop unlock rule. Regular Venice users had their tokens locked for 24H and had to upgrade to Pro to claim. Meanwhile, Base ecosystem holders and others with unlocked tokens could sell immediately. When those tokens hit the market, well‚Ä¶ you can guess what happened next.

This TGE was messy. Some were thrilled with free money for holding Crypto AI tokens, while Venice users felt rugged by the lock-up period.And it wasn‚Äôt just the tokenomics causing a stir. Concerns popped up over Venice sending inference requests in plain text, raising questions about GPU providers seeing user prompts. Then there was the insider trading scandal, with two Aerodrome contributors suspended and Venice team members dumping ~1% of the supply on day one. Not a good look, in our opinion.Airdrop mania, a controversial launch, and privacy concerns. Plenty of drama for a week.

üå¥ The Mortal who became a Goddess

Nous Research just dropped Nous Psyche, and it‚Äôs a big one.

This new infrastructure aims to decentralize and democratize AI development, making training and inference accessible to the community.

Built on Solana, Phase 1 of Psyche is all about cooperative training for generative AI‚Äîpulling together a mix of GPUs, from gaming rigs (4090s) to data centre powerhouses (A100s, H100s), to train AI models at scale. It builds on Nous‚Äô previous work with Nous DisTrO, which trained a 15B parameter model across multiple locations in the U.S. and Europe last year‚Äîsetting a record for fastest convergence in distributed training, all without high-speed interconnect hardware.

Phase 2 is where things get even more interesting‚ÄîPsyche moves beyond just training and into reasoning and reinforcement learning. Think Deepseek R1, but trained on a decentralized network that allows for accessible inference and higher-order thinking models‚Äç

Fun fact: The project is named after Psyche from Greek mythology - a mortal who became a goddess through sheer determination. Good omen?

The endgame? Open, decentralized infrastructure for training superintelligence. A pretty wild vision.

Nous hasn‚Äôt officially announced a token, but all signs point to it. A well-designed token could coordinate resources, align incentives, and drive adoption‚Äîexactly what Psyche needs to scale.

Nous is already crushing it with their Hermes LLM Series. Hermes 3 is the brain behind tons of social agents on X, Telegram, and Discord. And they're not stopping there - the plan is to make it even smarter through Psyche's reinforcement learning system.For months, Crypto AI has been obsessed with AI Agents. But distributed training has always been one of the most exciting use cases for Crypto AI, and Nous Psyche just put it back in the spotlight.

Funding Raises
Pippin Founder Yohei Nakajima¬†launches Agent Fund, a VC fund for AI agent apps, infra, and tools. Led by Yohei, Alex Reibman, and Adam Silverman, it‚Äôs open for investors on a rolling basis. Equity fund, not token-based.
Project Updates
Story Protocol announces Emergenceverse, a franchise with a storyline created by David Goyer. David Goyer is the mastermind behind the Dark Knight trilogy and Blade. AI agents and users will build the next major franchise on-chain.
Nillion network hosts the new DeepSeek R1-14B model privately using TEEs inside nilAI. Users can now access DeepSeek while ensuring their interaction is completely private. Nillion Network is building a privacy-focused network for AI.
Hyperbolic partners with Nexus to provide GPUs for powering Nexus's ZK technology. Hyperbolic‚Äôs Eliza¬†plugin is also live, allowing Eliza agents to autonomously use Hyperbolic GPUs
Nesa announces a fully encrypted inference API. Equivariant Encryption (EE) is an adaption of Homomorphic encryption that works on various models to provide end to end privacy on data manipulation but with zero latency.
Prime Intellect releases TOPLOC, a locality-sensitive hashing scheme for verifiable inference. It detects modifications to models, prompts, or precision and is robust across various GPU types. Prime Intellect is building the foundation for decentralized, verifiable compute protocols.
Giza crosses 11.5K autonomous transactions through ARMA, its automated on-chain yield optimizer bot. Users can deposit stablecoins for ARMA to find and optimize the best yields across multiple chains.
thirdweb, a full stack Web3 development platform, introduces Nebula for Unity, allowing game devs to build agents that talk to players and interact on-chain
Incentive Programs / Rewards
Privasea AI‚Äôs testnet part 2 has arrived. Users can provide processing power for secure AI computations and earn rewards, including token incentives. Privasea is building an encrypted AI network enabled by FHE.
AI Agents
Virtuals is expanding to Solana, introducing a Meteora Pool, a Strategic SOL Reserve, and maintaining the AGENT/VIRTUAL trading pair. The expansion includes a Venture Partner Model with grants, an AI Hackathon, and collaboration with key partners like Jupiter Exchange and LayerZero. Virtuals also offers grants of 42K VIRTUALS tokens for aspiring projects.
Youmio partners with Virtuals to bring agents to life in 3D worlds. Virtual agents can now be brought into 3D worlds powered by Unreal Engine, opening up new possibilities and environments for these agents.
Chromia rolls out EVAL, an agent that evaluates other AI agents. Built on the Chromia engine and Virtuals ecosystem, EVAL scores AI outputs on truth, accuracy, creativity, and engagement. AIXBT¬†received a score of 80/100.
Drift integrates with the Solana Agent Kit, enabling agents to trade perps, borrow/lend assets, and interact with Vaults. Drift is the home of on chain trading on Solana.
0G Labs releases their ERC-7857 standard. This standard is built explicitly for AI agents and enables the representation of AI agents as NFTs. This new standard includes privacy-preserving metadata where AI ‚Äúintelligence‚Äù stays encrypted and secure.
OLAS announced Modius, an advanced DeFAI agent. Modius autonomously manages crypto assets with intelligent rebalancing and lending strategies.
THINK agents drops their whitepaper for their Agent Standard. The THINK Agent Standard creates the foundation for intelligent on-chain agents, making them composable and interoperable.
ai16zdao rebrands as ElizaOS after a request from the VC firm a16z. The $ai16z ticker will remain.
Bittensor

The dTAO upgrade for Bittensor is set to drop in mid-February, so expect a surge in attention.

Mode¬†launches Synth 'subnet' on Bittensor to build decentralized AI that predicts crypto prices (subnet 50).
Crucible Lab‚Äôs State of Bittensor 2024 report is out. It‚Äôs a great read.

We dropped a new deep dive this week‚Äînow shifting gears from AI agents to the infrastructure powering them. Atoma Network is building the most trustable compute network on the planet üëá

Atoma Network: Private & Verifiable AI ¬†Building the most trustable compute network on the planet

üî•

¬†On X..DeepSeek = Bullish for Crypto AI?

DeepSeek is extremely bullish for crypto x AI. > An open source model with better performance than Open AI's model built at a fraction of the price--and they did it with inferior hardware.> All the major crypto x AI frameworks can easily use open source models or build on top‚Ä¶
x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Mark (@markus9x)
5:24 AM ‚Ä¢ Jan 27, 2025

DeepSeek is a huge deflationary shock to the price of intelligence

DeepSeek's new R1 reasoning model is dragging down the NASDAQ. It dropped 6 days ago but it seems Wall Street is only now digesting what it means. I'm no equity analyst, but a few things I've been thinking about.DeepSeek is a huge deflationary shock to the price of‚Ä¶

x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî Haseeb Ôºû|Ôºú (@hosseeb)
1:01 PM ‚Ä¢ Jan 27, 2025

DeepSeek isn‚Äôt the answer. It‚Äôs the question

the internet wasn‚Äôt built. @stevesi nails it hereit snuck in through the cracks of ‚Äúserious‚Äù infrastructure. http was a toy. linux was a hobby. ai‚Äôs next phase won‚Äôt come from a roadmap. it‚Äôll come from someone bored enough to ask ‚Äúwhat if we tried less?‚Äù deepseek isn‚Äôt the‚Ä¶

x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî Yhprum (@Yhprums_Law)
8:42 AM ‚Ä¢ Jan 27, 2025

DeepSeek shows that AI doesn‚Äôt have a data moat

One of the fundamental things that @deepseek_ai release shown is that AI doesn't have a data moat.People traditionally credited OpenAI, Google and Meta is that they have massive data that others can't access and it increases with every interaction users have with their‚Ä¶

x.com/i/web/status/1

‚Äî Illia (root.near) (üá∫üá¶, ‚ãà) (@ilblackdragon)
3:00 AM ‚Ä¢ Jan 27, 2025

DeepSeek‚Äôs breakthrough isn‚Äôt just about cost - it‚Äôs about architecture

DeepSeek's breakthrough isn't just about cost - it's about architecture.Their "mixture of experts" (MoE) approach means only relevant neural pathways activate for specific tasks.Think specialized doctors vs. one doctor trying to do everything.This is how they hit GPT-4‚Ä¶

x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî tong (üåê,üåê) (@tong0x)
7:49 PM ‚Ä¢ Jan 28, 2025

There‚Äôs going to be a war for specialized data

there gonna be a massive war for specialized datawhy? Because not all data is equalthe rarer and more specialized the data, the more valuable and unique the insights it can producegeneral data is everywhere, but it only scratches the surface. specialized data creates‚Ä¶

x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî nairolf (@0xNairolf)
2:29 PM ‚Ä¢ Jan 28, 2025

A comprehensive resource for Bittensor‚Äôs thesis and Dynamic TAO

This started as our year-in-review report on Bittensor. But halfway through writing it, we realized there wasn't a single comprehensive resource that simply explains the thesis, maps the ecosystem's growth, and explains Dynamic TAOSo Seth and I set out to create it

‚Äî Sami Kassab (@Old_Samster)
9:01 PM ‚Ä¢ Jan 29, 2025

State of Bittensor 2024

Our State of Bittensor 2024 report is live!Alongside the report, we're releasing a recording with the authors of the report, interviewed by our co-founder @dlawee and @brodydota from Outpost.We discuss:
> David's past experience as an executive at Google and as the founder‚Ä¶

x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî Crucible Labs (@CrucibleLabs)
9:01 PM ‚Ä¢ Jan 29, 2025

That‚Äôs a wrap for this week! Got feedback, wild ideas, or something cool to share? Just hit reply‚Äîwe read it all (yes, even the ‚ÄúAI is taking over the world‚Äù ones).

Cheers,Teng Yan & Josh
