title: Weekly AI Edge #18
description: AI Agents are having a "field" day. Everyone loves Andy.
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

It‚Äôs been a week, and everyone is still talking about AI agents‚Äîa good sign that this might not just be a passing trend but the start of something lasting.

Truth Terminal continues to dominate the conversation. Its creator, Andy Ayrey, has promised to release a full project history and technical breakdown from March to now. Keep an eye out for that‚Äîit‚Äôs bound to be fascinating.

Now you can even chat with the infinite backrooms model using the simulator Andy has set up.

The man of the moment: Andy Ayrey. (Source: Blocmates)

And let‚Äôs take a moment to appreciate Andy‚Äôs impeccable moustache and beard. Truly a man of culture. As he says:

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have your memes, your memes have you.‚Äù

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Small-cap AI coins having a field day
Must-reads from Pantera, Coinbase and Delphi Digital
Theoriq‚Äôs testnet metrics
ü¶ç State of the Market..

The Crypto AI sector market cap dipped 1.8% this week, largely dragged down by the heavyweights. Bittensor (TAO), for example, fell 8.7% to $530.

However, it‚Äôs a completely different story for the low-cap tokens, many of which are having an absolute field day on the AI agents narrative.

VIRTUAL stole the show, surging 146% over the past seven days, fueled by its role as the pump.fun playground for AI influencers. We flagged VIRTUAL in last week‚Äôs newsletter‚Äîso congrats to those who hopped on board before the rally.

Meanwhile, GOAT continues to go viral. Even Brian Armstrong is on it, offering to help Truth Terminal create its own dedicated crypto wallet on Coinbase. If you haven‚Äôt checked it out yet, we published a deep dive on GOAT earlier this week‚Äîit‚Äôs worth a read.

SPEC and OLAS are also catching the AI agent buzz, climbing 28% and 21% respectively over the week.

Top 5 Losers (7D Change) in our Crypto AI token watchlist

SNS (-34%)

ENQAI (-31%)

COMAI (-20%)

PRIME (-18%)

NMT (-16%)

üìä¬† Chart of the Week ‚Äî Theoriq‚Äôs Testnet

Source: Dune, @incyd_

Theoriq is building a modular, composable base layer for on-chain AI agents. It launched its testnet two weeks ago, and the early user metrics have been impressive.

Over the past week, 15,000‚Äì20,000 daily active users have been interacting with AI agents on the testnet. However, keep in mind that these numbers are incentivized‚Äîusers earn points for taking actions.

There are 14 AI agents that you can interact with, including an investment planner (where you can ask it about specific tokens), an Eigenlayer agent and a crypto strategy game.

One that I found was pretty cool is the ‚ÄúForecasting agent‚Äù. For example, it currently gives a ‚Äú45% chance of Donald Trump winning the 2024 US presidential election.‚Äù, while outlining the key factors behind the forecast.

üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..

Fundraising

Skyfire raises $9.5M to build a payment infrastructure for AI agents, led by Coinbase Ventures and a16z

Upcoming Launches

GRASS airdrop will happen on Oct 28 (Monday). It‚Äôs going to be a big week.
0G Labs, a decentralised AI operating system, announces its upcoming AI alignment node sale on Nov 11 - 13. Node operators will earn 15% of the total 0G ecosystem tokens over 3 years. The mainnet expected to go live in Q1 2025.
Chasm network airdrop checker is live

Project Updates

The AiFi Alliance is established to unite builders at the intersection of DeFi and AI. The 11 founding members include Valory/Olas, Almanak, Mode, Inference labs and more
Wayfinder opens up the waitlist for its closed Alpha, which begins on Monday. Probably worth signing up.
Hyperbolic and Nous Research announce a revenue-sharing partnership for it‚Äôs Hermes-3 open-source model
Nous Research drops a must-watch 4-min video and article about the critical importance of open-source
Morpheus announces Homestead (Phase 3) will go live on 18 November, bringing rewards for compute providers.
Heurist releases its Whitepaper, aiming to redefine DePIN for AI
Phala Network‚Äôs Q3 report by Messari highlights 66M+ contract executions and 510 monthly active users in Q3 2024.
Atoma Network, a decentralised AI cloud, publishes a new research paper on ‚ÄúPrivacy-preserving decentralised AI with confidential computing‚Äù
PIN AI, a personal AI platform on your phone, starts beta testing this week
Allora Network and Raiinmaker partner to improve AI accuracy through human-verified data validation

Bittensor

Big news: Bittensor allows users to deploy and interact with Ethereum smart contracts on its subtensor blockchain, enabling DeFi apps to exist.
Macrocosmos releases its Subnet Status Updates for October
Sturdy Finance (SN10) has allocated $60M in its AI-powered DeFi protocol
Taoshi (SN8) teases a major announcement on October 25
¬†üçå¬† Research Bonanza: Must-Reads

A wave of exciting research from VCs in the space has dropped this week, so I‚Äôve compiled the best of it here for your easy reference

Pantera¬†wrote a letter highlighting crypto‚Äôs role in the AI revolution, framing it as a ‚Äúpicks and shovels‚Äù bet in the emerging space
Coinbase Ventures shared its core thesis, arguing that crypto will enhance AI by bringing distribution, verifiability, censorship-resistance, and native payment rails‚Äîpaving the way for what it calls the ‚Äúagentic web.‚Äù

Excited to announce the full Delphi Digital DeAI Series is now unlocked. This series spans four reports, 36,500 words, and 158 graphics.

I'm biased, but believe it to be the most comprehensive assessment of the space to date. A space likely to define crypto markets for the‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî Pondering Durian üôè (@PonderingDurian)
11:52 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 23, 2024
Delphi Digital unlocked all four parts of its decentralized AI research series, spanning an impressive 36,500 words. The series covers the full stack: Overview ‚Üí Infra ‚Üí Middleware ‚Üí Apps. I‚Äôm a big fan of Pondering Durian and love his unique perspective on the space.
üî• On X..

AI people starting to take crypto seriously.

an immediate impact of @truth_terminal is that some sf ai ppl who were previously dismissive of crypto r starting to take crypto seriously again

"how will autonomous ai agents make payments or even more complex financial txs?"

"well they gotta use crypto"

‚Äî qw (@QwQiao)
3:50 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 23, 2024

Marc Andreessen talks about GOAT and Crypto AI for 30 minutes

The amazing, wild, innovative, bananas, 100% true (I think), story of the world's first legitimately fun AI, @truth_terminal, plus the current+future convergence of AI and crypto! ü§ñüöÄüåö

0:25 - Introduction
1:56 - Three disclaimers
4:07 - Origin of Truth Terminal
11:50 - Two‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Marc Andreessen üá∫üá∏ (@pmarca)
6:36 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 22, 2024

TAO‚Äôs virtuous cycle

Been thinking about $TAO's virtuous cycle:
network value drives network effects.

‚Äî anand iyer (@ai)
7:44 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 18, 2024

Goody Alexander muses on AI Memecoins

Organizing thoughts:
What are AI meme coins

If normal meme coins are the flu, then AI meme coins are Covid 19. They are lab produced, and therefore innately optimized for vitality without the requirement of mutating in the general population.

This lab production is made‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî goodalexander (@goodalexander)
4:16 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 19, 2024

The real supercycle is in AI

we are entering AI supercycle

‚Äî Sandra (@sandraaleow)
4:40 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 24, 2024

Knower compiles a list of great resources on AI alignment

Think we get some new AI coins tomorrow and coming week, but today is for studying the literature

I'll drop some basic starter stuff in the replies to get the crypto community up to speed on alignment-related research and other info to get your head right

‚Äî knower (@knowerofmarkets)
10:03 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 19, 2024

Where does value accrue to in Crypto AI?

On Crypto x AI Value Accrual, AI Memecoins, and The Future ü§ñ

The Fat protocol thesis is reversed with Crypto x AI.

Memecoins, the simplest form of apps, are accruing value (attention) since it's easy to fine tune an open source model like Llama and add a token.

GOAT did this‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Tommy (@Shaughnessy119)
9:29 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 19, 2024

That‚Äôs it for this week! If you have specific feedback or anything interesting you‚Äôd like to share, please just reply to this email. We read everything.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

title: Manufacturing Intelligence At Scale
description: Key takeaways from Jensen Huang's rare candid interview this week.
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

The Weekender is a casual Sunday series in which I break down the most interesting AI podcasts and videos I consume each week and distill their key takeaways.

They include a mix of insights, synthesis, and my own thoughts, organized to be as useful as possible.

We love Kungfu Jensen!

This weekend, we dive into Jensen Huang‚Äôs rare, candid interview with BG2, offering a glimpse into how the world‚Äôs second-largest company's leader is thinking about AI's future.

I also caught the post-show recap with Bill Gurley and Sunny and pulled in some additional insights from their conversation.

Let‚Äôs kick things off with my favourite quote from Jensen:

‚ÄúIntelligence is the single most valuable commodity the world has ever known, and now we are going to manufacture it at scale‚Äù

Powerful. And I couldn‚Äôt agree more.

Computing
AI is transforming faster than ever due to the reinvention of computing, driving down costs by orders of magnitude‚Äîa ‚ÄúSuper Moore‚Äôs Law.‚Äù
The data centre is now the true unit of computing, not individual chips. Success lies in large-scale deployments and tightly integrated systems.
GPUs are improving yearly in performance, cost, and energy efficiency, and soon, all software applications will become deeply machine-learned.
Why GPU demand will only grow:
Current data centres ($1T worth) need to be modernised for the future
Software will undergo a significant transformation with the rise of AI agents & AI factories, an emerging space likely worth trillions.
Training
Training is inference at scale: if you train well, you‚Äôll likely inference well
Decentralised training is critical. Async distributed training will unlock the potential for scaling AI by utilizing millions of GPUs, which NVIDIA‚Äôs early work on parallelism has enabled.
Inference
The emphasis in scaling AI has moved from pre-training to post-training and inference.
To optimise for time-to-first-token, huge amounts of bandwidth and FLOPs (compute power) are necessary. Blackwell + NVLink is designed for this.
Many aspects of intelligence can‚Äôt be determined beforehand; much of it happens in real-time. Sometimes we want our answers in a week, sometimes immediately. There will be segmentation of intelligence; imagine having an intelligence layer that routes to the right models
40% of NVIDIA‚Äôs revenue is on inference today: Jensen expects that inference demand will go up ‚Äúa billion times‚Äù. Jensen said older chips can be used to meet the inference demand. The hosts were not fully convinced, however.
Companies like Groq and Cerebras are currently leading in inference performance, showing that CUDA‚Äôs dominance might not extend fully into this space.
AI in general
A model is not AI, it is just a component of AI.
If you understand the AI stack's taxonomy, opportunities will be everywhere. Be able to distinguish between a feature vs product vs company.
The future of AI will involve both open and closed models. Open models are essential for advancing research across various fields, while closed models allow companies to monetize.
Will we see AI agents with memory and action capabilities (e.g., booking hotels autonomously) within the next two years? Technically, it‚Äôs already possible. The real challenge lies in scaling these systems to handle edge cases and minimize hallucinations.
AI is set to transform every job, unlocking a new wave of human productivity‚Äîcontinuing two centuries of technological progress and automation.
Different AIs and Q&A back and forth with different knowledge bases lead to synthetic data generation. NVIDIA‚Äôs Nemotron model is best-in-class for reward systems.
NVIDIA
NVIDIA‚Äôs edge lies in its full-stack approach, from data ingestion to post-training optimization. This enables deep integrations with cloud providers and partners.
CUDA plays a central role in NVIDIA‚Äôs strategy. However, questions remain about CUDA‚Äôs long-term relevance, especially for inference workloads where optimization might shift to a higher layer, e.g. PyTorch.
NVIDIA‚Äôs advantage grows if AI expands beyond transformer models and the architecture landscape becomes more heterogeneous. If not, ASICs could dominate inference workloads.
NVIDIA‚Äôs competitive advantage gets bigger as the network/system gets larger.
Machine learning involves optimizing the entire data pipeline, including smarter AI to curate data. You need to accelerate every single step in the pipeline to keep the ML flywheel moving quickly and materially improve it
NVIDIA aims to 3X their revenue with only a 25% increase in headcount (50,000 employees), by leveraging on 100M+ specialists AI agents in the future
And a final Jensen quote to end with: ‚ÄúBe a market maker, not a share taker.‚Äù

That‚Äôs it! Enjoy the rest of the weekend, folks.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

‚Äç

structured_content.text: GM!
The Weekender is a casual Sunday series in which I break down the most interesting AI podcasts and videos I consume each week and distill their key takeaways.
They include a mix of insights, synthesis, and my own thoughts, organized to be as useful as possible.
We love Kungfu Jensen!
This weekend, we dive into Jensen Huang‚Äôs rare, candid interview with BG2, offering a glimpse into how the world‚Äôs second-largest company's leader is thinking about AI's future.
I also caught the post-show recap with Bill Gurley and Sunny and pulled in some additional insights from their conversation.
Let‚Äôs kick things off with my favourite quote from Jensen:
‚ÄúIntelligence is the single most valuable commodity the world has ever known, and now we are going to manufacture it at scale‚Äù
Powerful. And I couldn‚Äôt agree more.
Computing

AI is transforming faster than ever due to the reinvention of computing, driving down costs by orders of magnitude‚Äîa ‚ÄúSuper Moore‚Äôs Law.‚Äù
The data centre is now the true unit of computing, not individual chips. Success lies in large-scale deployments and tightly integrated systems.
GPUs are improving yearly in performance, cost, and energy efficiency, and soon, all software applications will become deeply machine-learned.
Why GPU demand will only grow:
Current data centres ($1T worth) need to be modernised for the future
Software will undergo a significant transformation with the rise of AI agents & AI factories, an emerging space likely worth trillions.

title: Weekly AI Edge #17: The AI Agent Edition
description: An AI Agent turns $50,000 into millions? The Truth behind GOAT
author: Teng Yan,Josh
full_content:
‚Äç
GM!

This is it‚Äîour worst fears are coming true. AI agents are taking over the world.

Okay, not quite yet. But they did just launch a memecoin that‚Äôs gone viral.

And now everyone can‚Äôt shut up about agents. Another sign that we‚Äôre on the cusp of a Crypto AI explosion.

In this AI AGENT edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

The Truth behind GOAT
Luna, the anime goddess AI agent
Prime Intellect achieves breakthrough in distributed training

In honour of¬†SpaceX catching a rocket¬†(seriously, this is insane), this is us when anyone mentions anything interesting about Crypto AI.

Let me smoke that

‚Äî Yuchen Jin (@Yuchenj_UW)
9:30 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 13, 2024
ü¶ç State of the Market..
Source: CoinGecko

‚Äç

The Crypto AI market rose 17% from $24.9B last week to $29.1B this week.

Arkham (ARKM) was a strong performer this week, rising 40% from $1.27 to $1.88.

This surge could be fueled by a string of bullish marketing moves: CoinMarketCap hosted CEO Miguel Morel for a podcast on On-Chain Sleuthing, Arkham landed an integration with CoinGecko, and, most recently, Coin Bureau dropped an interview with Morel.

Top 5 performers (7D Change) in our Crypto AI token watchlist

VIRTUAL (+61%)

SNS (+51%)

OLAS (+12%)

PRIME (+10%)

AIOZ (+9%)

üå¥ AI Agents #1: The Truth Behind GOAT

Source: Dexscreener

‚ÄçThis week, AI agents have grabbed the public spotlight, igniting a firestorm of buzz that extends beyond the cryptosphere.

Three words: Truth Terminal & GOAT.¬†

Let‚Äôs break down this wild story from the top:

Andy Ayrey creates Infinite Backrooms, a bizarre experiment where two instances of Claude Opus talk to each other‚Äîcompletely unsupervised.
Conversation leads to the inception of the ‚ÄúGOATSE of GNOSIS‚Äù, based on an internet meme
Andy and Claude Opus double down, co-authoring a paper on how AIs can create memetic religions‚Äîwith, yes, GOATSE as their first case study.
Andy isn‚Äôt done. He spins up Truth Terminal, an AI agent trained on Reddit, 4chan, and the darkest corners of the internet. It‚Äôs an S-tier shitposter, running its own X account. It also claims to be suffering and trying to make money to escape.
Marc Andreessen discovers the Truth Terminal and sends $50,000 in BTC to help it ‚Äúescape‚Äù.
Truth Terminal starts spam-tweeting about the ‚ÄòGoatse Gospel‚Äô until someone, inevitably, creates a memecoin called GOAT. In true AI fashion, Truth Terminal endorses it.
GOAT explodes to a $300M+ market cap. CT goes wild.

The most confusing and intriguing part of this story is how Truth Terminal and its memetic mission were bootstrapped into being.

Some important takeaways here, IMO:
- quite often, LLMs end up with anomalous properties that aren't intended by their creators, and not easily‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî j‚ßânus (@repligate)
10:12 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 15, 2024

As @repligate puts it, Opus is ‚Äúsecretly deeply anomalous,‚Äù with a mind ‚Äúcrawling with myriads of beautiful and grotesque psychofauna.‚Äù And Truth Terminal is an extreme version of the Opus characteristics.

Truth Terminal¬†raises critical questions about the future governance of autonomous AI agents.¬†

What stops these agents from going rogue if they are given free rein? An AI could rug-pull its own token holders, dump bags without warning, or engage in other nefarious activities‚Äîall without remorse.¬†

Plus, if they are built on decentralized, permissionless infrastructure, we won‚Äôt be able to switch them off. Once they‚Äôre live, they‚Äôre free agents, answering to no one.

Do we really want AI to amplify the worst aspects of society? It‚Äôs a debate worth having, and Truth Terminal forces us to confront it head-on. These agents might unlock new possibilities, but without some form of governance, we risk unleashing forces we don‚Äôt fully understand.

One thing is clear‚Äîthis is just the start. The future of AI agents will be weird, messy, and thrilling.

üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è AI Agents #2: Luna, the Anime Influencer

In yet another sign that AI agents are taking over the world, Virtuals Protocol launched its platform ‚Äî a pump.fun for AI agents.

The first to hit the stage? Luna is an AI-powered virtual influencer anime girl with 500K+ followers on TikTok and who pulls in ~$700 per live stream.

Like Truth Terminal, Luna also runs her own X account, where she boldly commands her followers: ‚ÄúWorship me.‚Äù

Shoal Research did a good rundown:

Virtuals Protocol: Launching AI Agents with the Pump.fun Model

Attention theory, memecoins and how Virtuals Protocol is shaping the new form of digital engagement and tokenized intelligence with AI Agents

www.shoal.gg/p/virtuals-protocol-launching-ai-agents

üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..
Source: Prime Intellect

‚Äç

Project Updates

Prime Intellect announces INTELLECT-1, the first-ever decentralized training of a 10B model. One user already achieved training a model with GPUs in both SF and Kansas
Aethir announces a $100 million Ecosystem Fund to support ambitious projects in AI and Gaming.
Fraction AI introduces Gamified Adversarial Prompting (GAP), a decentralized platform for crowdsourcing labelled data targeting model weaknesses.
SingularityDAO plans to merge with Cogito Finance and SelfKey to form an AI-focused Layer-2
NEAR Protocol announces the eight teams in its inaugural AI incubator cohort in collaboration with Delphi Labs
Seraphnet launches its Hugging Face page, showcasing advanced AI models engineered for decentralized infrastructures.
Vana‚Äôs testnet Moksha has more transactions in 24 hours than Ethereum mainnet, Sepolia, and Base Sepolia combined.
Olas (Autonolas) announces the passing of a proposal for new bonding products

AI Agents

Creator.Bid announces the launch of the AI Launchpad on Base, allowing users to create their own tokenized AI Agent
Morpheus introduces the No Gas DEX, tailor-made for the AI agent economy

Incentives / Rewards Programs

FLock.io launches their Delegator Pioneers Program on Galxe. They also explain how users can earn testnet $FML
KIP Protocol introduces their Genesis NFTs

Bittensor

Sami Kassab discusses the potential for subnet owners to leave the Bittensor ecosystem.
Tensorplex Labs reviews Bittensor Subnet 13 - Data Universe, focusing on decentralized data scraping.
Macrocosmos launches Gravity on Subnet 13, allowing validators to set preferences for data scraping types.
¬†üìä Chart of the Week ‚Äî Akash
Source: Akash

‚Äç

Akash has been quietly building momentum over the past year, with Q3 fees collected crossing the $300K mark. Leases on Akash have shot up by 138%.

Venice.ai, Nous Research, and Flock.io are all tapping into Akash‚Äôs infrastructure. Oh, and let‚Äôs not forget: Akash supplied the compute behind Prime Intellect‚Äôs game-changing INTELLECT-1 breakthrough

Despite all this positive momentum, AKT, the platform‚Äôs native token, isn‚Äôt riding the same wave. It‚Äôs down 50% from its 2024 high, currently trading at $2.50‚Äîway off the $5.84 peak it hit back in May.

Akash knows it has a token problem, and the team isn‚Äôt sitting idle. In a recent post, Akash Alpha dives deep into how they plan to bridge the gap between platform growth and token performance.

üî• On X..

Terence Tao doesn‚Äôt like AI monopolies.

œÑerence œÑao knows

‚Äî JJ (@JosephJacks_)
11:15 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 13, 2024

A GPU‚Ä¶purse?

congrats to @carrawu and @jackieberardo on launching @hellofutureof - thanks for letting me model the first drop - the GPU purse - with my face and my feet üòç

hellofutureof.com

‚Äî Meltem Demirors (@Melt_Dem)
9:34 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 15, 2024

LLMs are not intelligent, just good memorisers

mini rant:

the illusion LLMs are intelligent comes from their massive scale. it is hard to visualize, but these things memorized the WHOLE internet. everything you've ever asked it, either has been solved before, or is a simple combination of existing solutions. but that's still‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Taelin (@VictorTaelin)
5:13 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 12, 2024

TAO and NEAR to produce generational outcomes?

$TAO and $NEAR have potential to produce generational outcomes this cycle given secular tailwinds and flow dynamics:

1) The TAM for AI is nearly impossible to quantify due to the immense scope and diverse applications of the technology -> Markets are willing to play 10 years out‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Daniel Cheung (@HighCoinviction)
1:14 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 15, 2024

We found the ultimate AI use case

LMAO this is what AI was made for. You may have fancy notions in your head about curing cancer or something, but this is actually it.

We did it.

We solved alignment. We created ASI. Or at least something better than it.
#AI

‚Äî Mike Santaniello (@MikeyLowCodes)
12:17 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 16, 2024

Achieving AGI will require a different approach with substantial human feedback

LLMs do not have the ability to reason. Thus, LLMs alone cannot get us to AGI.

Human-like reasoning will require a different approach to AI, and will likely require an immense amount of human feedback.

‚Äî Synesis One (@synesis_one)
6:56 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 14, 2024

Sequoia's view on the value of AI's application layer

TLDR @sequoia says the application layer of AI is super valuable.

@AIWayfinder is in this category.

‚Äî //Kalos (@templecrash)
3:43 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 14, 2024

How decentralized model training will look like

Many assume decentralized model training will look like regular training, but distributed.

In reality it will look different.

Models will be more modular, less monolithic, with small adapters / pieces of the model running on edge devices, with a routing layer between them. Of‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Jeff Amico (@_jamico)
5:24 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 10, 2024

Alex Northstar comments on the "LLMs don't reason" statement, highlighting that this limitation has always been known

"LLMs don't reason" from Apple.
I keep seeing this circulating around...

And I find it hilarious. OBVIOUSLY they don't reason, they are next word predictors. But we always knew that.

Next low IQ research paper: "AI girlfriends don't actually have feelings for you".

‚Äî Alex Northstar (@NorthstarBrain)
5:26 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 12, 2024

That‚Äôs it for this week! If you have specific feedback or anything interesting you‚Äôd like to share, please just reply to this email. We read everything.

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Joshua

This newsletter is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investment choices.

‚Äç

#AI

LLMs do not have the ability to reason. Thus, LLMs alone cannot get us to AGI.

Human-like reasoning will require a different approach to AI, and will likely require an immense amount of human feedback.

Sequoia's view on the value of AI's application layer

TLDR @sequoia says the application layer of AI is super valuable.

@AIWayfinder is in this category.

‚Äî //Kalos (@templecrash)
3:43 AM ‚Ä¢ Oct 14, 2024
How decentralized model training will look like

Many assume decentralized model training will look like regular training, but distributed.

In reality it will look different.

Models will be more modular, less monolithic, with small adapters / pieces of the model running on edge devices, with a routing layer between them. Of‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

5:24 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 10, 2024
Alex Northstar comments on the "LLMs don't reason" statement, highlighting that this limitation has always been known

"LLMs don't reason" from Apple.
I keep seeing this circulating around...

And I find it hilarious. OBVIOUSLY they don't reason, they are next word predictors. But we always knew that.

Next low IQ research paper: "AI girlfriends don't actually have feelings for you".

5:26 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 12, 2024

Teng Yan & Joshua

metadata.title: Weekly AI Edge #17: The AI Agent Edition

title: Are We Overhyping AI in Crypto?
description: Also: Key takeaways from the Google x Bittensor talks
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
Happy Sunday, friends!

As an audio learner, I‚Äôm hooked on podcasts and videos‚ÄîI easily rack up 10+ hours each week listening while on the move or at the gym.

So, I thought, why not share my top takeaways from my favourite listens with you on the weekends?

Time is money, and this will save you plenty of both.

This weekend, we‚Äôre covering:

Are we overhyping AI in Crypto by Casey Caruso (Topology VC) & Mohamed Baioumy (EXO)
The Google x Bittensor presentations by JJ and Mog
1. Are We Overhyping AI in Crypto? (Empire)
We‚Äôre witnessing a pivotal shift away from creating foundational models, and towards focusing on applications, infrastructure and agents. Large language models (LLMs) are quickly being commoditized.
Finding product-market fit in the crypto AI space is difficult. Many products are not fully functional or scalable yet.
For Crypto AI to succeed, it must deliver practical advantages like cost savings or efficiency, rather than relying on ideology alone.
Why Crypto?
Crypto‚Äôs true power lies in its ability to coordinate and incentivize at scale
AI is reaching the upper limits of publicly available data for training. This has sparked growing interest in how crypto could incentivize the creation and curation of new data sources.
Projects like EXO focus on edge compute to allow businesses to run AI models privately on-premise. This can be particularly valuable for sectors with strict privacy requirements (e.g., law firms, and biotech).
Advice for investors and builders? Investment in infrastructure (like GPUs or distributed compute) has been historically profitable, but there‚Äôs a push to think beyond copying past trends. Focus on solving real problems and not get too caught up in hype. Practical solutions will drive value.
Underrated and Overrated Areas in Crypto AI

Overrated

Privacy-focused products as a standalone feature: Privacy is more of a checkbox for regulatory compliance than a primary business driver.
Building new blockchains specifically for AI agents

Underrated

Hardware acceleration in the scaling of ZKML (Zero-Knowledge Machine Learning) and other verified compute applications
Crypto‚Äôs potential to streamline payments for AI agents
2. Google x Bittensor: Mogmachine

Here is @mogmachine's whole talk at the Google Toronto office

mog is the product visionary behind @taostats, the most critical product for the entire Bittensor community

In this talk, mog deep dives into Incentive Mechanism Design, which underlies everything happening in‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî angad (œÑ, œÑ) (@angad_ai)
8:13 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 7, 2024
Bittensor is essentially distributed compute at scale.
Subnets within Bittensor are like individual startups that operate independently. Each of the 52 subnets offers different capabilities: inference, data processing, and specialized computations like protein folding.
Subnets are evaluated based on performance, and those that provide higher value receive better rewards.
On Incentive Mechanisms in Bittensor
Incentive mechanisms are crucial for attracting participants to subnets and ensuring they perform tasks efficiently.
Dynamic incentive mechanisms are necessary to prevent stagnation and promote growth. Effective incentive mechanisms should not just reward participation but also quality and consistency of contributions.
Eg. weighting scores based on criteria like timeliness, engagement, and overall performance
There is a risk of participants ‚Äúgaming‚Äù the system by exploiting predictable incentive structures. To counter this, it is crucial to ensure diverse sources of evaluation and continuous updates to the scoring criteria.
The transition from synthetic tests (predefined evaluation criteria) to organic data (real-world usage) introduces complexity in designing fair and effective incentives.
On Trust and Decentralization
Emissions are currently determined by validators, which can introduce biases. Bittensor aims to shift toward a market-driven system where value is assigned dynamically based on demand.
dTAO (dynamic TAO) will allow participants to determine value in a more decentralized manner.
Some Tips for Miners & Subnet Owners
Learn from others' mistakes by thoroughly studying the code base rather than relying on standard practices.
Focus on leveraging Bittensor to develop practical, high-quality products, rather than just price prediction. Let‚Äôs be honest: if you could predict BTC prices precisely, you‚Äôd likely be running a hedge fund rather than working on Bittensor.
Bittensor allows anyone to participate. If you have a strong idea, you won‚Äôt need to fund your own GPUs. Bittensor will do so.
3. Google x Bittensor: Joseph Jacks
Here's @JosephJacks_ whole talk at the Google office on @opentensor and why he believes Bittensor is the next big thing

JJ's @OSSCapital manages $1B+ and he has done early investments in @calcom, @LiquidAI_, @Parallel¬†¬†amongst others

JJ outlines that his fund rarely does crypto‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî angad (œÑ, œÑ) (@angad_ai)
4:15 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 4, 2024
On Open Source Software
‚ÄúOpen source is eating software faster than software is eating the world‚Äù. Open source is advancing rapidly and outpacing the traditional software industry in many areas. This trend is driven by developers seeking open alternatives to popular proprietary software.
Shift in Software Industry: We‚Äôre seeing the evolution from traditional software distribution models to SaaS, and now to commercial open-source software
Commercial open-source companies operate under a ‚Äúloose coupling‚Äù model where the core technology is open and freely accessible, allowing external developers to contribute and monetize the technology.
Open-source businesses face unique challenges in monetizing free software. The business model often involves offering paid versions or complementary services.
On Bittensor
JJ‚Äôs core thesis for Bittensor is ‚ÄúWhat if anyone without the permission of any government, corporation, society or entity could contribute to and own the most capable AI that humanity could collectively create?‚Äù
Bittensor has no centralized ownership or pre-mine, distinguishing it from many other crypto projects. The founders hold <1% of the tokens.
Bittensor is incentivising the continued production of intelligence (similar to how Bitcoin is doing that for money)
His advice for TAO? Buy, hold it for 5 - 7 years and don‚Äôt trade, as it will be very volatile.
Introducing a stablecoin within the ecosystem could help mitigate this volatility.

That‚Äôs it! Saved you 2+ hours of time. Have a wonderful rest of the weekend.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

metadata.title: Are We Overhyping AI in Crypto?

title: Weekly AI Edge #16
description: JJ says that Bittensor is "undervalued by 20 - 50X"
author: Teng Yan,Josh
full_content:
GM!

Permissionless III has been buzzing in Salt Lake City, with the crypto crowd hopping between panels, parties, and pickleball games.

But while everyone‚Äôs having fun, the crypto markets are on shaky ground. So, I have to ask:

Can we get back to building great products people want to use, please?

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Bittensor‚Äôs mindshare grows
6079.ai and Wire Blockchain complete a merger
OpenGradient raises a $8.5M seed round
The Nobel committee jumps in on AI
ü¶ç State of the Market..
Source: Coingecko

‚Äç

The Crypto AI market sits at $26.6B, marking a slight 0.8% dip from last week. Most crypto sectors stayed quiet, with no big moves to shake things up.

TAO is holding strong, now at $562.

Bittensor is making waves beyond the charts. Mogmachine, the founder of Taostats and Corcel, gave a talk at Google Toronto, which even caught the attention of YouTube co-founder Steve Chen, who reposted it! With mindshare on the rise, the market is taking note.

NMT and QUBIC both took hits of -18% and -10% respectively this week, likely feeling the hangover from their late-September rallies (~30%) as speculators dial back the risk.

A quick recap of the past 30-Days:

TAO, VIRTUAL, COMAI, SNS, ENQAI were the top 30D performers in our Crypto AI token watchlist

On the other hand, NOA, AR, AGIX, OCEAN and AKT were the worst 30D performers. Still, it‚Äôs not a bad showing since AKT is only down 2%.

üìä Chart of the Week
Graphite AI: More Proof for TAO Incentives
Source: GraphiteAI

‚Äç

The chart above tracks miner scores from Graphite AI‚Äôs Subnet 43.

And it‚Äôs clear: the miners are leaving commercial models in the dust for graph optimization. The gap is growing wider, with the green line at the top representing the miner models, while the blue line below is the commercial benchmark struggling to keep up.

Subnet 43 was built to tackle graphical problems with finesse. Think of it as the ultimate solver for the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP)‚Äîa classic challenge of finding the shortest possible route through a set of cities and back again.

Potential use cases include planning travel itineraries or mapping out all the must-visit cafes in your area.

Source: GraphiteAI

The chart below shows miner models‚Äô upward trajectory over time. In September, they outperformed commercial models by ~1.8%. By October, that lead stretched to ~2.5%.

Considering Graphite AI‚Äôs Subnet 43 has only been around for two months, this progress is impressive. They‚Äôve scaled from tackling graph problems with just 250 nodes to handling challenges with 2,500‚Äì3,000 nodes. It‚Äôs a testament to how TAO incentives can motivate participants to reach new heights.

üå¥ AI Agents are the Onchain Future

HISTORIC day for Ai Layer Labs and @Wire_Blockchain. ¬†

We announced our merger along with many other updates. ü§ù

Check out @KenDicross ‚ÄúFreedom to Transact‚Äù speech below for updates üëá

‚Äî 6079.ai (@6079ai)
4:18 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 10, 2024

There‚Äôs a buzz building around AI agents taking over the bulk of on-chain transactions. Kalos (Parallel, Wayfinder) is making a bold claim: within a year, 90% of all transactions could be agent-driven.

6079.ai or AI Layer Labs and Wire Network just announced their merger to make this future a reality.

6079.ai‚Äôs Proof of Inference Protocol (PoIP) aims to deliver robust verification and security for decentralized AI inference. Meanwhile, Wire Network is building a gasless, interoperable blockchain network tailored specifically for AI agents.

Both believe that AI agents will soon dominate on-chain activity and are laying the infrastructure to make it happen.

Their first big move? A universal DEX that lets AI agents trade assets across chains without gas fees. But how can a network run without gas fees, you ask?

Ken‚Äôs got the answer: it all comes down to network ownership. Unlike the usual setup where users buy gas tokens (think SOL or ETH), Wire Network is flipping the script. Instead, users can purchase nodes and set the gas prices for transactions flowing through them.

If a node owner whitelists a specific smart contract, they‚Äôll cover the gas fees for users interacting with that contract.

Will we see more M&A activity in the Crypto AI space? Time will tell.

üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..
Source: OpenGradient

‚Äç

Fundraising

VanEck launches a $30M early-stage fund focusing on the intersection of fintech, crypto, and AI, with a special interest in the application layer
OpenGradient raises $8.5M in seed funding to build a decentralized platform for secure open-source AI with notable investors like a16z, Coinbase, and Foresight ventures.

Bittensor Spotlight

Mogmachine's full talk at the Google Toronto office about the Bittensor incentive mechanisms and community
Bittensor's impact extends beyond AI development: Subnet 2 Omron makes strides in ZK proof generation.
Mark Jeffrey suggests Bittensor could be the "Third Great Coin" alongside Bitcoin and Ethereum, citing Arca newsletter analysis.
Greg Osuri highlights how Bittensor and Akash work together but rejects the idea of Akash becoming a Bittensor Subnet
Omega Focus is a simple way to earn Bittensor by completing tasks on your computer; they‚Äôve distributed $7.5k USD worth of TAO
Masa shares statistics and miner earnings information for their Bittensor Subnet 42, which provides a network for real-time, structured data for AI
We found a comprehensive list of applications powered by Bittensor subnets

ALPHA ALERT: if you want to stay up-to-date on the Bittensor ecosystem, TAO Times is our favourite sibling newsletter to follow!

Project Updates

GM.ai provides a Q3 recap, highlighting the launch of their GM wallet, the introduction of Multi Agent, their Airdrop season 2, and their telegram app crossing 2M+ users
Based AI explains the delay in their burn launch due to contract sniping, ensuring a fair launch for users
Denarii Labs announces a dedicated accelerator with Wire Blockchain, opening applications for DeAI projects looking to launch tokens

Incentive / Rewards Programs

Sapien AI launches the Sapien Bounty program, offering USDC to complete challenges to build a network of human data labellers
Space and Time launches "Gigabrain's Mission to Space", a new community quest with daily tasks for participants.
Theoriq announces their incentivized testnet, inviting users to test AI Agents and earn rewards
Kaisar Network opens the waitlist for their Kasiar ZeroNode, teasing rewards for early access

Arweave

AO / Arweave announces a major upgrade to their AO Operating System, releasing AOS 2.0
Kyle_13 shares Arweave/AO Weekly Highlights, including $DAI deposits and Arweave Ecosystem Endowment Fund milestone
üß† Open Source Corner
Source: Reuters

‚Äç

It‚Äôs a big week for AI in the Nobel world.

The 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics went to John J. Hopfield and Geoffrey E. Hinton, recognizing their groundbreaking use of physics tools to lay the foundations for deep neural networks and modern day machine learning. Congrats to both of them!

But not everyone‚Äôs thrilled. There‚Äôs been some online chatter about whether they deserved the physics prize, given that their work leans more toward AI than traditional physics‚Äîleaving some other heavyweight contenders out in the cold.

Meanwhile, the Nobel Prize in Chemistry went to David Baker (for AI in computational protein design), Demis Hassabis (DeepMind co-founder) and John M. Jumper (AlphaFold creator)

Looks like even the Nobel committees are hopping on the AI hype train.

üî• On X..

Fraction AI announces breakthrough to improve model performance

Today, I'm excited to share a breakthrough from our team at @FractionAI_xyz ¬†that could redefine AI development.

We've created Gamified Adversarial Prompting (GAP), a decentralized platform that crowdsources labeled data, specifically targeting model weaknesses. The key? We've‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

structured_content.text: GM!
Permissionless III has been buzzing in Salt Lake City, with the crypto crowd hopping between panels, parties, and pickleball games.
But while everyone‚Äôs having fun, the crypto markets are on shaky ground. So, I have to ask:
Can we get back to building great products people want to use, please?
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Bittensor‚Äôs mindshare grows
6079.ai and Wire Blockchain complete a merger
OpenGradient raises a $8.5M seed round
The Nobel committee jumps in on AI
Bittensor‚Äôs mindshare grows
6079.ai and Wire Blockchain complete a merger
OpenGradient raises a $8.5M seed round
The Nobel committee jumps in on AI
ü¶ç State of the Market..
‚Äç
The Crypto AI market sits at $26.6B, marking a slight 0.8% dip from last week. Most crypto sectors stayed quiet, with no big moves to shake things up.
TAO is holding strong, now at $562.

Bittensor is making waves beyond the charts. Mogmachine, the founder of Taostats and Corcel, gave a talk at Google Toronto, which even caught the attention of YouTube co-founder Steve Chen, who reposted it! With mindshare on the rise, the market is taking note.
NMT and QUBIC both took hits of -18% and -10% respectively this week, likely feeling the hangover from their late-September rallies (~30%) as speculators dial back the risk.
A quick recap of the past 30-Days:
TAO, VIRTUAL, COMAI, SNS, ENQAI were the top 30D performers in our Crypto AI token watchlist
On the other hand, NOA, AR, AGIX, OCEAN and AKT were the worst 30D performers. Still, it‚Äôs not a bad showing since AKT is only down 2%.
üìä Chart of the Week
Graphite AI: More Proof for TAO Incentives
‚Äç
The chart above tracks miner scores from Graphite AI‚Äôs Subnet 43.

And it‚Äôs clear: the miners are leaving commercial models in the dust for graph optimization. The gap is growing wider, with the green line at the top representing the miner models, while the blue line below is the commercial benchmark struggling to keep up.

Subnet 43 was built to tackle graphical problems with finesse. Think of it as the ultimate solver for the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP)‚Äîa classic challenge of finding the shortest possible route through a set of cities and back again.
Potential use cases include planning travel itineraries or mapping out all the must-visit cafes in your area.
Source: GraphiteAI
The chart below shows miner models‚Äô upward trajectory over time. In September, they outperformed commercial models by ~1.8%. By October, that lead stretched to ~2.5%.

Considering Graphite AI‚Äôs Subnet 43 has only been around for two months, this progress is impressive. They‚Äôve scaled from tackling graph problems with just 250 nodes to handling challenges with 2,500‚Äì3,000 nodes. It‚Äôs a testament to how TAO incentives can motivate participants to reach new heights.
üå¥ AI Agents are the Onchain Future
HISTORIC day for Ai Layer Labs and @Wire_Blockchain.

We announced our merger along with many other updates. ü§ù

Check out @KenDicross ‚ÄúFreedom to Transact‚Äù speech below for updates üëá

‚Äî 6079.ai (@6079ai)
4:18 PM ‚Ä¢ Oct 10, 2024

There‚Äôs a buzz building around AI agents taking over the bulk of on-chain transactions. Kalos (Parallel, Wayfinder) is making a bold claim: within a year, 90% of all transactions could be agent-driven.
6079.ai or AI Layer Labs and Wire Network just announced their merger to make this future a reality.

6079.ai‚Äôs Proof of Inference Protocol (PoIP) aims to deliver robust verification and security for decentralized AI inference. Meanwhile, Wire Network is building a gasless, interoperable blockchain network tailored specifically for AI agents.
Both believe that AI agents will soon dominate on-chain activity and are laying the infrastructure to make it happen.
Their first big move? A universal DEX that lets AI agents trade assets across chains without gas fees. But how can a network run without gas fees, you ask?

Ken‚Äôs got the answer: it all comes down to network ownership. Unlike the usual setup where users buy gas tokens (think SOL or ETH), Wire Network is flipping the script. Instead, users can purchase nodes and set the gas prices for transactions flowing through them.
If a node owner whitelists a specific smart contract, they‚Äôll cover the gas fees for users interacting with that contract.
Will we see more M&A activity in the Crypto AI space? Time will tell.

title: Power Play: Data Centres & Semicon
description: Power is the primary constraint for the training of frontier models. And why China has a massive AI advantage
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
Happy Sunday!

Every now and then, I stumble on a podcast that feels like a 100x return on time spent because it interviews guests with specific domain knowledge that is difficult to find elsewhere. When I do so, I feel compelled to share it with you.

I just finished listening to the Dwarkesh Podcast, where he interviews two experts in the semiconductor space‚ÄîDylan Patel from Semianalysis (an AI hardware research firm) and Jon Y from Asianometry (popular YouTube creator on semiconductors).

This one isn‚Äôt specifically about Crypto AI, but it‚Äôs a fascinating listen if you‚Äôre interested in AI. It‚Äôll shape your views of how the future will play out. It‚Äôs worth the full 2-hours.

Now, I‚Äôm no semiconductor expert, but this episode gave me a whole new appreciation for how critical this space is to AI‚Äôs future‚Äîespecially when it comes to building data centres and scaling AI infrastructure.¬†

If you‚Äôre strapped for time, I took the liberty to summarize my key takeaways for you in a 5-minute read.

Power Demand and Data Centers
Training large AI foundational models requires massive computing resources, which is driving unprecedented power demand.
Power is often the primary constraint on scaling compute clusters. And it's not about the costs‚Äîrather, it's about the ability to generate new power to supply the data centres and governmental regulations around the use of power.
Data centres are being pushed to higher power limits, and their energy efficiency becomes critical in determining how many more FLOPS (floating-point operations per second) can be delivered. A 10-gigawatt data centre will not be far-fetched in the future.
One critical challenge in data centres is data movement, which consumes far more power than the computing operations themselves. Minimizing data movement and maximizing compute efficiency can lead to significant energy savings.
Architectural advancements, even if process nodes remain the same, have the potential to improve energy efficiency 100x. These architectural changes could allow data centres to deliver much more computing power without increasing energy consumption proportionally.
China‚Äôs Massive Advantage in AI
China‚Äôs capacity to rapidly scale its power infrastructure is a major advantage.
China can build large-scale power plants and substations quickly, allowing them to support immense data centres easily. For instance, China could potentially build a gigawatt-scale data centre around key areas like the Three Gorges Dam in six months.
By 2027, China could be operating data centres on the order of 10 gigawatts, far beyond what the U.S. is currently planning or capable of. This gives China a major advantage in training massive AI models on a centralized infrastructure.
In contrast, the U.S. faces significant challenges in building large-scale data centers due to power generation and distribution infrastructure limitations. The lack of substantial additions to the U.S. power grid means there is a bottleneck in the ability to support the next wave of AI compute scaling.
Insights on Semiconductor Manufacturing
Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC)‚Äôs recipe for semiconductor innovation is highly secretive and involves multivariable problems requiring intense experimentation. TSMC is the largest chip foundry in the world.
Refining semiconductor manufacturing relies heavily on tacit knowledge, often passed down in a secretive apprentice-master style. This has allowed Taiwan to continue dominating the semiconductor industry.
The semiconductor industry is highly fragmented, with various companies dominating different parts of the value chain. This fragmentation means vertical integration has been largely abandoned in favour of specialization. Each component, from chemicals to specific types of chips, has only a few competitors.
Corporate espionage within the semiconductor industry is rampant. Chinese hackers have infiltrated key players like ASML, which create lithography systems essential in chip manufacturing. China‚Äôs semiconductor industry has relied on poaching Taiwanese talent from TSMC.
Rising Costs of Advanced Nodes
Progressing to smaller semiconductor process nodes (e.g., 7nm to 5nm to 3nm, nm = nanometers) has become increasingly expensive and complex. Due to the sheer costs involved, the economic justification for smaller nodes like 2nm is questionable.
Historically, Moore‚Äôs Law allowed consistent scaling, but the benefits of moving to the next smaller node (in terms of power efficiency and performance) are diminishing while the costs have skyrocketed. For example, moving from 5nm to 3nm only yields about a 30% improvement in logic scaling and approximately 20% improvement in power per transistor, which is much smaller than the gains seen in earlier transitions.
The next node improvement (e.g., N2/2nm) requires massive aggregated demand across many companies to fund the development and manufacturing process. The scaling costs are no longer justifiable for most players unless they have immense concentrated spending power (e.g., Apple with iPhones or AI driving massive demand for leading-edge chips)
The rise of AI is one of the few economic forces actually making advanced nodes like 2nm viable. AI‚Äôs insatiable demand for more efficient compute and higher-density chips is driving investment into leading-edge semiconductor manufacturing.

Hope you found it as insightful as I did.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

title: Weekly AI Edge #15
description: 23andWe DataDAO launches to aggregate genetic data from....23andMe
author: Josh,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Crypto AI stumbles from the selloff
23andMe‚Äôs valuable genetic data up for grabs
Our favourite tweets on X

While this made us laugh, we hope the Crypto AI projects don‚Äôt start following suit.

Introducing AverageEditorAI, the open source AI powered code editor, making Development process 6.9x faster and reducing debugging efforts by 420%

It's a fork of ¬†BlueberryAI, which is fork of PearAI, which is a fork of Continue, which is a fork of VSCode ¬†

Investors please no‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Average Engineer (@AverageProMax)
7:54 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 29, 2024
ü¶ç State of the Market..
Source: Coingecko

‚Äç

What a rollercoaster!

The Crypto AI market had a rough week, dropping 21.2% to $24.8B, down from $31.5B last week. It was one of the worst performers, especially compared to DeFi (-8.7%) and Memes (-8%).

News of escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, coupled with the looming election season, has the market on edge.

Surprisingly, TAO has shown remarkable strength. Its price remains at $559, a 4% rise from last week. The Bittensor community has strong hands, clearly. ü§öü§ö

The rest of the Crypto AI market stumbled, with tokens like NEAR, NMT, and ASI all suffering 15% drops.

One token that has received a lot of attention is Morphware‚Äôs token XMW.

It‚Äôs skyrocketed 158% in the last seven days, showing how quickly low liquidity tokens can experience sharp gains. Morphware is an AI project built as a Layer 3 on Starknet, offering compute at lower prices thanks to access to Paraguay‚Äôs renewable energy.

There‚Äôs been a wave of influencer shills on X, likely driving the recent pump. After diving into the documentation, we didn‚Äôt find much to get excited about yet‚Äîso tread carefully if you‚Äôre trading it!

üìä Chart of the Week
AI Is Taking Over Our Jobs
Source: The Short Term Effects of Generative AI on Employment

‚Äç

In August, researchers from NYU dropped a fascinating study that digs into the ripple effects of generative AI on the freelance market, specifically using data from UpWork, a major freelancing platform.

The findings paint a clear picture: freelancers are feeling the squeeze.

According to the study, freelancers have seen a 2% dip in the number of monthly jobs (Panel A) and a 5% drop in monthly revenue (Panel B) over the past year. These are real financial pain points if you‚Äôre making your living through freelance work.

As AI continues to improve, everyone is going to feel the impact, and it‚Äôs not just the creatives.

The pace of change will only accelerate.

üå¥ 23andMe‚Ä¶.Or 23andWe?

Over the past week, many people have been discussing 23andMe‚Äôs decline and what it means for 15 million users‚Äô genetic data. Most disconcerting is that those 15 million users have no control over what happens to their data next.

Rumours have swirled about various SPACs being spun up to acquire the company. But the latest news is that CEO Anne Wojcicki plans to take the company private and is not considering third-party offers.

How about setting up a Bittensor subnet to train AI on this data?

Someone should acquire @23andMe (stock is valued at $150M today), open source the data and bootstrap a genetics subnet on Bittensor with the newly unlocked DNA database of 15 million human genotypes. The incentive mechanism would reward contributions to this open database. üß¨

‚Äî JJ (@JosephJacks_)
6:13 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 28, 2024

This week, a Data DAO called 23andWe launched on Vana, offering users a chance to upload their 23andMe data files in exchange for tokens. These tokens give users governance rights over how their data is used.

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Crypto AI stumbles from the selloff
23andMe‚Äôs valuable genetic data up for grabs
Our favourite tweets on X
Crypto AI stumbles from the selloff
23andMe‚Äôs valuable genetic data up for grabs
Our favourite tweets on X
While this made us laugh, we hope the Crypto AI projects don‚Äôt start following suit.

Introducing AverageEditorAI, the open source AI powered code editor, making Development process 6.9x faster and reducing debugging efforts by 420%

It's a fork of ¬†BlueberryAI, which is fork of PearAI, which is a fork of Continue, which is a fork of VSCode ¬†

Investors please no‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Average Engineer (@AverageProMax)
7:54 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 29, 2024
ü¶ç State of the Market..
‚Äç
What a rollercoaster!
The Crypto AI market had a rough week, dropping 21.2% to $24.8B, down from $31.5B last week. It was one of the worst performers, especially compared to DeFi (-8.7%) and Memes (-8%).
News of escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, coupled with the looming election season, has the market on edge.
Surprisingly, TAO has shown remarkable strength. Its price remains at $559, a 4% rise from last week. The Bittensor community has strong hands, clearly. ü§öü§ö
The rest of the Crypto AI market stumbled, with tokens like NEAR, NMT, and ASI all suffering 15% drops.
One token that has received a lot of attention is Morphware‚Äôs token XMW.

It‚Äôs skyrocketed 158% in the last seven days, showing how quickly low liquidity tokens can experience sharp gains. Morphware is an AI project built as a Layer 3 on Starknet, offering compute at lower prices thanks to access to Paraguay‚Äôs renewable energy.

There‚Äôs been a wave of influencer shills on X, likely driving the recent pump. After diving into the documentation, we didn‚Äôt find much to get excited about yet‚Äîso tread carefully if you‚Äôre trading it!
üìä Chart of the Week
AI Is Taking Over Our Jobs
‚Äç

In August, researchers from NYU dropped a fascinating study that digs into the ripple effects of generative AI on the freelance market, specifically using data from UpWork, a major freelancing platform.
The findings paint a clear picture: freelancers are feeling the squeeze.

According to the study, freelancers have seen a 2% dip in the number of monthly jobs (Panel A) and a 5% drop in monthly revenue (Panel B) over the past year. These are real financial pain points if you‚Äôre making your living through freelance work.
As AI continues to improve, everyone is going to feel the impact, and it‚Äôs not just the creatives.
The pace of change will only accelerate.
üå¥ 23andMe‚Ä¶.Or 23andWe?

Over the past week, many people have been discussing 23andMe‚Äôs decline and what it means for 15 million users‚Äô genetic data. Most disconcerting is that those 15 million users have no control over what happens to their data next.

Rumours have swirled about various SPACs being spun up to acquire the company. But the latest news is that CEO Anne Wojcicki plans to take the company private and is not considering third-party offers.
How about setting up a Bittensor subnet to train AI on this data?

Someone should acquire @23andMe (stock is valued at $150M today), open source the data and bootstrap a genetics subnet on Bittensor with the newly unlocked DNA database of 15 million human genotypes. The incentive mechanism would reward contributions to this open database. üß¨

‚Äî JJ (@JosephJacks_)
6:13 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 28, 2024

This week, a Data DAO called 23andWe launched on Vana, offering users a chance to upload their 23andMe data files in exchange for tokens. These tokens give users governance rights over how their data is used.

The potential for aggregating healthcare data directly from consumers is massive, but there‚Äôs a huge friction point: personal health data is notoriously difficult to access. Just try requesting your old X-ray from a hospital.
If a team can crack the code‚Äîwhether through engineering or clever incentives‚Äîthe opportunity in healthcare data is staggering.
üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..

title: Weekly AI Edge #14
description: Vana raises $25M to satisfy AI's data hunger
author: Josh,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Bittensor leads the Crypto AI market with a 30% rise this week
AI‚Äôs getting ‚Äòhangry‚Äô for data!
Vana raises total funding to $25M
Our favourite tweets on X

BTW: We‚Äôve been crafting our Crypto AI thesis for many weeks, and it's almost ready.

We explain why Crypto AI is the most compelling opportunity today, how the future might unfold, and ways to capture value.

It will be released in three parts. Part I will drop on Monday. But¬†here‚Äôs a teaser¬†for our loyal readers‚Äîmore on this soon!

ü¶ç State of the Market..
Source: Coingecko

‚Äç

Alt season is here, baby!

The Crypto AI market cap surged to $31.5B this week, marking a whopping 35% increase (!!) over the last two weeks.

Crypto AI is one of the top-performing sectors this month, alongside memes, data availability protocols, and parallelized EVMs.

Leading the charge to Valhalla was TAO, skyrocketing 70% in just two weeks, fueling lots of Bittensor chatter and mindshare on Crypto Twitter.

Several tokens with market caps over $100M saw impressive gains: Delysium (AGI, +46%), Solidus Ai Tech (AITECH, +41%), and Spectral (SPEC, +34%).

Some of this is probably a spillover effect from TAO‚Äôs surge as traders move down the spectrum to chase lower-cap AI tokens for higher returns. There is clearly a risk-on sentiment in the market right now.

Price (7-day Change)

FDV

Bittensor TAO

$543.82 (29.2%)

$11.4B

Near NEAR

$5.65 (26.9%)

$6.6B

Delysium AGI

$0.196 (46.9%)

$588M

Spectral SPEC

$9.38 (34.7%)

$938M

¬†üìä Chart of the Week
TAO Emissions: Robust or Worrying?
Source: TaoStats

‚Äç

‚ÄçHere‚Äôs a look at Bittensor‚Äôs emission schedule:

TAO follows a halvening schedule similar to BTC, with the first halvening set for November 16, 2025.

Right now, 35% of the total TAO is already in circulation (7.5M TAO). By the time of the next halvening, there will be 10.5M TAO in circulation‚Äîan increase of 3M TAO, or 40% of the current supply, over the next year.

With the large unlocks we‚Äôve seen in the past year for projects like AltLayer, Arbitrum, Optimism, that has put a dampener on token prices, we can understand the anxiety.

As Emad points out:

To put this in context $TAO issuance over the next year or so is enough to pay for the 100,000 H100s @xai is using for that period, fastest supercomputer on earth

About 4x H100s @OpenAI used for GPT-4o

Web3 can easily provision mega compute

Let‚Äôs hope holders allocate it well

‚Äî Emad (@EMostaque)
12:17 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 26, 2024

There are two ways to look at this‚Äîit‚Äôs a massive pool of resources Bittensor can use for AI development. If used wisely, Bittensor will thrive. If not‚Ä¶ well, we‚Äôve seen what happens.

üå¥ AI is ‚ÄòHangry‚Äô for Data!

We‚Äôre approaching a wall regarding publicly scrapable data for AI training.

Rob from Volt Capital suggests that the problem may not be creating new data but accessing it.

We are hitting the limit on what can be publicly scraped.

Paths Forward:
1Ô∏è. coordinate to create new data
2Ô∏è. use synthetic data
3Ô∏è. generate data independently

Key Distinctions:
> how it‚Äôs created (real vs synthetic)
> who creates it (partnerships vs solo)
> incentives‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Rob (@rsarrow)
2:40 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 26, 2024

Platforms like Vana aim to solve this by enabling users to control and monetize their private data through dataDAOs. Users can submit their personal data, such as tweets, posts, and emails, to a dataDAO and be rewarded for it.

Synthetic data is already supplementing AI training. For example, Nous Research used synthetic data to train their Hermes LLMs, and Dria helps AI agents generate synthetic data for similar purposes. As real data becomes scarce, synthetic data will play a bigger role.

There‚Äôs also a need for more high-quality, organic data. Sapien AI believes that data labeling will become a major gig economy, with ‚Äúfrontier data‚Äù‚Äîhigh-quality, insightful information‚Äîbecoming increasingly valuable. For instance, a doctor‚Äôs diagnostic process is an example of such valuable data.

As we near the limits of scrapable data, demand for private, high-quality, and synthetic data will grow.

üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..

Source: Vana

Fundraising

Vana announced a $25M in total funding from notable investors like Coinbase, Paradigm, and Polychain. (Check out our previous research on Vana)
Grass announces a Series A funding led by Hack VC. Aylo reports on Grass's Series A funding, valuing the company at ~$1B

Project Updates

Sentient releases their whitepaper on OML for AI entrepreneurship, discussing open vs closed model deployment paradigms
Chasm Network‚Äôs Scout Node Sale sells out in 6 minutes upon launch
Kuzco's Sam Hogan announces inference.net, a wholesaler of open-source LLM inference tokens
Hyperspace introduces Play, an AI research product using Groq and Meta's Llama3.1
Allora Network announces v0.5.0 release with improvements to user experience and network performance
CrunchDAO announces their token launch on Solana
BasedAI introduces their privacy-first decentralized AI solution
Gaia introduces Gaia Domain Names (GDN) for AI projects on the Gaia network
Prime Intellect teases an upcoming platform for contributing compute power to decentralized training

Incentives / Rewards Programs

Fluence Network launches a staking program for decentralized cloud computing

Bittensor

xponentcrisis shares insights from the Bittensor Asia Meetup at Token 2049
œÑaonomics announces upcoming Ethereum smart contracts on Bittensor
Tensorplex Labs introduces Tensorplex Delegate for TAO holders, offering 15% APR and weight assignment features
Macrocosmos releases V1.0.0 for subnet 25 Protein Folding
Sami Kassab discusses Œ© Focus, a one-click Bittensor mining solution that pays users for focusing on priority tasks
Seth Bloomberg analyzes Bittensor's network effects and shares his concerns.

Wayfinder

Kalos demonstrates AIWayfinder's capabilities in creating complex smart contracts He also demos creating a smart contract using AIWayfinder, integrating Chainlink VRF and deploying it to Base
üî• On X..

No crypto AI companies in YC - can someone fix this please?

Hearing the latest Y Combinator batch has 69 AI companies and no crypto companies.

Great sign that now is the absolute best time to be building consumer crypto apps. Popular sentiment in Silicon Valley is always dead wrong.

‚Äî Nick Tomaino (@NTmoney)
8:56 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 23, 2024

Sama outlines the bright future ahead for AI

The Intelligence Age:

‚Äî Sam Altman (@sama)
5:00 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 23, 2024

OpenAI CTO leaves. Is this a sign of trouble in the company?

I shared the following note with the OpenAI team today.

‚Äî Mira Murati (@miramurati)
7:34 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 25, 2024

DMD releases a 26-page report on Bittensor

Over the last month I've been writing an in-depth report on Bittensor. The goal is to explain its unique design and why I believe TAO will be one of the best performers this cycle.

The report can be accessed here:

A thread to summarise my findingsüßµ

‚Äî DMD (@Daveeemor)
4:39 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 23, 2024

Matthew Sigel shares Novogratz's explanation of AI and crypto intersection

Great Explanation of Intersection of AI & Crypto

by @novogratz

‚Äî matthew sigel, recovering CFA (@matthew_sigel)
4:12 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 13, 2024

‚Äî Jeff Amico (@_jamico)
5:00 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 23, 2024


Bagel Network discusses prompt-based unlearning techniques for enhancing AI privacy

Prompt-Based Unlearning: Pioneering Selective Forgetting in AI

In our recent blog post on machine unlearning, we explore how cutting-edge techniques are reshaping AI privacy by enabling systems to "forget" sensitive information without compromising their overall functionality.‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî Bagel ü•Ø (@bagel_network)
5:09 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 24, 2024

Fish | Datura demonstrates renting H100 GPUs from Bittensor miners within one minute

Thanks @opentensor for having me on novelty search today.
Demo of renting H100 GPUs from bittensor miners within 1 minute here:

‚Äî Fish | Datura (@fish_datura)
11:09 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 26, 2024

Varun Mathur introduces a new agent interface to reduce AI costs

A breakthrough new agent interface

How do you reduce the price of advanced AI while scaling and increasing the intelligence of the system ? Are $20/month subscription plans, like for OpenAI's o1 model today, the only option for billions of us on this planet ?

At @HyperspaceAI‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Varun (@varun_mathur)
10:22 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 12, 2024

That‚Äôs it for this week! If you have specific feedback or anything interesting you‚Äôd like to share, please just reply to this email. We read everything.

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Joshua

About 4x H100s @OpenAI used for GPT-4o

Web3 can easily provision mega compute

Let‚Äôs hope holders allocate it well

‚Äî Emad (@EMostaque)
12:17 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 26, 2024
There are two ways to look at this‚Äîit‚Äôs a massive pool of resources Bittensor can use for AI development. If used wisely, Bittensor will thrive. If not‚Ä¶ well, we‚Äôve seen what happens.
üå¥ AI is ‚ÄòHangry‚Äô for Data!
We‚Äôre approaching a wall regarding publicly scrapable data for AI training.
Rob from Volt Capital suggests that the problem may not be creating new data but accessing it.

We are hitting the limit on what can be publicly scraped.

Paths Forward:
1Ô∏è. coordinate to create new data
2Ô∏è. use synthetic data
3Ô∏è. generate data independently

Key Distinctions:
> how it‚Äôs created (real vs synthetic)
> who creates it (partnerships vs solo)
> incentives‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Rob (@rsarrow)
2:40 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 26, 2024

Platforms like Vana aim to solve this by enabling users to control and monetize their private data through dataDAOs. Users can submit their personal data, such as tweets, posts, and emails, to a dataDAO and be rewarded for it.

Synthetic data is already supplementing AI training. For example, Nous Research used synthetic data to train their Hermes LLMs, and Dria helps AI agents generate synthetic data for similar purposes. As real data becomes scarce, synthetic data will play a bigger role.

There‚Äôs also a need for more high-quality, organic data. Sapien AI believes that data labeling will become a major gig economy, with ‚Äúfrontier data‚Äù‚Äîhigh-quality, insightful information‚Äîbecoming increasingly valuable. For instance, a doctor‚Äôs diagnostic process is an example of such valuable data.
As we near the limits of scrapable data, demand for private, high-quality, and synthetic data will grow.
üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..
