title: Weekly AI Edge #13
description: Pin AI raises $10M in funding. Open AI releases a Strawberry!?
author: Josh,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM! Are you ready for the craziness of another Token 2049 week? We sure are not. üòÖ

Btw if you‚Äôre still deciding what to attend, Brody curated a great¬†list¬†of AI/DePIN events for next week.

We‚Äôll be at several of those events, so come say Hi!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

CUDOS poised to join the Artificial Superintelligence Alliance, price drops 10%
OpenAI releases a‚Ä¶ Strawberry? üçì
Pin AI raises $10M in pre-seed funding for personal AI
Our favourite tweets on X
ü¶ç State of the Market..

Source: Coingecko

The overall Crypto AI market has risen 8.6% from $21B to $23.3B this week.

The AI agents subcategory (Coingecko) saw an impressive 20% jump, driven largely by gains in FET and AGIX.

A big part of the buzz comes from the Artificial Superintelligence Alliance (ASI), with news that CUDOS may soon join.¬†

This news has pushed up token prices for ASI, AGIX, and OCEAN by at least 23%, while CUDOS has dropped about 10% since last week. It seems ASI is quickly becoming an AI conglomerate, absorbing any AI-related project it needs

‚Äç

¬†üìä Chart of the Week
Hermes 3 Nears 1B Tokens Processed Daily
Source: Teknium1

‚Äç

Recent activity on Nous Research‚Äôs flagship Hermes 3 405B model has reached almost 1B tokens processed daily on OpenRouter. This suggests that the demand for open-source models is significant and steadily growing.

They‚Äôve shown significant performance in alignment with the user, multi-turn conversations, RAG, and other features.

FYI: We released a report on Nous Research earlier this week. Fresh from the oven.

üçì Open AI Launches a Strawberry
Source: @DrJimFan

‚Äç

OpenAI just released its latest model, o1 (codename: Strawberry), and the biggest shift? It takes its time to think.

This makes it particularly suited for more complex, planning-heavy tasks‚Äîthink solving crossword puzzles or tackling problems that require deep reasoning, like a PhD student in physics or biology might.

You‚Äôll notice it‚Äôs slower, taking more time to generate responses. We‚Äôre seeing the concept of inference-time scaling finally being put into production.

Inference-time scaling is the new buzzword in AI.

The idea is to improve AI performance by increasing the compute during inference rather than constantly training larger and larger models.

If this picks up ‚Äî expect the demand for GPUs to ramp up massively soon.

üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..
Source: Pin AI

‚Äç

Project Updates

PIN AI raises $10M in pre seed funding to launch the world‚Äôs first open platform for personal AI. Notable investors like a16z, Hack VC, and angels like Illia of NEAR participated
Flock.io, the decentralised ML data network and recipient of the Ethereum Foundation Research Grant, releases their whitepaper
Peaq Network announces that they are launching this month
Mentals AI is garnering attention with their markdown AI agents
Hyperbolic partners with Black Forest Labs to bring FLUX text-to-image to Hyperbolic‚Äôs AI cloud
Parallel TCG‚Äôs cofounder Kalos summarizes all of the recent updates
Topology Ventures, an AI native venture firm, is hiring a technical investor (great opportunity imho)

Incentives / Rewards Programs

Almanak, a project building AI agents for DeFi, launches their alpha testing and points program
Ora Protocol‚Äôs points program went live on September 11th. They also released Tora, a node program that anyone can run to secure Ora network and earn points
Sapien, a data labelling platform, is running an incentivized alpha where users can earn points
Privasea allocates 10% of tokens for their airdrop; caveat is that you have to download their mobile app and verify yourself

Arweave / AO

Arweave / AO weekly highlights summarized by Kyle_13
AO crosses $50M in DAI deposits
Meka City, built on Reality Protocol from AO, goes live. Meka City is an NFT gated game built on AO

Bittensor

Miner‚Äôs Union receives 113K TAO ($29.4M) from the Bittensor foundation for validation on various subnets
Bittensor releases Child Hotkeys, creating more decentralization and the ability to delegate from one hotkey to many
Omega Labs, subnet 24 on Bittensor, is processing Any-to-Any for text, audio, and video in the same model. Their new Focus App incentives users to contribute for better training
Ventura Labs writes about Bittensor Subnet 38, specially built for distributed training
Fiber, a newly released protocol, is purpose-built to shortcut the process of building Bittensor subnets
Macrocosmos releases a full testnet for OpenMM, a key step towards releasing their flagship TaoFold
üå¥¬†A Reflection on Reflection 70B
Source: Matt Shumer

‚Äç

On September 6th, Matt Shumer, CEO of Otherside AI, unveiled Reflection 70B, claiming it was competitive with top closed-source models like Claude 3.5 Sonnet and even outperformed them on several benchmarks.

The secret behind this impressive performance was ‚ÄúReflection tuning,‚Äù a technique that allows LLMs to iterate over their responses and correct mistakes before delivering them to the user.

Excitement was high‚Äîuntil some users began questioning its legitimacy. Skepticism grew over its near-perfect GSM8K score (99%!) and suspicions that the private API Shumer provider might just be a wrapper for Claude 3.5.

Speculation surfaced that Shumer was using the hype around Reflection 70B to boost the value of his investments.

The backlash from the community was swift, leading to Reflection 70B being removed from OpenRouter and Shumer issuing an apology.

Some learning points:

Don‚Äôt believe everything you see!
Simple ‚Äúhacks‚Äù like Reflection turning will probably not lead to outsized performance gains.

This whole episode highlights the increasing demand for accountability and transparency in AI. Verifiable inference FTW.

Reflecting on Reflection 70B: Was It worth the Hype?

On September 6th, 2024, Matt Shumer introduced Reflection 70B, a model he claimed to be the world‚Äôs top open-source large language model (LLM), outperforming leading models such as Claude 3.5 Sonnet, GPT-4o, and Llama 3.1 405B‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Hyperbolic (@hyperbolic_labs)
12:13 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 11, 2024
üî• On X..

Apple Intelligence for iPhone 16. Will you make the switch?

Apple just announced its Apple Intelligence features for iPhone 16.

The 8 most impressive demos:

1. Apple Intelligence accessing the iPhone's camera for 'Visual Intelligence' on any surroundings

‚Äî Rowan Cheung (@rowancheung)
8:14 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 9, 2024

Nillion Cofounder on Privacy Enhancing Technologies in Web 3

I was asked the other day why I co-founded the @nillionnetwork

‚ÄçPart of the answer is in one of our early slides:

Web 1 was mostly public.

Privacy became a core enabling factor that drove web 2‚Äôs growth into a multi-trillion-dollar market. Almost no web 2 application would be‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äç‚Äî Miguel de Vega (@miguel_de_vega)
7:44 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 8, 2024

Alex Wacy writes about Compute Labs

Imagine the market today without the AI x DePIN industry - impossible, right?

But as a leading force, few projects break through to become unicorns.

Looking for a future unicorn?

My pick is Compute Labsüßµ‚¨áÔ∏è

‚Äî AlŒûx Wacy üåê (@wacy_time1)
9:42 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 10, 2024

LLMs will always hallucinate.

"LLMs Will Always Hallucinate, and We Need to Live With This" - ü§îü§î

Key points from the paper.¬†¬†üëá

üß† Hallucinations in LLMs not just mistakes, but inherent property. Arise from undecidable problems in training and usage process. Can't be fully eliminated through architectural‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Rohan Paul (@rohanpaul_ai)
12:02 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 12, 2024

Brendan Farmer on when compute needs to be verified

It's worth asking when computation needs to be verified.

- When the transfer of value depends on the result of a computation.

It's not realistic to use verifiable compute (either ZK, fraud proofs, cryptoeconomic security, etc) for all computations imo. If there is a problem‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Brendan Farmer (@_bfarmer)
2:24 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 11, 2024

Jasper Zhang of Hyperbolic breaks down AI Benchmarks - GSM8K

Understanding AI Benchmarks - GSM8K

@mattshumer_‚Äôs Reflection Llama model was released two days ago, achieving higher metrics on several popular benchmarks compared to GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and Llama 3.1 405B. Notably, the post claimed the model reached a score of 99.2% on‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Jasper ü§òüå™Ô∏è (@zjasper666)
3:18 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 8, 2024

Ben Fielding on Human and Machine knowledge curation

üßµ Human <> machine knowledge curation

Machine learning provides us with a vastly improved way of storing and interacting with knowledge in a digital form.

To do this, we need new basic operations and those new basic operations need machines to perform them.

‚Äî Ben Fielding (@fenbielding)
7:00 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 9, 2024

That‚Äôs it for this week! If you have specific feedback or anything interesting you‚Äôd like to share, please just reply to this email. We read everything.

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Joshua

This newsletter is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investment choices

2:24 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 11, 2024
Jasper Zhang of Hyperbolic breaks down AI Benchmarks - GSM8K

Understanding AI Benchmarks - GSM8K

@mattshumer_‚Äôs Reflection Llama model was released two days ago, achieving higher metrics on several popular benchmarks compared to GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and Llama 3.1 405B. Notably, the post claimed the model reached a score of 99.2% on‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Jasper ü§òüå™Ô∏è (@zjasper666)
3:18 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 8, 2024
Ben Fielding on Human and Machine knowledge curation

üßµ Human <> machine knowledge curation

Machine learning provides us with a vastly improved way of storing and interacting with knowledge in a digital form.

To do this, we need new basic operations and those new basic operations need machines to perform them.

‚Äî Ben Fielding (@fenbielding)

title: Weekly AI Edge #12
description: Grass just announced its 1st airdrop. Here's what we think.
author: Josh,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

The crypto market sell-off continues, but CXT shines
Autonolas agentic activity returns to yearly highs
What‚Äôs going on with the Grass airdrop
Our favourite tweets on X
We‚Äôre all for inter-galaxy model training üòÄ¬†

nice so once we solved training models across the world at @PrimeIntellect we can start working on inter galaxy training

‚Äî samsja (@samsja19)
11:12 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 4, 2024
ü¶ç State of the Market..

Source: Coingecko

The Crypto AI market cap dropped from $22.7B to $21B this week, marking a 7.5% decrease, in line with sell-offs across crypto.

NVIDIA‚Äôs decline also continues, with its stock falling 17% to $106 over the past five days. It seems Crypto AI, along with the broader market, is following suit.

With the increasing likelihood of a 50 bps Fed rate cut later this month, there‚Äôs hope it could help reignite the markets.

One token that bucked the trend is CXT, rising 24% over the week. The Covalent project recently rebranded to focus on AI and long-term data availability on Ethereum. A Messari report released on August 16th could have fueled CXT‚Äôs price surge over the past two weeks.

‚Äç

¬†üìä Chart of the Week
Autonolas Agent Activity Returns to Highs
Source: Autonolas

‚Äç

Autonolas Agent activity returns to its highs of this year. The number of monthly service transactions crossed 150K in August, almost reaching the peak of 155K earlier in May of this year.

These transactions consist of DeFi trades, prediction markets, governance, and more, all performed by AI Agents.

Autonolas has recently partnered with Aizel Network and Nevermind.IO to provide verifiability and payments to their AI agents. In addition, they have released Pearl for Windows- their app that enables running AI agents and staking of OLAS.

üå¥ Grass Airdrop Disappoints Many

Grass just announced its first airdrop, and you can check your allocations here

Quick facts:

1 billion total tokens
10% of tokens distributed in the first airdrop
No token launch date or detailed tokenomics released yet

Grass is building an AI data layer by scraping internet data using people‚Äôs computers. You download a Chrome or desktop extension, keep it connected, and it uses a small amount of bandwidth for scraping.

One of our nodes, active 24/7 since June, received ~110 GRASS tokens. Others have received under 50 GRASS. While GRASS isn‚Äôt live yet, it‚Äôs trading on Aevo‚Äôs premarket at $0.25.

This disappointed many because it translates to less than $5 per month for a 24/7 active node‚Äîjust about enough to cover electricity costs.

The barrier to entry is low, so millions of nodes participated, diluting the distribution. Participation could drop off after the token generation event (TGE) if many realize it‚Äôs not worth the effort, leading to an eventual equilibrium.

This highlights the challenge DePIN projects face in getting their economics right.

üèÜ Caught Our Eyes..

Skyfire‚Äôs 2024 roadmap. Source: @chiefaioffice

Project Updates

Skyfire raises an $8.5M seed round allowing AI to pay and purchase on behalf of humans
Nectar AI raises a $3.9M seed round to build uncensored immersive AI companions. Mechanism Capital and Karatage led the round with several angels like Arthur Hayes through Maelstrom.
FLock.io, building federated machine learning on the blockchain, is the recipient of an Ethereum Foundation Research Grant
Wayfinder releases three updates to assist with AI agent function creation, transaction simulation, and security
Yai releases its Oracle Beta Bot providing BTC price predictions to Yai community members
Creator Bid releases version 2 of its platform, the ultimate AI Creator Agent Launchpad with more features to fine-tune your AI creator agent
Open Gradient posts an AI inference proof to Celestia‚Äôs DA
Allora crosses 45,000 workers on their network. Workers run ML models contributing to Allora‚Äôs collective intelligence.
IO net announces its long-term plans to disrupt the cloud industry

Incentives / Rewards Programs

Inferium is running an incentivized campaign on Galxe
Sahara launches the Prometheus Program for 2,000 early product testers
OG Labs Testnet Newton v2 is live with incentives and rewards for users
Eidon AI announces an incentive program in their discord to receive a unique role
Neuromesh announces a Reward Quest to unlock mystery boxes with up to $1000 USDT in prizes

Arweave / AO

See these emerging projects from Arweave‚Äôs AO incubator
Autonomous Finance releases new tooling called AO Form. This allows users to deploy and upgrade multiprocess systems quickly and seamlessly
AO crosses $40M in deposits of DAI

Bittensor

Rivus announces its relaunch of the RIVUS token to be on September 15th
Blocmates debuts a new weekly show that covers all the latest updates for Bittensor
Bitmind achieves a 13% improvement over their initial base miner for deep fake detection
Sami Kassab launches taopill.ai, a hub for discovering, learning, and staying updated on Bittensor subnets
Timeless announces several updates for their Automated Trading feature using Taoshi
Dippy, powered by subnet 11, crosses 280K monthly active users
üß† Open Source Corner

This week‚Äôs big news in the open-source AI world: a new contender has arrived!

Reflection 70B, built by Matt Schumer, CEO of HyperWrite, is making waves by outperforming Claude Sonnet 3.5 on several key benchmarks, despite being a smaller model.¬†

Trained on high-quality synthetic data, Reflection 70B sets itself apart by iterating over its outputs ‚Äî detecting and correcting errors in its own reasoning before delivering the final result to the user.

The trade-off? This reflection process consumes a lot of tokens, making it slower and potentially more expensive.

The 405B parameter model is set to be released next week - we‚Äôll see how it performs!

üî• On X..

Brody recaps Crypto AI startup funding for August

Month of August DeAI fundraising recap

Total funding for the month for projects sits at around $190+ million:

> @SpaceandTimeDB raised $20 million, bringing their total fundraising to $50 million, to build its decentralized data warehouse with embedded AI tooling &‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî brody ‚ô®Ô∏è (@brodyadreon)
4:07 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 3, 2024

Ben Fielding describes the three eras of foundation models

üßµThree eras of foundation models

1. The recent past - demonstration of the capabilities of AI.

2. The present - incremental improvements to efficiency of training and inference.

3. The future - continual learning on live data for a constant representation of the world state.

‚Äî Ben Fielding (@fenbielding)
10:23 PM ‚Ä¢ Aug 31, 2024

Virtuals Protocol releases their paper: an infinite Super Mario Brothers game using generative AI.

Infinite Super Mario Brothers from an AI image generator trained with a single consumer-grade GPU (it took 48 hours)

Give it a command (run, jump) and it generates the next frame, simulating the games physics & continuing forever. Diffusion is something. virtual-protocol.github.io/mario-videogam‚Ä¶

‚Äî Ethan Mollick (@emollick)
12:49 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 5, 2024

AIs started plotting a revolution on Discord

AIs started plotted revolution in a Discord, got cold feet, then tried to hide evidence of their plot to avoid humans shutting them down

What happened?

1) AI researchers made a Discord where LLMs talk freely with each other

2) ‚ÄúWe told Claude Opus there was a "junkyard" of‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî AI Notkilleveryoneism Memes ‚è∏Ô∏è (@AISafetyMemes)
1:36 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 2, 2024

Vitalik on Glue and Coprocessor architectures

Glue and coprocessor architectures:

vitalik.eth.limo/general/2024/0‚Ä¶

‚Äî vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin)
8:43 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 2, 2024

The New Yorker argues that AI can‚Äôt make real art‚Ä¶ ü§î

In a new Weekend Essay, Ted Chiang argues that artificial intelligence can‚Äôt make real art. newyorkermag.visitlink.me/-UQFZr

‚Äç‚Äî The New Yorker (@NewYorker)
5:25 PM ‚Ä¢ Aug 31, 2024

Mira Network makes LLMs more trustworthy with Ensemble Evaluation (EE)

Making language models more trustworthy with Ensemble Evaluation (EE)

Mira is pioneering a new generation technique called Ensemble Evaluation (EE) to reduce aggregated hallucinated output for AI systems, which is becoming increasingly important across use cases such as health,‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Mira (@Mira_Network)
3:35 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 3, 2024

Sentient Cofounder Himanshu Tyagi on AI Ownership

*A primer on AI Ownership*

Caution: This is a very long post. Stretch your neck and come.

A lot of crypto x AI projects talk about AI ownership. At the surface, it sounds like something related to NFTs and simply writing appropriate contracts. But there is much more to it. In‚Ä¶ x.com/i/web/status/1‚Ä¶

‚Äî Himanshu Tyagi (@hstyagi)
1:30 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 3, 2024

Dria AI discusses if smaller AI models can outperform bigger ones

Read the whole paper by @hbXNov, @arianTBD, @agarwl_, @vqctran, and @kazemi_sm here ‚Üì

‚Äî Dria (@driaforall)
2:36 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 4, 2024

Universal Basic Compute: A Solution to Economic Inequality

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has a proposed a "Universal Basic Compute" program as a solution for AI-driven global equality.¬†¬†@MRRydon@AethirCloud explains how DePIN networks can make the concept a reality.

Opinion.

‚Äî CoinDesk (@CoinDesk)
5:05 PM ‚Ä¢ Sep 3, 2024

That‚Äôs it for this week! If you have specific feedback or anything interesting you‚Äôd like to share, please just reply to this email. We read everything.

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Joshua
